Text

[THE MAN WHO WAS THURSDAY A NIGHTMARE

To [Edmund Clerihew Bentley

A]87-edmund clerihew bentley a cloud was on the mind of [men]179-men]178-the man who was thursday a nightmare to edmund clerihew bentley a cloud was on the mind of men , and wailing went the weather , Yea , a sick cloud upon the soul when [we]180-we were [boys together]181-boys together . Science announced nonentity and art admired decay ; [The world]182-the world was old and ended : but [you]183-you and [I]0-i were gay ; Round [us]180-we in antic order [their]179-men crippled vices came Lust that had lost its laughter , fear that had lost its shame . Like the white lock of [Whistler]88-whistler , that lit [our]180-we aimless gloom , [Men]179-men showed [their]179-men own white feather as proudly as a plume . Life was [a fly that faded , and death a drone that stung]185-a fly that faded , and death a drone that stung ; [The world]182-the world was very old indeed when [you]183-you and [I]0-i were young . [They]179-men twisted even decent sin to shapes not to be named : [Men]179-men were ashamed of honour ; but [we]180-we were not ashamed . Weak if [we]180-we were and foolish , not thus [we]180-we failed , not thus ; When that black Baal blocked the heavens [he]188-he had no hymns from [us]180-we Children [we]180-we were [[our]180-we forts of sand]189-our forts of sand were even as weak as [we]180-we , High as [they]189-our forts of sand went [we]180-we piled [them]189-our forts of sand up to break [that bitter sea]190-that bitter sea . [Fools]191-fools as [we]180-we were in motley , all jangling and absurd , When all church bells were silent [our]180-we cap and bells were heard .

Not all unhelped [we]180-we held [the fort]192-the fort , [our]180-we tiny flags unfurled ; [Some giants]193-some giants laboured in that cloud to lift it from [the world]182-the world . [I]0-i find again the book [we]180-we found , [I]0-i feel the hour that flings Far out of fish - shaped Paumanok some cry of cleaner things ; And the Green Carnation withered , as in forest fires that pass , Roared in the wind of all [the world]182-the world ten million leaves of grass ; Or sane and sweet and sudden as a bird sings in the rain Truth out of [Tusitala]1-tusitala spoke and pleasure out of pain . [Yea]196-yea , cool and clear and sudden as a bird sings in the grey , Dunedin to [Samoa]89-samoa spoke , and darkness unto day . But [we]180-we were young ; [we]180-we lived to see [God]90-god break [their]197-their bitter charms . [God]90-god and [the good Republic]198-the good republic come riding back in arms : [We]180-we have seen [the City of Mansoul]199-the city of mansoul , even as [it]199-the city of mansoul rocked , relieved Blessed are [they]197-their who did not see , but being blind , believed .

This is a tale of those old fears , even of those emptied hells , And none but [you]200-you shall understand the true thing that it tells Of what [colossal gods of shame]201-colossal gods of shame could cow [men]179-men and yet crash , Of what huge devils hid the stars , yet fell at a pistol flash . The doubts that were so plain to chase , so dreadful to withstand Oh , who shall understand but [you]200-you ; [yea]196-yea , who shall understand ? The doubts that drove [us]180-we through the night as [we]180-we two talked amain , And day had broken on [the streets]203-the streets e'er it broke upon the brain . Between [us]180-we , by the peace of [God]90-god , such truth can now be told ; [Yea]196-yea , there is strength in striking root and good in growing old . [We]180-we have found common things at last and marriage and a creed , And [I]0-i may safely write it now , and [you]200-you may safely read .

G. K. C.

CHAPTER I. THE TWO POETS OF [SAFFRON PARK]2-saffron park

[The suburb of Saffron Park]204-the suburb of saffron park lay on [the sunset side of [London]3-london]205-the sunset side of london , as red and ragged as a cloud of sunset . [It]204-the suburb of saffron park was built of a bright brick throughout ; [its]204-the suburb of saffron park sky - line was fantastic , and even [its]204-the suburb of saffron park ground plan was wild . [It]204-the suburb of saffron park had been the outburst of [a speculative builder]206-a speculative builder , faintly tinged with art , who called [its]204-the suburb of saffron park architecture sometimes Elizabethan and sometimes [Queen Anne]91-queen anne , apparently under the impression that [the two sovereigns]207-the two sovereigns were identical . [It]204-the suburb of saffron park was described with some justice as [an artistic colony]208-an artistic colony , though [it]204-the suburb of saffron park never in any definable way produced any art . But although [its]204-the suburb of saffron park pretensions to be an intellectual centre were a little vague , [its]204-the suburb of saffron park pretensions to be [a pleasant place]209-a pleasant place were quite indisputable . [The stranger who looked for the first time]210-the stranger who looked for the first time at [the quaint red houses]211-the quaint red houses could only think how very oddly shaped [the people]212-the people must be who could fit in to [them]211-the quaint red houses . Nor when [he]210-the stranger who looked for the first time met [the people]212-the people was [he]210-the stranger who looked for the first time disappointed in this respect . [The place]214-the place was not only pleasant , but perfect , if once [he]210-the stranger who looked for the first time could regard [it]214-the place not as a deception but rather as a dream . Even if [the people]212-the people were not " [artists]2121-artists , "[212-the people] the whole was nevertheless artistic . [That young man with the long , auburn hair and the impudent face that young man]216-that young man with the long , auburn hair and the impudent face that young man was not really [a poet]217-a poet ; but surely [he]216-that young man with the long , auburn hair and the impudent face that young man was [a poem]218-a poem . [That old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat that venerable humbug]219-that old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat that venerable humbug was not really [a philosopher]220-a philosopher ; but at least [he]219-that old gentleman with the wild , white beard and the wild , white hat that venerable humbug was the cause of philosophy in others . [That scientific gentleman with the bald , egg - like head and the bare , bird - like neck]221-that scientific gentleman with the bald , egg - like head and the bare , bird - like neck had no real right to the airs of science that [he]210-the stranger who looked for the first time assumed . [He]210-the stranger who looked for the first time had not discovered anything new in biology ; but what biological creature could [he]210-the stranger who looked for the first time have discovered more singular than [himself]210-the stranger who looked for the first time ? Thus , and thus only , [the whole place]222-the whole place had properly to be regarded ; [it]222-the whole place had to be considered not so much as a workshop for [artists]2121-artists , but as a frail but finished work of art . [A man who stepped into [its]222-the whole place social atmosphere]224-a man who stepped into its social atmosphere felt as if [he]224-a man who stepped into its social atmosphere had stepped into a written comedy .

More especially this attractive unreality fell upon it about nightfall , when the extravagant roofs were dark against the afterglow and [the whole insane village]225-the whole insane village seemed as separate as a drifting cloud . This again was more strongly true of the many nights of local festivity , when [the little gardens]226-the little gardens were often illuminated , and the big Chinese lanterns glowed in the dwarfish trees like some fierce and monstrous fruit . And this was strongest of all on one particular evening , still vaguely remembered in [the locality]227-the locality , of which [the auburn - haired poet]228-the auburn - haired poet was [the hero]229-the hero . It was not by any means the only evening of which [he]228-the auburn - haired poet was [the hero]229-the hero . On many nights [those passing by [[his]228-the auburn - haired poet little back garden]232-his little back garden]231-those passing by his little back garden might hear [his]228-the auburn - haired poet high , didactic voice laying down the law to [men]179-men and particularly to [women]234-women . The attitude of [women]234-women in such cases was indeed one of the paradoxes of [the place]214-the place . [Most of [the women]238-the women]237-most of the women were of the kind vaguely called emancipated , and professed some protest against male supremacy . Yet [these new women]239-these new women would always pay to [a man]240-a man the extravagant compliment which [no ordinary woman]241-no ordinary woman ever pays to [him]240-a man , that of listening while [he]240-a man is talking . And [Mr. Lucian Gregory]92-mr. lucian gregory , [the red - haired poet]242-the red - haired poet , was really ( in some sense ) [a man worth listening to]243-a man worth listening to , even if [one]244-one only laughed at the end of it . [He]92-mr. lucian gregory put the old ca nt of the lawlessness of art and the art of lawlessness with a certain impudent freshness which gave at least a momentary pleasure . [He]228-the auburn - haired poet was helped in some degree by the arresting oddity of [his]228-the auburn - haired poet appearance , which [he]228-the auburn - haired poet worked , as the phrase goes , for all it was worth . [His]228-the auburn - haired poet dark red hair parted in the middle was literally like [a woman]245-a woman 's , and curved into the slow curls of [a virgin in a pre - Raphaelite picture]246-a virgin in a pre - raphaelite picture . From within this almost saintly oval , however , [his]228-the auburn - haired poet face projected suddenly broad and brutal , the chin carried forward with a look of cockney contempt . This combination at once tickled and terrified the nerves of [a neurotic population]247-a neurotic population . [He]228-the auburn - haired poet seemed like a walking blasphemy , a blend of [the angel]248-the angel and the ape .

This particular evening , if it is remembered for nothing else , will be remembered in [that place]249-that place for [its]249-that place strange sunset . [It]249-that place looked like the end of [the world]182-the world . [All the heaven]251-all the heaven seemed covered with a quite vivid and palpable plumage ; [you]252-you could only say that the sky was full of feathers , and of feathers that almost brushed the face . Across the great part of the dome they were grey , with the strangest tints of violet and mauve and an unnatural pink or pale green ; but towards the west the whole grew past description , transparent and passionate , and the last red - hot plumes of it covered up the sun like something too good to be seen . The whole was so close about [the earth]253-the earth , as to express nothing but a violent secrecy . The very empyrean seemed to be a secret . It expressed that splendid smallness which is the soul of local patriotism . The very sky seemed small .

[I]0-i say that there are [some inhabitants who may remember the evening if only by that oppressive sky]254-some inhabitants who may remember the evening if only by that oppressive sky . There are [others who may remember it]255-others who may remember it because it marked the first appearance in the place of [the second poet of [Saffron Park]2-saffron park]256-the second poet of saffron park . For a long time [the red - haired revolutionary]257-the red - haired revolutionary had reigned without [a rival]258-a rival ; it was upon the night of the sunset that [his]228-the auburn - haired poet solitude suddenly ended . [The new poet]259-the new poet , who introduced [himself]259-the new poet by the name of [Gabriel Syme]93-syme was [a very mild - looking mortal , with a fair , pointed beard and faint , yellow hair]260-a very mild - looking mortal , with a fair , pointed beard and faint , yellow hair . But an impression grew that [he]259-the new poet was less meek than [he]259-the new poet looked . [He]259-the new poet signalised [his]259-the new poet entrance by differing with [the established poet]261-the established poet , [Gregory]92-mr. lucian gregory , upon the whole nature of poetry . [He]259-the new poet said that [he]259-the new poet ( [Syme]93-syme ) was [poet of law]262-poet of law , [a poet of order]263-a poet of order ; nay , [he]259-the new poet said [he]259-the new poet was [a poet of respectability]264-a poet of respectability . So all [the Saffron Parkers]94-the saffron parkers looked at [him]259-the new poet as if [he]259-the new poet had that moment fallen out of that impossible sky .

In fact , [Mr. Lucian Gregory]92-mr. lucian gregory , [the anarchic poet]265-the anarchic poet , connected the two events .

" It may well be , "[92-mr. lucian gregory] [he]92-mr. lucian gregory said , in [his]92-mr. lucian gregory sudden lyrical manner , " it may well be on such a night of clouds and cruel colours that there is brought forth upon [the earth]253-the earth such a portent as [a respectable poet]2123-a respectable poet . [You]266-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard say [you]266-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard are [a poet of law]2124-a poet of law ; [I]92-mr. lucian gregory say [you]266-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard are a contradiction in terms . [I]92-mr. lucian gregory only wonder there were not comets and earthquakes on the night [you]266-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard appeared in [this garden]2125-this garden . "[92-mr. lucian gregory]

[The man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard]266-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard endured these thunders with a certain submissive solemnity . [The third party of [the group]268-the group]267-the third party of the group , [[Gregory]92-mr. lucian gregory 's sister [Rosamond]95-gregory , who had [[her]269-gregory 's sister rosamond , who had her brother 's braids of red hair , but a kindlier face underneath them brother]270-her brother 's braids of red hair , but a kindlier face underneath [them]271-them]269-gregory 's sister rosamond , who had her brother 's braids of red hair , but a kindlier face underneath them , laughed with such mixture of admiration and disapproval as [she]269-gregory 's sister rosamond , who had her brother 's braids of red hair , but a kindlier face underneath them gave commonly to [the family oracle]272-the family oracle .

[Gregory]95-gregory resumed in high oratorical good humour .

" [An artist]2126-an artist is identical with [an anarchist]2127-an anarchist , "[95-gregory] [he]95-gregory cried . " [You]266-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard might transpose the words anywhere . [An anarchist]2127-an anarchist is [an artist]2126-an artist . [The man who throws a bomb]2130-the man who throws a bomb is [an artist]2126-an artist , because [he]2130-the man who throws a bomb prefers a great moment to everything . [He]2130-the man who throws a bomb sees how much more valuable is one burst of blazing light , one peal of perfect thunder , than the mere common bodies of [a few shapeless policemen]2132-a few shapeless policemen . [An artist]2126-an artist disregards all governments , abolishes all conventions . [The poet]2134-the poet delights in disorder only . If it were not so , the most poetical thing in [the world]182-the world would be [the Underground Railway]4-the underground railway . "[95-gregory]

" So it is , "[93-syme] said [Mr. Syme]93-syme .

" Nonsense ! "[95-gregory] said [Gregory]95-gregory , who was very rational when [anyone else attempted paradox]273-anyone else attempted paradox . " Why do [all [the clerks]2137-the clerks and navvies in [the railway trains]2138-the railway trains]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains look so sad and tired , so very sad and tired ? [I]95-gregory will tell [you]266-the man with the meek blue eyes and the pale , pointed beard . It is because [they]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains know that [the train]2139-the train is going right . It is because [they]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains know that whatever place [they]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains have taken a ticket for that place [they]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains will reach . It is because after [they]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains have passed [Sloane Square]2140-sloane square [they]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains know that [the next station]2141-the next station must be [Victoria]96-victoria , and nothing but [Victoria]96-victoria . Oh , [their]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains wild rapture ! oh , [their]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains eyes like stars and [their]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains souls again in [Eden]6-eden , if [the next station]2141-the next station were unaccountably [Baker Street]7-baker street ! "[95-gregory]

" It is [you]93-syme who are unpoetical , "[93-syme] replied [the poet]2134-the poet [Syme]93-syme . " If what [you]93-syme say of clerks is true , [they]2136-all the clerks and navvies in the railway trains can only be as prosaic as [your]93-syme poetry . The rare , strange thing is to hit the mark ; the gross , obvious thing is to miss it . [We]2143-we feel it is epical when [man with one wild arrow strikes a distant bird]2144-man with one wild arrow strikes a distant bird . Is it not also epical when [man with one wild engine]2145-man with one wild engine strikes [a distant station]2146-a distant station ? Chaos is dull ; because in chaos [the train]2139-the train might indeed go anywhere , to [Baker Street]7-baker street or to [Bagdad]8-bagdad . But [man]2148-man is [a magician]2149-a magician , and [his]2148-man whole magic is in this , that [he]2148-man does say [Victoria]96-victoria , and lo ! it is [Victoria]96-victoria . No , take [your]93-syme books of mere poetry and prose ; let [me]93-syme read a time table , with tears of pride . Take [[your]93-syme Byron , who commemorates the defeats of [man]2148-man]2150-your byron , who commemorates the defeats of man ; give [me]93-syme [Bradshaw]97-bradshaw , who commemorates [his]97-bradshaw victories . Give [me]93-syme [Bradshaw]97-bradshaw , [I]93-syme say ! "[93-syme]

" Must [you]93-syme go ? "[95-gregory] inquired [Gregory]95-gregory sarcastically .

" [I]93-syme tell [you]93-syme , "[93-syme] went on [Syme]93-syme with passion , " that every time [a train]2152-a train comes in [I]93-syme feel that it has broken past batteries of [besiegers]2153-besiegers , and that [man]2148-man has won a battle against chaos . [You]93-syme say contemptuously that when one has left [Sloane Square]9-sloane square one must come to [Victoria]96-victoria . [I]93-syme say that one might do a thousand things instead , and that whenever [I]93-syme really come [there]2155-there [I]93-syme have the sense of hairbreadth escape . And when [I]93-syme hear [the guard]2156-the guard shout out the word [Victoria]96-victoria , ' it is not an unmeaning word . It is to [me]93-syme the cry of [a herald announcing conquest]2157-a herald announcing conquest . It is to [me]93-syme indeed [Victoria]96-victoria ' ; it is the victory of [Adam]98-adam . "[93-syme]

[Gregory]95-gregory wagged [his]95-gregory heavy , red head with a slow and sad smile .

" And even then , "[95-gregory] [he]95-gregory said , " [we]2158-we poets always ask the question , And what is [Victoria]96-victoria now that [you]93-syme have got [there]2155-there ? ' [You]93-syme think [Victoria]96-victoria is like [the New Jerusalem]2160-the new jerusalem . [We]2158-we know that [the New Jerusalem]2160-the new jerusalem will only be like [Victoria]96-victoria . Yes , [the poet]2134-the poet will be discontented even in [the streets of heaven]2163-the streets of heaven . [The poet]2134-the poet is always in revolt . "[95-gregory]

" There again , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme irritably , " what is there poetical about being in revolt ? [You]93-syme might as well say that it is poetical to be sea - sick . Being sick is a revolt . Both being sick and being rebellious may be the wholesome thing on certain desperate occasions ; but [I]93-syme 'm hanged if [I]93-syme can see why they are poetical . Revolt in the abstract is revolting . It 's mere vomiting . "[93-syme]

[The girl]275-the girl winced for a flash at the unpleasant word , but [Syme]93-syme was too hot to heed [her]275-the girl .

" It is things going right , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme cried , " that is poetical ! [Our]2158-we digestions , for instance , going sacredly and silently right , that is the foundation of all poetry . Yes , the most poetical thing , more poetical than the flowers , more poetical than the stars the most poetical thing in [the world]182-the world is not being sick . "[93-syme]

" Really , "[95-gregory] said [Gregory]95-gregory superciliously , " the examples [you]93-syme choose "[95-gregory]

" [I]93-syme beg [your]95-gregory pardon , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme grimly , " [I]93-syme forgot [we]2158-we had abolished all conventions . "[93-syme]

For the first time a red patch appeared on [Gregory]95-gregory 's forehead .

" [You]93-syme do n't expect [me]95-gregory , "[95-gregory] [he]95-gregory said , " to revolutionise society on this lawn ? "[95-gregory]

[Syme]93-syme looked straight into [his]95-gregory eyes and smiled sweetly .

" No , [I]93-syme do n't , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said ; " but [I]93-syme suppose that if [you]93-syme were serious about [your]93-syme anarchism , that is exactly what [you]93-syme would do . "[93-syme]

[Gregory]95-gregory 's big bull 's eyes blinked suddenly like those of an angry lion , and [one]244-one could almost fancy that [his]95-gregory red mane rose .

" Do n't [you]93-syme think , then , "[95-gregory] [he]95-gregory said in a dangerous voice , " that [I]95-gregory am serious about [my]95-gregory anarchism ? "[95-gregory]

" [I]93-syme beg [your]93-syme pardon ? "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme .

" Am [I]95-gregory not serious about [my]95-gregory anarchism ? "[95-gregory] cried [Gregory]95-gregory , with knotted fists .

" [[My]93-syme dear fellow]2166-my dear fellow ! "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , and strolled away .

With surprise , but with a curious pleasure , [he]95-gregory found [Rosamond Gregory]95-gregory still in [his]95-gregory company .

" [Mr. Syme]93-syme , "[277-she] [she]277-she said , " do [the people who talk like [you]93-syme and [[my]277-she brother]2168-my brother]2167-the people who talk like you and my brother often mean what [they]2167-the people who talk like you and my brother say ? Do [you]93-syme mean what [you]93-syme say now ? "[277-she]

[Syme]93-syme smiled .

" Do [you]275-the girl ? "[95-gregory] [he]95-gregory asked .

" What do [you]93-syme mean ? "[275-the girl] asked [the girl]275-the girl , with grave eyes .

" [[My]93-syme dear]2169-my dear [Miss Gregory]112-gregory , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme gently , " there are many kinds of sincerity and insincerity . When [you]112-gregory say thank [you]112-gregory ' for the salt , do [you]112-gregory mean what [you]112-gregory say ? No . When [you]112-gregory say [the world]182-the world is round , ' do [you]112-gregory mean what [you]112-gregory say ? No . It is true , but [you]112-gregory do n't mean it . Now , sometimes [a man like [[your]112-gregory brother]2172-your brother]2171-a man like your brother really finds a thing [he]2171-a man like your brother does mean . "[93-syme]

[She]275-the girl was looking at [him]93-syme from under level brows ; [her]275-the girl face was grave and open , and there had fallen upon it the shadow of that unreasoning responsibility which is at the bottom of [the most frivolous woman]279-the most frivolous woman , the maternal watch which is as old as [the world]182-the world .

" Is [he]93-syme really [an anarchist]2127-an anarchist , then ? "[275-the girl] [she]275-the girl asked .

" Only in that sense [I]93-syme speak of , "[93-syme] replied [Syme]93-syme ; " or if [you]275-the girl prefer it , in that nonsense . "[93-syme]

[She]275-the girl drew [her]275-the girl broad brows together and said abruptly

" [He]93-syme would n't really use bombs or that sort of thing ? "[275-the girl]

[Syme]93-syme broke into a great laugh , that seemed too large for [his]93-syme slight and somewhat dandified figure .

" [Good Lord]2174-good lord , no ! "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said , " that has to be done anonymously . "[93-syme]

And at that the corners of [her]275-the girl own mouth broke into a smile , and [she]275-the girl thought with a simultaneous pleasure of [Gregory]112-gregory 's absurdity and of [his]93-syme safety .

[Syme]93-syme strolled with [her]275-the girl to a seat in the corner of [the garden]281-the garden , and continued to pour out [his]93-syme opinions . For [he]93-syme was [a sincere man]282-a sincere man , and in spite of [his]93-syme superficial airs and graces , at root [a humble one]283-a humble one . And it is always [the humble man who talks too much]284-the humble man who talks too much ; [the proud man]285-the proud man watches [himself]93-syme too closely . [He]93-syme defended respectability with violence and exaggeration . [He]93-syme grew passionate in [his]93-syme praise of tidiness and propriety . All the time there was a smell of lilac all round [him]93-syme . Once [he]93-syme heard very faintly in [some distant street]286-some distant street a barrel - organ begin to play , and it seemed to [him]93-syme that [his]93-syme heroic words were moving to a tiny tune from under or beyond [the world]182-the world .

[He]93-syme stared and talked at [the girl]275-the girl 's red hair and amused face for what seemed to be a few minutes ; and then , feeling that [the groups in such a place]289-the groups in such a place should mix , rose to [his]93-syme feet . To [his]93-syme astonishment , [he]93-syme discovered [the whole garden]290-the whole garden empty . [Everyone]291-everyone had gone long ago , and [he]93-syme went [himself]93-syme with a rather hurried apology . [He]93-syme left with a sense of champagne in [his]93-syme head , which [he]93-syme could not afterwards explain . In the wild events which were to follow [this girl]292-this girl had no part at all ; [he]93-syme never saw [her]292-this girl again until all [his]93-syme tale was over . And yet , in some indescribable way , [she]292-this girl kept recurring like a motive in music through all [his]93-syme mad adventures afterwards , and the glory of [her]292-this girl strange hair ran like a red thread through those dark and ill - drawn tapestries of the night . For what followed was so improbable , that it might well have been a dream .

When [Syme]93-syme went out into [the starlit street]293-the starlit street , [he]93-syme found [it]293-the starlit street for the moment empty . Then [he]93-syme realised ( in some odd way ) that the silence was rather a living silence than a dead one . Directly outside the door stood a street lamp , whose gleam gilded the leaves of the tree that bent out over the fence behind [him]93-syme . About a foot from the lamp - post stood [a figure almost as rigid and motionless as the lamp - post itself]294-a figure almost as rigid and motionless as the lamp - post itself . The tall hat and long frock coat were black ; the face , in an abrupt shadow , was almost as dark . Only a fringe of fiery hair against the light , and also something aggressive in the attitude , proclaimed that it was the poet [Gregory]112-gregory . [He]93-syme had something of the look of [a masked bravo waiting sword in hand for [[his]93-syme foe]296-his foe]295-a masked bravo waiting sword in hand for his foe .

[He]93-syme made a sort of doubtful salute , which [Syme]297-syme somewhat more formally returned .

" [I]112-gregory was waiting for [you]297-syme , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory . " Might [I]112-gregory have a moment 's conversation ? "[112-gregory]

" Certainly . About what ? "[93-syme] asked [Syme]93-syme in a sort of weak wonder .

[Gregory]112-gregory struck out with [his]93-syme stick at the lamp - post , and then at the tree .

" About _ this _ and _ this _ , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme cried ; " about order and anarchy . There is [your]297-syme precious order , that lean , iron lamp , ugly and barren ; and there is anarchy , rich , living , reproducing itself there is anarchy , splendid in green and gold . "[93-syme]

" All the same , "[93-syme] replied [Syme]93-syme patiently , " just at present [you]112-gregory only see the tree by the light of the lamp . [I]93-syme wonder when [you]112-gregory would ever see the lamp by the light of the tree . "[93-syme] Then after a pause [he]93-syme said , " But may [I]93-syme ask if [you]93-syme have been standing out here in the dark only to resume [our]2175-our little argument ? "[93-syme]

" No , "[112-gregory] cried out [Gregory]112-gregory , in a voice that rang down [the street]298-the street , " [I]112-gregory did not stand here to resume [our]2175-our argument , but to end it for ever . "[112-gregory]

The silence fell again , and [Syme]93-syme , though [he]93-syme understood nothing , listened instinctively for something serious . [Gregory]112-gregory began in a smooth voice and with a rather bewildering smile .

" [Mr. Syme]93-syme , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said , " this evening [you]93-syme succeeded in doing something rather remarkable . [You]93-syme did something to [me]93-syme that [no man born of woman]2176-no man born of woman has ever succeeded in doing before . "[93-syme]

" Indeed ! "[112-gregory]

" Now [I]112-gregory remember , "[112-gregory] resumed [Gregory]112-gregory reflectively , " [one other person]2177-one other person succeeded in doing it . [The captain of [a penny steamer]2179-a penny steamer]2178-the captain of a penny steamer ( if [I]112-gregory remember correctly ) at [Southend]10-southend . [You]93-syme have irritated [me]112-gregory . "[112-gregory]

" [I]93-syme am very sorry , "[93-syme] replied [Syme]93-syme with gravity .

" [I]112-gregory am afraid [my]112-gregory fury and [your]93-syme insult are too shocking to be wiped out even with an apology , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory very calmly . " [No duel]2180-no duel could wipe it out . If [I]112-gregory struck [you]93-syme dead [I]112-gregory could not wipe it out . [I]112-gregory am going , at the possible sacrifice of [my]112-gregory life and honour , to _ prove _ to [you]93-syme that [you]93-syme were wrong in what [you]93-syme said . "[112-gregory]

" In what [I]93-syme said ? "[93-syme]

" [You]93-syme said [I]112-gregory was not serious about being [an anarchist]2127-an anarchist . "[112-gregory]

" [I]93-syme have never doubted that [you]112-gregory were perfectly sincere in this sense , that [you]112-gregory thought what [you]112-gregory said well worth saying , that [you]112-gregory thought a paradox might wake [men]179-men up to a neglected truth . "[93-syme]

[Gregory]112-gregory stared at [him]93-syme steadily and painfully .

" And in no other sense , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme asked , " [you]93-syme think [me]93-syme serious ? [You]93-syme think [me]93-syme a _ fl neur _ who lets fall occasional truths . [You]93-syme do not think that in a deeper , a more deadly sense , [I]93-syme am serious . "[93-syme]

[Syme]93-syme struck [his]93-syme stick violently on the stones of [the road]299-the road .

" Very well , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory , [his]93-syme face darkening , " [you]93-syme shall see something more serious than either drink or religion . "[112-gregory]

[Syme]93-syme stood waiting with [his]93-syme usual air of mildness until [Gregory]112-gregory again opened [his]93-syme lips .

" [You]93-syme spoke just now of having a religion . Is it really true that [you]93-syme have one ? "[93-syme]

" Oh , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme with a beaming smile , " [we]2188-we are [all Catholics]2189-all catholics now . "[93-syme]

" Then may [I]93-syme ask [you]112-gregory to swear by whatever [gods]2190-gods or [saints]2191-saints [your]112-gregory religion involves that [you]112-gregory will not reveal what [I]93-syme am now going to tell [you]112-gregory to [any son of [Adam]98-adam]2192-any son of adam , and especially not to [the police]2193-the police ? Will [you]112-gregory swear that ! " [You]93-syme will promise [me]93-syme in return ? "[93-syme] inquired [Syme]93-syme , as [the other]300-the other paused .

" [I]93-syme will promise [you]112-gregory a very entertaining evening . "[93-syme] [Syme]93-syme suddenly took off [his]93-syme hat .

" [Your]112-gregory offer , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said , " is far too idiotic to be declined . [You]112-gregory say that [a poet]217-a poet is always [an anarchist]2127-an anarchist . And now , in the name of [Colney Hatch]100-colney hatch , what is it ? "[93-syme]

" [I]112-gregory think , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory , with placid irrelevancy , " that [we]302-the two will call [a cab]2201-a cab . "[112-gregory]

[He]93-syme gave two long whistles , and a hansom came rattling down [the road]299-the road . [The two]302-the two got into [it]303-it in silence . CHAPTER II . THE SECRET OF [GABRIEL SYME]93-syme

[The cab]306-the cab pulled up before [a particularly dreary and greasy beershop]310-a particularly dreary and greasy beershop , into which [Gregory]112-gregory rapidly conducted [[his]93-syme companion]311-his companion . [They]302-the two seated [themselves]302-the two in [a close and dim sort of bar - parlour]312-a close and dim sort of bar - parlour , at a stained wooden table with one wooden leg . [The room]313-the room was so small and dark , that very little could be seen of [the attendant who was summoned , beyond a vague and dark impression of something bulky and bearded]314-the attendant who was summoned , beyond a vague and dark impression of something bulky and bearded .

" Will [you]315-the man take a little supper ? "[112-gregory] asked [Gregory]112-gregory politely . " The _ p t de foie gras _ is not good [here]2202-here , but [I]112-gregory can recommend the game . "[112-gregory]

[Syme]93-syme received the remark with stolidity , imagining it to be a joke . Accepting the vein of humour , [he]93-syme said , with a well - bred indifference

" Oh , bring [me]93-syme some lobster mayonnaise . "[93-syme]

To [his]93-syme indescribable astonishment , [the man]315-the man only said " Certainly , [sir]2203-sir ! "[315-the man] and went away apparently to get it .

" What will [you]315-the man drink ? "[112-gregory] resumed [Gregory]112-gregory , with the same careless yet apologetic air . " [I]112-gregory shall only have a _ cr [me]112-gregory de menthe _ [myself]112-gregory ; [I]112-gregory have dined . But the champagne can really be trusted . Do let [me]112-gregory start [you]315-the man with a half - bottle of Pommery at least ? "[112-gregory]

" Thank [you]93-syme ! "[93-syme] said [the motionless Syme]93-syme . " [You]93-syme are very good . "[93-syme]

[His]93-syme further attempts at conversation , somewhat disorganised in themselves , were cut short finally as by a thunderbolt by the actual appearance of the lobster . [Syme]93-syme tasted it , and found it particularly good . Then [he]93-syme suddenly began to eat with great rapidity and appetite .

" Excuse [me]93-syme if [I]93-syme enjoy [myself]93-syme rather obviously ! "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said to [Gregory]112-gregory , smiling . " [I]93-syme do n't often have the luck to have a dream like this . It is new to [me]93-syme for a nightmare to lead to a lobster . It is commonly the other way . "[93-syme]

" [You]315-the man are not asleep , [I]112-gregory assure [you]315-the man , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory . " [You]315-the man are , on the contrary , close to the most actual and rousing moment of [your]315-the man existence . Ah , here comes [your]315-the man champagne ! [I]112-gregory admit that there may be a slight disproportion , let [us]2204-we say , between the inner arrangements of [this excellent hotel]2205-this excellent hotel and [its]2205-this excellent hotel simple and unpretentious exterior . But that is all [our]2204-we modesty . [We]2204-we are [the most modest men that ever lived on [earth]2207-earth]2206-the most modest men that ever lived on earth . "[112-gregory]

" And who are _ [we]2204-we ? _ "[93-syme] asked [Syme]93-syme , emptying [his]93-syme champagne glass .

" It is quite simple , "[112-gregory] replied [Gregory]112-gregory . " _ [We]2204-we _ are [the serious anarchists , in whom [you]315-the man do not believe]2208-the serious anarchists , in whom you do not believe . "[112-gregory]

" Oh ! "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme shortly . " [You]315-the man do [yourselves]315-the man well in drinks . "[93-syme]

" Yes , [we]2204-we are serious about everything , "[112-gregory] answered [Gregory]112-gregory .

Then after a pause [he]93-syme added

" If in a few moments this table begins to turn round a little , do n't put it down to [your]315-the man inroads into the champagne . [I]93-syme do n't wish [you]315-the man to do [yourself]315-the man an injustice . "[93-syme]

" Well , if [I]93-syme am not drunk , [I]93-syme am mad , "[93-syme] replied [Syme]93-syme with perfect calm ; " but [I]93-syme trust [I]93-syme can behave like [a gentleman]2209-a gentleman in either condition . May [I]93-syme smoke ? "[93-syme]

" Certainly ! "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory , producing a cigar - case . " Try one of [mine]112-gregory . "[93-syme]

[Syme]93-syme took the cigar , clipped the end off with a cigar - cutter out of [his]93-syme waistcoat pocket , put it in [his]93-syme mouth , lit it slowly , and let out a long cloud of smoke . It is not a little to [his]93-syme credit that [he]93-syme performed these rites with so much composure , for almost before [he]93-syme had begun [them]316-them the table at which [he]93-syme sat had begun to revolve , first slowly , and then rapidly , as if at an insane seance .

" [You]112-gregory must not mind it , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory ; " it 's a kind of screw . "[112-gregory]

" Quite so , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme placidly , " a kind of screw . How simple that is ! "[93-syme]

The next moment the smoke of [his]93-syme cigar , which had been wavering across [the room]313-the room in snaky twists , went straight up as if from a factory chimney , and [the two]302-the two , with [their]302-the two chairs and table , shot down through the floor as if the earth had swallowed [them]302-the two . [They]302-the two went rattling down a kind of roaring chimney as rapidly as a lift cut loose , and [they]302-the two came with an abrupt bump to the bottom . But when [Gregory]112-gregory threw open a pair of doors and let in a red subterranean light , [Syme]93-syme was still smoking with one leg thrown over the other , and had not turned a yellow hair .

[Gregory]112-gregory led [him]93-syme down [a low , vaulted passage]319-a low , vaulted passage , at the end of which was the red light . It was an enormous crimson lantern , nearly as big as a fireplace , fixed over a small but heavy iron door . In the door there was a sort of hatchway or grating , and on this [Gregory]112-gregory struck five times . A heavy voice with a foreign accent asked [him]93-syme who [he]93-syme was . To this [he]93-syme gave the more or less unexpected reply , " [Mr. Joseph Chamberlain]101-mr. joseph chamberlain . "[93-syme] The heavy hinges began to move ; it was obviously some kind of password .

Inside the doorway [the passage]320-the passage gleamed as if [it]320-the passage were lined with a network of steel . On a second glance , [Syme]93-syme saw that the glittering pattern was really made up of ranks and ranks of rifles and revolvers , closely packed or interlocked .

" [I]112-gregory must ask [you]93-syme to forgive [me]112-gregory all these formalities , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory ; " [we]322-we have to be very strict here . "[112-gregory]

" Oh , do n't apologise , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme . " [I]93-syme know [your]93-syme passion for law and order , "[93-syme] and [he]93-syme stepped into [the passage lined with the steel weapons]321-the passage lined with the steel weapons . With [his]93-syme long , fair hair and rather foppish frock - coat , [he]93-syme looked a singularly frail and fanciful figure as [he]93-syme walked down that shining avenue of death .

[They]322-we passed through [several such passages]323-several such passages , and came out at last into [a queer steel chamber with curved walls , almost spherical in shape , but presenting , with [its]324-a queer steel chamber with curved walls , almost spherical in shape , but presenting , with its tiers of benches , something of the appearance of a scientific lecture - theatre tiers of benches , something of the appearance of a scientific lecture - theatre]324-a queer steel chamber with curved walls , almost spherical in shape , but presenting , with its tiers of benches , something of the appearance of a scientific lecture - theatre . There were no rifles or pistols in [this apartment]325-this apartment , but round the walls of [it]325-this apartment were hung more dubious and dreadful shapes , things that looked like the bulbs of iron plants , or the eggs of iron birds . They were bombs , and [the very room]326-the very room itself seemed like the inside of a bomb . [Syme]93-syme knocked [his]93-syme cigar ash off against the wall , and went in .

" And now , [[my]112-gregory dear]2169-my dear [Mr. Syme]93-syme , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory , throwing [himself]112-gregory in an expansive manner on the bench under the largest bomb , " now [we]322-we are quite cosy , so let [us]322-we talk properly . Now no human words can give [you]2169-my dear any notion of why [I]112-gregory brought [you]2169-my dear [here]2202-here . It was one of those quite arbitrary emotions , like jumping off a cliff or falling in love . Suffice it to say that [you]2169-my dear were [an inexpressibly irritating fellow]2212-an inexpressibly irritating fellow , and , to do [you]2169-my dear justice , [you]2169-my dear are still . [I]112-gregory would break twenty oaths of secrecy for the pleasure of taking [you]2169-my dear down a peg . That way [you]2169-my dear have of lighting a cigar would make [a priest]2213-a priest break the seal of confession . Well , [you]2169-my dear said that [you]2169-my dear were quite certain [I]112-gregory was not [a serious anarchist]2214-a serious anarchist . Does this place strike [you]2169-my dear as being serious ? "[112-gregory]

" It does seem to have a moral under all its gaiety , "[93-syme] assented [Syme]93-syme ; " but may [I]93-syme ask [you]2169-my dear two questions ? [You]2169-my dear need not fear to give [me]93-syme information , because , as [you]2169-my dear remember , [you]2169-my dear very wisely extorted from [me]93-syme a promise not to tell [the police]2193-the police , a promise [I]93-syme shall certainly keep . So it is in mere curiosity that [I]93-syme make [my]93-syme queries . First of all , what is it really all about ? What is it [you]2169-my dear object to ? [You]2169-my dear want to abolish Government ? "[93-syme]

" To abolish [God]90-god ! "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory , opening the eyes of [a fanatic]327-a fanatic . " [We]2216-we do not only want to upset a few despotisms and police regulations ; that sort of anarchism does exist , but it is a mere branch of [the Nonconformists]2217-the nonconformists . [We]2216-we dig deeper and [we]2216-we blow [you]2169-my dear higher . [We]2216-we wish to deny all those arbitrary distinctions of vice and virtue , honour and treachery , upon which [mere rebels]2218-mere rebels base [themselves]2218-mere rebels . [The silly sentimentalists of the French Revolution]2219-the silly sentimentalists of the french revolution talked of the Rights of [Man]102-thursday ! [We]2216-we hate Rights as [we]2216-we hate Wrongs . [We]2216-we have abolished Right and Wrong . "[112-gregory]

" And Right and Left , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme with a simple eagerness , " [I]93-syme hope [you]112-gregory will abolish [them]2220-them too . [They]2220-them are much more troublesome to [me]93-syme . "[93-syme]

" [You]93-syme spoke of a second question , "[112-gregory] snapped [Gregory]112-gregory .

" With pleasure , "[93-syme] resumed [Syme]93-syme . " In all [your]2169-my dear present acts and surroundings there is a scientific attempt at secrecy . [I]93-syme have [an aunt]2221-an aunt who lived over [a shop]2222-a shop , but this is the first time [I]93-syme have found [people]2223-people living from preference under [a public - house]2224-a public - house . [You]2169-my dear have a heavy iron door . [You]2169-my dear can not pass it without submitting to the humiliation of calling [yourself]2169-my dear [Mr. Chamberlain]101-mr. joseph chamberlain . [You]2169-my dear surround [yourself]2169-my dear with steel instruments which make [the place]214-the place , if [I]93-syme may say so , more impressive than [homelike]2226-homelike . May [I]93-syme ask why , after taking all this trouble to barricade [yourselves]2169-my dear in [the bowels of [the earth]253-the earth]2227-the bowels of the earth , [you]2169-my dear then parade [your]2169-my dear whole secret by talking about anarchism to [every silly woman in [Saffron Park]2-saffron park]2229-every silly woman in saffron park ? "[93-syme]

[Gregory]112-gregory smiled .

" The answer is simple , "[328-i] [he]328-i said . " [I]328-i told [you]2169-my dear [I]328-i was [a serious anarchist]2214-a serious anarchist , and [you]2169-my dear did not believe [me]328-i . Nor do _ [they]2169-my dear _ believe [me]328-i . Unless [I]328-i took [them]2169-my dear into [this infernal room]2231-this infernal room [they]2169-my dear would not believe [me]328-i . "[328-i]

[Syme]93-syme smoked thoughtfully , and looked at [him]328-i with interest . [Gregory]112-gregory went on .

" The history of the thing might amuse [you]2169-my dear , "[328-i] [he]328-i said . " When first [I]328-i became one of [the New Anarchists]2232-the new anarchists [I]328-i tried all kinds of respectable disguises . [I]328-i dressed up as [a bishop]2233-a bishop . [I]328-i read up all about [bishops]2234-bishops in [our]2235-our anarchist pamphlets , in _ Superstition [the Vampire _ and _ Priests of Prey _]2236-the vampire _ and _ priests of prey _ . [I]328-i certainly understood from [them]2236-the vampire _ and _ priests of prey _ that [bishops]2234-bishops are strange and [terrible old men]2238-terrible old men keeping a cruel secret from [mankind]2239-mankind . [I]328-i was misinformed . When on [my]328-i first appearing in episcopal gaiters in [a drawing - room]2240-a drawing - room [I]328-i cried out in a voice of thunder , Down ! down ! presumptuous human reason ! ' [they]2236-the vampire _ and _ priests of prey _ found out in some way that [I]328-i was not [a bishop]2233-a bishop at all . [I]328-i was nabbed at once . Then [I]328-i made up as [a millionaire]2242-a millionaire ; but [I]328-i defended [Capital]12-capital with so much intelligence that [a fool]2243-a fool could see that [I]328-i was quite poor . Then [I]328-i tried being [a major]2244-a major . Now [I]328-i am [a humanitarian]2245-a humanitarian [myself]328-i , but [I]328-i have , [I]328-i hope , enough intellectual breadth to understand the position of those who , like [Nietzsche]103-nietzsche , admire violence the proud , mad war of Nature and all that , [you]2246-you know . [I]328-i threw [myself]328-i into the major . [I]328-i drew [my]328-i sword and waved it constantly . [I]328-i called out Blood ! ' abstractedly , like [a man calling for wine]2247-a man calling for wine . [I]328-i often said , Let [the weak]2248-the weak perish ; it is the Law . ' Well , well , it seems majors do n't do this . [I]328-i was nabbed again . At last [I]328-i went in despair to [the President of [the Central Anarchist Council]2250-the central anarchist council , who is [the greatest man in [Europe]13-europe]2251-the greatest man in europe]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe . "[328-i]

" What is [his]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe name ? "[93-syme] asked [Syme]93-syme .

" [You]112-gregory would not know it , "[112-gregory] answered [Gregory]112-gregory . " That is [his]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe greatness . [Caesar]104-caesar and [Napoleon]105-napoleon put all [their]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe genius into being heard of , and [they]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe _ were _ heard of . [He]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe puts all [his]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe genius into not being heard of , and [he]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe is not heard of . But [you]112-gregory can not be for five minutes in [the room]313-the room with [him]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe without feeling that [Caesar]104-caesar and [Napoleon]105-napoleon would have been children in [his]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe hands . "[112-gregory]

[He]329-you was silent and even pale for a moment , and then resumed

" But whenever [he]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe gives advice it is always something as startling as an epigram , and yet as practical as [the Bank of [England]14-england]2253-the bank of england . [I]329-you said to [him]2249-the president of the central anarchist council , who is the greatest man in europe , What disguise will hide [me]329-you from [the world]182-the world ? What can [I]329-you find more respectable than [bishops]2234-bishops and [majors]2256-majors ? ' [He]329-you looked at [me]329-you with [his]329-you large but indecipherable face . [You]329-you want a safe disguise , do [you]329-you ? [You]329-you want a dress which will guarantee [you]329-you harmless ; a dress in which [no one]2257-no one would ever look for a bomb ? ' [I]329-you nodded . [He]329-you suddenly lifted [his]329-you lion 's voice . Why , then , dress up as an _ anarchist _ , [[you]329-you fool]2258-you fool ! ' [he]329-you roared so that [the room]313-the room shook . [Nobody]2260-nobody will ever expect [you]329-you to do anything dangerous then . ' And [he]329-you turned [his]329-you broad back on [me]329-you without another word . [I]329-you took [his]329-you advice , and have never regretted it . [I]329-you preached blood and murder to [those women]2261-those women day and night , and by [God]90-god ! [they]2261-those women would let [me]329-you wheel [[their]2261-those women perambulators]2262-their perambulators . "[329-you]

[Syme]93-syme sat watching [him]330-he with some respect in [his]330-he large , blue eyes .

" [You]93-syme took [me]330-he in , "[330-he] [he]330-he said . " It is really a smart dodge . "[330-he]

Then after a pause [he]330-he added

" What do [you]93-syme call [this tremendous President of [yours]93-syme]2263-this tremendous president of yours ? "[330-he]

" [We]2264-we generally call [him]2263-this tremendous president of yours Sunday , "[112-gregory] replied [Gregory]112-gregory with simplicity . " [You]93-syme see , there are [seven members of [the Central Anarchist Council]2250-the central anarchist council]2265-seven members of the central anarchist council , and [they]2265-seven members of the central anarchist council are named after days of the week . [He]2263-this tremendous president of yours is called Sunday , by [some of [[his]2263-this tremendous president of yours admirers]2268-his admirers Bloody Sunday]2267-some of his admirers bloody sunday . It is curious [you]93-syme should mention the matter , because the very night [you]93-syme have dropped in ( if [I]112-gregory may so express it ) is the night on which [[our]2264-we [London]3-london branch]2269-our london branch , which assembles in [this room]2270-this room , has to elect [[its]2269-our london branch own deputy to fill a vacancy in [the Council]2272-the council]2271-its own deputy to fill a vacancy in the council . [The gentleman who has for some time past played , with propriety and general applause , the difficult part of Thursday]2273-the gentleman who has for some time past played , with propriety and general applause , the difficult part of thursday , has died quite suddenly . Consequently , [we]2264-we have called a meeting this very evening to elect [a successor]2274-a successor . "[112-gregory]

[He]331-i got to [his]331-i feet and strolled across [the room]313-the room with a sort of smiling embarrassment .

" [I]331-i feel somehow as if [you]93-syme were [[my]331-i mother]2275-my mother , [Syme]93-syme , "[331-i] [he]331-i continued casually . " [I]331-i feel that [I]331-i can confide anything to [you]93-syme , as [you]93-syme have promised to tell [nobody]2260-nobody . In fact , [I]331-i will confide to [you]93-syme something that [I]331-i would not say in so many words to [the anarchists who will be coming to [the room]313-the room in about ten minutes]2277-the anarchists who will be coming to the room in about ten minutes . [We]2279-we shall , of course , go through a form of election ; but [I]331-i do n't mind telling [you]93-syme that it is practically certain what the result will be . "[331-i] [He]331-i looked down for a moment modestly . " It is almost a settled thing that [I]331-i am to be Thursday . "[331-i]

" [[My]93-syme dear fellow]2166-my dear fellow . "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme heartily , " [I]93-syme congratulate [you]112-gregory . A great career ! "[93-syme]

[Gregory]112-gregory smiled in deprecation , and walked across [the room]313-the room , talking rapidly .

" As a matter of fact , everything is ready for [me]331-i on this table , "[331-i] [he]331-i said , " and the ceremony will probably be the shortest possible . "[331-i]

[Syme]93-syme also strolled across to the table , and found lying across it a walking - stick , which turned out on examination to be a sword - stick , a large Colt 's revolver , a sandwich case , and a formidable flask of brandy . Over the chair , beside the table , was thrown a heavy - looking cape or cloak .

" [I]112-gregory have only to get the form of election finished , "[112-gregory] continued [Gregory]112-gregory with animation , " then [I]331-i snatch up this cloak and stick , stuff these other things into [my]331-i pocket , step out of a door in [this cavern]2281-this cavern , which opens on [the river]2282-the river , where there is a steam - tug already waiting for [me]331-i , and then then oh , the wild joy of being Thursday ! "[331-i] And [he]331-i clasped [his]331-i hands .

[Syme]93-syme , who had sat down once more with [his]93-syme usual insolent languor , got to [his]93-syme feet with an unusual air of hesitation .

" Why is it , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme asked vaguely , " that [I]93-syme think [you]112-gregory are quite [a decent fellow]2283-a decent fellow ? Why do [I]93-syme positively like [you]112-gregory , [Gregory]112-gregory ? "[93-syme] [He]93-syme paused a moment , and then added with a sort of fresh curiosity , " Is it because [you]112-gregory are such [an ass]2284-an ass ? "[93-syme]

There was a thoughtful silence again , and then [he]93-syme cried out

" Well , damn it all ! this is the funniest situation [I]93-syme have ever been in in [my]93-syme life , and [I]93-syme am going to act accordingly . [Gregory]112-gregory , [I]93-syme gave [you]112-gregory a promise before [I]93-syme came into [this place]2285-this place . That promise [I]93-syme would keep under red - hot pincers . Would [you]112-gregory give [me]93-syme , for [my]93-syme own safety , a little promise of the same kind ? "[93-syme]

" A promise ? "[112-gregory] asked [Gregory]112-gregory , wondering .

" Yes , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme very seriously , " a promise . [I]93-syme swore before [God]90-god that [I]93-syme would not tell [your]112-gregory secret to [the police]2193-the police . Will [you]112-gregory swear by [Humanity]106-humanity , or whatever beastly thing [you]112-gregory believe in , that [you]112-gregory will not tell [my]93-syme secret to [the anarchists]2287-the anarchists ? "[93-syme]

" [Your]112-gregory secret ? "[112-gregory] asked [the staring Gregory]112-gregory . " Have [you]93-syme got a secret ? "[112-gregory]

" Yes , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , " [I]93-syme have a secret . "[93-syme] Then after a pause , " Will [you]112-gregory swear ? "[93-syme]

[Gregory]112-gregory glared at [him]93-syme gravely for a few moments , and then said abruptly

" [You]93-syme must have bewitched [me]93-syme , but [I]93-syme feel a furious curiosity about [you]93-syme . Yes , [I]93-syme will swear not to tell [the anarchists]2287-the anarchists anything [you]93-syme tell [me]93-syme . But look sharp , for [they]2287-the anarchists will be [here]2202-here in a couple of minutes . "[93-syme]

[Syme]93-syme rose slowly to [his]93-syme feet and thrust [his]93-syme long , white hands into [his]93-syme long , grey trousers ' pockets . Almost as [he]93-syme did so there came five knocks on the outer grating , proclaiming the arrival of [the first of [the conspirators]335-the conspirators]334-the first of the conspirators .

" Well , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme slowly , " [I]93-syme do n't know how to tell [you]112-gregory the truth more shortly than by saying that [your]112-gregory expedient of dressing up as [an aimless poet]2290-an aimless poet is not confined to [you]112-gregory or [[your]112-gregory President]2291-your president . [We]2292-we have known [the dodge]2293-the dodge for some time at [Scotland Yard]15-scotland yard . "[93-syme]

[Gregory]112-gregory tried to spring up straight , but [he]336-he swayed thrice .

" What do [you]93-syme say ? "[336-he] [he]336-he asked in an inhuman voice .

" Yes , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme simply , " [I]93-syme am [a police detective]2294-a police detective . But [I]93-syme think [I]93-syme hear [[your]112-gregory friends]2295-your friends coming . "[93-syme]

From the doorway there came a murmur of " [Mr. Joseph Chamberlain]101-mr. joseph chamberlain . "[336-he] It was repeated twice and thrice , and then thirty times , and the crowd of [Joseph Chamberlains]107-joseph chamberlains ( a solemn thought ) could be heard trampling down [the corridor]337-the corridor .

CHAPTER III . [THE MAN WHO WAS [THURSDAY]102-thursday

Before one of the fresh faces]102-thursday could appear at the doorway , [Gregory]112-gregory 's stunned surprise had fallen from [him]336-he . [He]336-he was beside the table with a bound , and a noise in [his]336-he throat like a wild beast . [He]336-he caught up the [Colt]108-colt 's revolver and took aim at [Syme]93-syme . [Syme]93-syme did not flinch , but [he]93-syme put up a pale and polite hand .

" Do n't be such [a silly man]2296-a silly man , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said , with the effeminate dignity of [a curate]338-a curate . " Do n't [you]93-syme see it 's not necessary ? Do n't [you]93-syme see that [we]2297-we 're both in [the same boat]2298-the same boat ? Yes , and [jolly sea - sick]2299-jolly sea - sick . "[93-syme]

[Gregory]112-gregory could not speak , but [he]336-he could not fire either , and [he]336-he looked [his]336-he question .

" Do n't [you]93-syme see [we]2297-we 've checkmated [each other]2300-each other ? "[93-syme] cried [Syme]93-syme . " [I]93-syme ca n't tell [the police]2193-the police [you]93-syme are [an anarchist]2127-an anarchist . [You]93-syme ca n't tell [the anarchists]2287-the anarchists [I]93-syme 'm [a policeman]2304-a policeman . [I]93-syme can only watch [you]93-syme , knowing what [you]93-syme are ; [you]93-syme can only watch [me]93-syme , knowing what [I]93-syme am . In short , it 's a lonely , intellectual duel , [my]93-syme head against [yours]93-syme . [I]93-syme 'm [a policeman deprived of the help of the police]2305-a policeman deprived of the help of the police . [You]93-syme , [[my]93-syme poor fellow]2306-my poor fellow , are [an anarchist]2127-an anarchist deprived of the help of that law and organisation which is so essential to anarchy . The one solitary difference is in [your]93-syme favour . [You]93-syme are not surrounded by [inquisitive policemen]2308-inquisitive policemen ; [I]93-syme am surrounded by [inquisitive anarchists]2309-inquisitive anarchists . [I]93-syme can not betray [you]93-syme , but [I]93-syme might betray [myself]93-syme . Come , come ! wait and see [me]93-syme betray [myself]93-syme . [I]93-syme shall do it so nicely . "[93-syme]

[Gregory]112-gregory put the pistol slowly down , still staring at [Syme]93-syme as if [he]93-syme were [a sea - monster]339-a sea - monster .

" [I]93-syme do n't believe in immortality , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said at last , " but if , after all this , [you]93-syme were to break [your]93-syme word , [God]90-god would make a hell only for [you]93-syme , to howl in for ever . "[93-syme]

" [I]93-syme shall not break [my]93-syme word , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme sternly , " nor will [you]93-syme break [yours]93-syme . Here are [[your]93-syme friends]2295-your friends . "[93-syme]

[The mass of [the anarchists]2287-the anarchists]340-the mass of the anarchists entered [the room]313-the room heavily , with a slouching and somewhat weary gait ; but [one little man , with a black beard and glasses]343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses [a man somewhat of the type of]344-a man somewhat of the type of [Mr. Tim Healy]109-mr. tim healy detached [himself]343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses , and bustled forward with some papers in [his]343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses hand .

" Comrade [Gregory]112-gregory , "[343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses] [he]343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses said , " [I]343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses suppose [this man]2311-this man is [a delegate]2312-a delegate ? "[343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses]

[Gregory]112-gregory , taken by surprise , looked down and muttered the name of [Syme]93-syme ; but [Syme]93-syme replied almost pertly

" [I]93-syme am glad to see that [your]112-gregory gate is well enough guarded to make it hard for [anyone]2313-anyone to be here who was not [a delegate]2312-a delegate . "[93-syme]

The brow of [the little man with the black beard]345-the little man with the black beard was , however , still contracted with something like suspicion .

" What branch do [you]93-syme represent ? "[343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses] [he]343-one little man , with a black beard and glasses asked sharply .

" [I]93-syme should hardly call it a branch , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , laughing ; " [I]93-syme should call it at the very least a root . "[93-syme]

" What do [you]93-syme mean ? "[345-the little man with the black beard]

" The fact is , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme serenely , " the truth is [I]93-syme am [a Sabbatarian]2315-a sabbatarian . [I]93-syme have been specially sent here to see that [you]346-the little man show a due observance of Sunday . "[93-syme]

[The little man]346-the little man dropped one of [his]346-the little man papers , and a flicker of fear went over all the faces of [the group]268-the group . Evidently [the awful President , whose name was [Sunday]110-sunday]348-the awful president , whose name was sunday , did sometimes send down [such irregular [ambassadors]350-ambassadors to such branch meetings]349-such irregular ambassadors to such branch meetings .

" Well , [comrade]2316-comrade , "[351-the man with the papers] said [the man with the papers]351-the man with the papers after a pause , " [I]351-the man with the papers suppose [we]2317-we 'd better give [you]346-the little man a seat in the meeting ? "[351-the man with the papers]

" If [you]346-the little man ask [my]93-syme advice as [a friend]2318-a friend , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme with severe benevolence , " [I]93-syme think [you]346-the little man 'd better . "[93-syme]

When [Gregory]112-gregory heard the dangerous dialogue end , with a sudden safety for [[his]346-the little man rival]352-his rival , [he]346-the little man rose abruptly and paced the floor in painful thought . [He]346-the little man was , indeed , in an agony of diplomacy . It was clear that [Syme]93-syme 's inspired impudence was likely to bring [him]346-the little man out of all merely accidental dilemmas . Little was to be hoped from [them]353-we . [He]346-the little man could not [himself]346-the little man betray [Syme]93-syme , partly from honour , but partly also because , if [he]346-the little man betrayed [him]93-syme and for some reason failed to destroy [him]93-syme , [the Syme who escaped]354-the syme who escaped would be [a Syme freed from all obligation of secrecy]355-a syme freed from all obligation of secrecy , [a Syme who would simply walk to [the nearest police station]357-the nearest police station]356-a syme who would simply walk to the nearest police station . After all , it was only one night 's discussion , and only [one detective who would know of it]358-one detective who would know of it . [He]346-the little man would let out as little as possible of [their]353-we plans that night , and then let [Syme]93-syme go , and chance it .

[He]346-the little man strode across to the group of anarchists , which was already distributing itself along the benches .

" [I]346-the little man think it is time [we]353-we began , "[346-the little man] [he]346-the little man said ; " [the steam - tug]2319-the steam - tug is waiting on [the river]2282-the river already . [I]346-the little man move that [Comrade Buttons]111-comrade buttons takes the chair . "[346-the little man]

This being approved by a show of hands , [the little man with the papers]359-the little man with the papers slipped into the presidential seat .

" [Comrades]2321-comrades , "[346-the little man] [he]346-the little man began , as sharp as a pistol - shot , " [our]353-we meeting tonight is important , though it need not be long . [This branch]2322-this branch has always had the honour of electing Thursdays for [the Central European Council]2323-the central european council . [We]353-we have elected [many and splendid Thursdays]2324-many and splendid thursdays . [We]353-we all lament the sad decease of [the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week]2325-the heroic worker who occupied the post until last week . As [you]2321-comrades know , [his]346-the little man services to the cause were considerable . [He]346-the little man organised the great dynamite coup of [Brighton]16-brighton which , under happier circumstances , ought to have killed everybody on [the pier]2326-the pier . As [you]2321-comrades also know , [his]346-the little man death was as self - denying as [his]346-the little man life , for [he]346-the little man died through [his]346-the little man faith in a hygienic mixture of chalk and water as a substitute for milk , which beverage [he]346-the little man regarded as barbaric , and as involving cruelty to the cow . Cruelty , or anything approaching to cruelty , revolted [him]346-the little man always . But it is not to acclaim [his]346-the little man virtues that [we]353-we are met , but for a harder task . It is difficult properly to praise [his]346-the little man qualities , but it is more difficult to replace them . Upon [you]2321-comrades , [comrades]2321-comrades , it devolves this evening to choose out of the company present [the man who shall be Thursday]2328-the man who shall be thursday . If [any comrade]2329-any comrade suggests a name [I]346-the little man will put it to the vote . If [no comrade]2330-no comrade suggests a name , [I]346-the little man can only tell [myself]346-the little man that [that dear dynamiter , who is gone from [us]353-we , has carried into the unknowable abysses the last secret of [his]346-the little man virtue and [his]346-the little man innocence]2331-that dear dynamiter , who is gone from us , has carried into the unknowable abysses the last secret of his virtue and his innocence . "[346-the little man]

There was a stir of almost inaudible applause , such as is sometimes heard in [church]360-church . Then [a large old man , with a long and venerable white beard]361-a large old man , with a long and venerable white beard , perhaps [the only real working - man present]362-the only real working - man present , rose lumberingly and said

" [I]361-a large old man , with a long and venerable white beard move that [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory be elected Thursday , "[361-a large old man , with a long and venerable white beard] and sat lumberingly down again .

" Does [anyone]2313-anyone second ? "[363-the chairman] asked [the chairman]363-the chairman .

[A little man with a velvet coat and pointed beard seconded]364-a little man with a velvet coat and pointed beard seconded .

" Before [I]363-the chairman put the matter to the vote , "[363-the chairman] said [the chairman]363-the chairman , " [I]363-the chairman will call on [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory to make a statement . "[363-the chairman]

[Gregory]112-gregory rose amid a great rumble of applause . [His]366-his face was deadly pale , so that by contrast [his]366-his queer red hair looked almost scarlet . But [he]366-his was smiling and altogether at ease . [He]366-his had made up [his]366-his mind , and [he]366-his saw [his]366-his best policy quite plain in front of [him]366-his like a white road . [His]366-his best chance was to make a softened and ambiguous speech , such as would leave on [the detective]367-the detective 's mind the impression that [the anarchist brotherhood]368-the anarchist brotherhood was a very mild affair after all . [He]366-his believed in [his]366-his own literary power , [his]366-his capacity for suggesting fine shades and picking perfect words . [He]366-his thought that with care [he]366-his could succeed , in spite of [all the people around [him]366-his]369-all the people around him , in conveying an impression of [the institution]370-the institution , subtly and delicately false . [Syme]93-syme had once thought that [anarchists]371-anarchists , under all [their]371-anarchists bravado , were only playing [the fool]372-the fool . Could [he]93-syme not now , in the hour of peril , make [Syme]93-syme think so again ?

" [Comrades]2321-comrades , "[112-gregory] began [Gregory]112-gregory , in a low but penetrating voice , " it is not necessary for [me]112-gregory to tell [you]2321-comrades what is [my]112-gregory policy , for it is [your]2321-comrades policy also . [Our]2334-we belief has been slandered , it has been disfigured , it has been utterly confused and concealed , but it has never been altered . [Those who talk about anarchism and its dangers]2335-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers go everywhere and anywhere to get [their]2335-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers information , except to [us]2334-we , except to the fountain head . [They]2335-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers learn about [anarchists]371-anarchists from sixpenny novels ; [they]2335-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers learn about [anarchists]371-anarchists from [tradesmen]2338-tradesmen 's newspapers ; [they]2335-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers learn about [anarchists]371-anarchists from [_ Ally Sloper 's Half - Holiday]17-_ ally sloper 's half - holiday _ and the _ Sporting Times _ . [They]2335-those who talk about anarchism and its dangers never learn about [anarchists]371-anarchists from [anarchists]371-anarchists . [We]2334-we have no chance of denying the mountainous slanders which are heaped upon [our]2334-we heads from [one end of [Europe]13-europe]2342-one end of europe to another . [The man who has always heard that [we]2334-we are walking plagues]2343-the man who has always heard that we are walking plagues has never heard [our]2334-we reply . [I]112-gregory know that [he]2343-the man who has always heard that we are walking plagues will not hear it tonight , though [my]112-gregory passion were to rend the roof . For it is deep , deep under the earth that [the persecuted]2344-the persecuted are permitted to assemble , as [the Christians]2345-the christians assembled in [the Catacombs]2346-the catacombs . But if , by some incredible accident , there were here tonight [a man who all [his]2347-a man who all his life had thus immensely misunderstood us life had thus immensely misunderstood [us]2334-we]2347-a man who all his life had thus immensely misunderstood us , [I]112-gregory would put this question to [him]2347-a man who all his life had thus immensely misunderstood us : When [those Christians]2348-those christians met in [those Catacombs]2349-those catacombs , what sort of moral reputation had [they]2348-those christians in [the streets above]2350-the streets above ? What tales were told of [their]2348-those christians atrocities by [one educated Roman]2351-one educated roman to another ? Suppose ' ( [I]112-gregory would say to [him]2347-a man who all his life had thus immensely misunderstood us ) , suppose that [we]2334-we are only repeating that still mysterious paradox of history . Suppose [we]2334-we seem as shocking as [the Christians]2345-the christians because [we]2334-we are really as harmless as [the Christians]2345-the christians . Suppose [we]2334-we seem as mad as [the Christians]2345-the christians because [we]2334-we are really as meek . "[112-gregory] '

The applause that had greeted the opening sentences had been gradually growing fainter , and at the last word it stopped suddenly . In the abrupt silence , [the man with the velvet jacket]373-the man with the velvet jacket said , in a high , squeaky voice

" [I]373-the man with the velvet jacket 'm not meek ! "[373-the man with the velvet jacket]

" [Comrade Witherspoon]113-comrade witherspoon tells [us]2334-we , "[112-gregory] resumed [Gregory]112-gregory , " that [he]113-comrade witherspoon is not meek . Ah , how little [he]113-comrade witherspoon knows [himself]113-comrade witherspoon ! [His]113-comrade witherspoon words are , indeed , extravagant ; [his]113-comrade witherspoon appearance is ferocious , and even ( to an ordinary taste ) unattractive . But only the eye of a friendship as deep and delicate as [mine]112-gregory can perceive the deep foundation of solid meekness which lies at the base of [him]113-comrade witherspoon , too deep even for [himself]113-comrade witherspoon to see . [I]112-gregory repeat , [we]2334-we are [the true early Christians]2355-the true early christians , only that [we]2334-we come too late . [We]2334-we are simple , as [they]2356-they revere simple look at [Comrade Witherspoon]113-comrade witherspoon . [We]2334-we are modest , as [they]2356-they were modest look at [me]112-gregory . [We]2334-we are merciful "[112-gregory]

" No , no ! "[114-mr. witherspoon] called out [Mr. Witherspoon]114-mr. witherspoon with the velvet jacket .

" [I]112-gregory say [we]2334-we are merciful , "[112-gregory] repeated [Gregory]112-gregory furiously , " as [the early Christians]2357-the early christians were merciful . Yet this did not prevent [their]2356-they being accused of eating human flesh . [We]2334-we do not eat human flesh "[112-gregory]

" Shame ! "[114-mr. witherspoon] cried [Witherspoon]114-mr. witherspoon . " Why not ? "[114-mr. witherspoon]

" [Comrade Witherspoon]113-comrade witherspoon , "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory , with a feverish gaiety , " is anxious to know why [nobody]2260-nobody eats [him]113-comrade witherspoon ( laughter ) . " No , no ! "[113-comrade witherspoon] said [Witherspoon]113-comrade witherspoon , " down with love . "[113-comrade witherspoon]

" Which is founded upon love , "[112-gregory] repeated [Gregory]112-gregory , grinding [his]374-his teeth , " there will be no difficulty about the aims which [we]2334-we shall pursue as a body , or which [I]374-his should pursue were [I]374-his chosen as [the representative of that body]2360-the representative of that body .
