"[374-his]

[Gregory]112-gregory resumed [his]374-his seat and passed [his]374-his hand across [his]374-his forehead . The silence was sudden and awkward , but [the chairman]363-the chairman rose like [an automaton]376-an automaton , and said in a colourless voice

" Does [anyone]2313-anyone oppose the election of [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory ? "[363-the chairman]

[The assembly]377-the assembly seemed vague and sub - consciously disappointed , and [Comrade Witherspoon]113-comrade witherspoon moved restlessly on [his]113-comrade witherspoon seat and muttered in [his]113-comrade witherspoon thick beard . By the sheer rush of routine , however , the motion would have been put and carried . But as [the chairman]363-the chairman was opening [his]363-the chairman mouth to put it , [Syme]93-syme sprang to [his]93-syme feet and said in a small and quiet voice

" Yes , [Mr. Chairman]115-mr. chairman , [I]93-syme oppose . "[93-syme]

The most effective fact in oratory is an unexpected change in the voice . [Mr. Gabriel Syme]93-syme evidently understood oratory . Having said these first formal words in a moderated tone and with a brief simplicity , [he]93-syme made [his]93-syme next word ring and volley in [the vault]379-the vault as if one of the guns had gone off .

" [Comrades]2321-comrades ! "[93-syme] [he]93-syme cried , in a voice that made [every man]380-every man jump out of [his]380-every man boots , " have [we]2321-comrades come here for this ? Do [we]2321-comrades live underground like rats in order to listen to talk like this ? This is talk [we]2321-comrades might listen to while eating buns at [a Sunday School treat]2364-a sunday school treat . Do [we]2321-comrades line these walls with weapons and bar that door with death lest [anyone]2313-anyone should come and hear [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory saying to [us]2321-comrades , Be good , and [you]2321-comrades will be happy , ' Honesty is the best policy , ' and Virtue is its own reward ' ? There was not a word in [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory 's address to which [a curate]338-a curate could not have listened with pleasure ( hear , hear ) . But [I]93-syme am not [a curate]338-a curate ( loud cheers ) , and [I]93-syme did not listen to it with pleasure ( renewed cheers ) . [The man who is fitted to make a good curate]2368-the man who is fitted to make a good curate is not fitted to make [a resolute , forcible , and efficient Thursday ( hear , hear )]2369-a resolute , forcible , and efficient thursday ( hear , hear ) . "[93-syme]

" [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory has told [us]2321-comrades , in only too apologetic a tone , that [we]2321-comrades are not [the enemies of society]2370-the enemies of society . But [I]93-syme say that [we]2321-comrades are the enemies of society , and so much the worse for society . [We]2321-comrades are [the enemies of society]2370-the enemies of society , for society is the enemy of humanity , [[its]2372-its oldest and [its]2372-its most pitiless enemy]2373-its oldest and its most pitiless enemy ( hear , hear ) . [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory has told [us]2321-comrades ( apologetically again ) that [we]2321-comrades are not [murderers]2374-murderers . There [I]93-syme agree . [We]2321-comrades are not [murderers]2374-murderers , [we]2321-comrades are [executioners]2376-executioners ( cheers ) . "[93-syme]

Ever since [Syme]93-syme had risen [Gregory]112-gregory had sat staring at [him]93-syme , [his]93-syme face idiotic with astonishment . Now in the pause [his]93-syme lips of clay parted , and [he]93-syme said , with an automatic and lifeless distinctness

" [[You]112-gregory damnable hypocrite]2377-you damnable hypocrite ! "[93-syme]

[Syme]93-syme looked straight into those frightful eyes with [his]93-syme own pale blue ones , and said with dignity

" [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory accuses [me]93-syme of hypocrisy . [He]93-syme knows as well as [I]93-syme do that [I]93-syme am keeping all [my]93-syme engagements and doing nothing but [my]93-syme duty . [I]93-syme do not mince words . [I]93-syme do not pretend to . [I]93-syme say that [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory is unfit to be Thursday for all [his]93-syme amiable qualities . [He]93-syme is unfit to be Thursday because of [his]93-syme amiable qualities . [We]2378-we do not want [the Supreme Council of Anarchy]2379-the supreme council of anarchy infected with a maudlin mercy ( hear , hear ) . This is no time for ceremonial politeness , neither is it a time for ceremonial modesty . [I]93-syme set [myself]93-syme against [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory as [I]93-syme would set [myself]93-syme against [all the Governments of [Europe]13-europe]2380-all the governments of europe , because [the anarchist who has given [himself]2381-the anarchist who has given himself to anarchy to anarchy]2381-the anarchist who has given himself to anarchy has forgotten modesty as much as [he]2381-the anarchist who has given himself to anarchy has forgotten pride ( cheers ) . [I]93-syme am not [a man]240-a man at all . [I]93-syme am [a cause]2383-a cause ( renewed cheers ) . [I]93-syme set [myself]93-syme against [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory as impersonally and as calmly as [I]93-syme should choose one pistol rather than another out of that rack upon the wall ; and [I]93-syme say that rather than have [Gregory]112-gregory and [his]381-his milk - and - water methods on the Supreme Council , [I]93-syme would offer [myself]93-syme for election "[93-syme]

[His]381-his sentence was drowned in a deafening cataract of applause . The faces , that had grown fiercer and fiercer with approval as [his]381-his tirade grew more and more uncompromising , were now distorted with grins of anticipation or cloven with delighted cries . At the moment when [he]381-his announced [himself]381-his as ready to stand for the post of Thursday , a roar of excitement and assent broke forth , and became uncontrollable , and at the same moment [Gregory]112-gregory sprang to [his]381-his feet , with foam upon [his]381-his mouth , and shouted against the shouting .

But louder than [Gregory]112-gregory 's shouting and louder than the roar of [the room]313-the room came the voice of [Syme]93-syme , still speaking in a peal of pitiless thunder

" [I]93-syme do not go to the Council to rebut that slander that calls [[us]2385-us [murderers]2374-murderers]2386-us murderers ; [I]93-syme go to earn it ( loud and prolonged cheering ) . To [the priest who says [these men]2389-these men]2388-the priest who says these men are [the enemies of religion]2390-the enemies of religion , to [the judge who says [these men]2389-these men are [the enemies of law]2393-the enemies of law]2391-the judge who says these men are the enemies of law , to [the fat parliamentarian who says [these men]2389-these men]2394-the fat parliamentarian who says these men are [the enemies of order and public decency]2396-the enemies of order and public decency , to all these [I]93-syme will reply , [You]2389-these men are [false kings]2397-false kings , but [you]2389-these men are [true prophets]2398-true prophets . [I]93-syme am come to destroy [you]2389-these men , and to fulfil [your]2389-these men prophecies . ' "[93-syme]

The heavy clamour gradually died away , but before it had ceased [Witherspoon]113-comrade witherspoon had jumped to [his]113-comrade witherspoon feet , [his]113-comrade witherspoon hair and beard all on end , and had said

" [I]113-comrade witherspoon move , as an amendment , that [Comrade Syme]116-syme be appointed to the post . "[113-comrade witherspoon]

" Does [anyone]2313-anyone second this amendment ? "[113-comrade witherspoon] [he]113-comrade witherspoon said . [A tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an American chin beard]384-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard , was observed on the back bench to be slowly rising to [his]384-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard feet . " [I]113-comrade witherspoon end all this ! "[113-comrade witherspoon] [he]113-comrade witherspoon said , in a voice as heavy as stone .

" [This man]2311-this man can not be elected . [He]2311-this man is a "[113-comrade witherspoon]

" [I]385-the long , lean man with the american beard beg to second the election of [Comrade Syme]116-syme . "[385-the long , lean man with the american beard]

" The question is that [Comrade Syme]116-syme "[385-the long , lean man with the american beard]

[Gregory]112-gregory had again sprung to [his]384-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard feet , panting and passionate .

" [Comrades]2321-comrades , "[384-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard] [he]384-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard cried out , " [I]384-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard am not [a madman]2404-a madman . "[384-a tall , tired man , with melancholy eyes and an american chin beard]

" Oh , oh ! "[114-mr. witherspoon] said [Mr. Witherspoon]114-mr. witherspoon .

" [I]112-gregory am not [a madman]2404-a madman , "[112-gregory] reiterated [Gregory]112-gregory , with a frightful sincerity which for a moment staggered [the room]313-the room , " but [I]112-gregory give [you]2321-comrades a counsel which [you]2321-comrades can call mad if [you]2321-comrades like . No , [I]112-gregory will not call it a counsel , for [I]112-gregory can give [you]2321-comrades no reason for it . [I]112-gregory will call it a command . Call it a mad command , but act upon it . Strike , but hear [me]112-gregory ! Kill [me]112-gregory , but obey [me]112-gregory ! Do not elect [this man]2311-this man . "[112-gregory] Truth is so terrible , even in fetters , that for a moment [Syme]116-syme 's slender and insane victory swayed like a reed . But [you]388-you could not have guessed it from [Syme]116-syme 's bleak blue eyes . [He]116-syme merely began

" [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory commands "[116-syme]

Then the spell was snapped , and [one anarchist]389-one anarchist called out to [Gregory]112-gregory

" Who are [you]112-gregory ? [You]112-gregory are not Sunday ; "[390-another anarchist] and [another anarchist]390-another anarchist added in a heavier voice , " And [you]112-gregory are not Thursday . "[390-another anarchist]

" [Comrades]2321-comrades , "[112-gregory] cried [Gregory]112-gregory , in a voice like that of [a martyr who in an ecstacy of pain has passed beyond pain]391-a martyr who in an ecstacy of pain has passed beyond pain , " it is nothing to [me]112-gregory whether [you]2321-comrades detest [me]112-gregory as [a tyrant]2408-a tyrant or detest [me]112-gregory as [a slave]2409-a slave . If [you]2321-comrades will not take [my]112-gregory command , accept [my]112-gregory degradation . [I]112-gregory kneel to [you]2321-comrades . [I]112-gregory throw [myself]112-gregory at [your]2321-comrades feet . [I]112-gregory implore [you]2321-comrades . Do not elect [this man]2311-this man . "[112-gregory]

" [Comrade Gregory]112-gregory , "[363-the chairman] said [the chairman]363-the chairman after a painful pause , " this is really not quite dignified . "[363-the chairman]

For the first time in the proceedings there was for a few seconds a real silence . Then [Gregory]112-gregory fell back in [his]393-his seat , [a pale wreck of a man]394-a pale wreck of a man , and [the chairman]363-the chairman repeated , like a piece of clock - work suddenly started again

" The question is that [Comrade Syme]116-syme be elected to the post of Thursday on the General Council . "[363-the chairman]

The roar rose like [the sea]396-the sea , the hands rose like a forest , and three minutes afterwards [Mr. Gabriel Syme]93-syme , of [the Secret Police Service]397-the secret police service , was elected to the post of Thursday on [the General Council of [the Anarchists of [Europe]13-europe]399-the anarchists of europe]398-the general council of the anarchists of europe .

[Everyone in [the room]313-the room]400-everyone in the room seemed to feel the tug waiting on [the river]2282-the river , the sword - stick and the revolver , waiting on the table . The instant the election was ended and irrevocable , and [Syme]116-syme had received the paper proving [his]116-syme election , [they]400-everyone in the room all sprang to [their]400-everyone in the room feet , and [the fiery groups]403-the fiery groups moved and mixed in [the room]313-the room . [Syme]116-syme found [himself]116-syme , somehow or other , face to face with [Gregory]112-gregory , who still regarded [him]116-syme with a stare of stunned hatred . [They]400-everyone in the room were silent for many minutes .

" [You]112-gregory are [a devil]2411-a devil ! "[112-gregory] said [Gregory]112-gregory at last .

" And [you]112-gregory are [a gentleman]2209-a gentleman , "[116-syme] said [Syme]116-syme with gravity .

" It was [you]112-gregory that entrapped [me]112-gregory , "[112-gregory] began [Gregory]112-gregory , shaking from head to foot , " entrapped [me]112-gregory into "[112-gregory]

" Talk sense , "[116-syme] said [Syme]116-syme shortly . " Into what sort of devils ' parliament have [you]112-gregory entrapped [me]116-syme , if it comes to that ? [You]112-gregory made [me]116-syme swear before [I]116-syme made [you]112-gregory . Perhaps [we]2413-we are both doing what [we]2413-we think right . But what [we]2413-we think right is so damned different that there can be nothing between [us]2413-we in the way of concession . There is nothing possible between [us]2413-we but honour and death , "[116-syme] and [he]116-syme pulled the great cloak about [his]116-syme shoulders and picked up the flask from the table .

" [The boat]2414-the boat is quite ready , "[117-mr. buttons] said [Mr. Buttons]117-mr. buttons , bustling up . " Be good enough to step this way . "[117-mr. buttons]

With a gesture that revealed the shop - walker , [he]117-mr. buttons led [Syme]116-syme down [a short , iron - bound passage]405-a short , iron - bound passage , the still agonised [Gregory]112-gregory following feverishly at [their]406-their heels . At the end of [the passage]320-the passage was a door , which [Buttons]117-mr. buttons opened sharply , showing a sudden blue and silver picture of [the moonlit river]408-the moonlit river , that looked like a scene in [a theatre]409-a theatre . Close to the opening lay a dark , dwarfish steam - launch , like a baby dragon with one red eye .

Almost in the act of stepping on board , [Gabriel Syme]93-syme turned to the gaping [Gregory]112-gregory .

" [You]112-gregory have kept [your]112-gregory word , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said gently , with [his]93-syme face in shadow . " [You]112-gregory are [a man of honour]2415-a man of honour , and [I]93-syme thank [you]112-gregory . [You]112-gregory have kept it even down to a small particular . There was one special thing [you]112-gregory promised [me]93-syme at the beginning of the affair , and which [you]112-gregory have certainly given [me]93-syme by the end of it . "[93-syme]

" What do [you]112-gregory mean ? "[112-gregory] cried the chaotic [Gregory]112-gregory . " What did [I]112-gregory promise [you]112-gregory ? "[112-gregory]

" A very entertaining evening , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , and [he]93-syme made a military salute with the sword - stick as [the steamboat]410-the steamboat slid away .

CHAPTER IV . THE TALE OF [A DETECTIVE

Gabriel Syme]93-syme was not merely [a detective who pretended to be [a poet]217-a poet]411-a detective who pretended to be a poet ; [he]93-syme was really a poet who had become [a detective]413-a detective . Nor was [his]93-syme hatred of anarchy hypocritical . [He]93-syme was one of [those who are driven early in life into too conservative an attitude by the bewildering folly of most revolutionists]414-those who are driven early in life into too conservative an attitude by the bewildering folly of most revolutionists . [He]93-syme had not attained it by any tame tradition . [His]93-syme respectability was spontaneous and sudden , a rebellion against rebellion . [He]93-syme came of [a family of cranks]415-a family of cranks , in which [all the oldest people]416-all the oldest people had all the newest notions . [One of [[his]93-syme uncles]418-his uncles]417-one of his uncles always walked about without a hat , and [another]419-another had made an unsuccessful attempt to walk about with a hat and nothing else . [[His]93-syme father]420-his father cultivated art and self - realisation ; [[his]93-syme mother]421-his mother went in for simplicity and hygiene . Hence [the child]422-the child , during [his]93-syme tenderer years , was wholly unacquainted with any drink between the extremes of absinth and cocoa , of both of which [he]93-syme had a healthy dislike . The more [[his]93-syme mother]421-his mother preached a more than Puritan abstinence the more did [[his]93-syme father]420-his father expand into a more than pagan latitude ; and by the time [the former]425-the former had come to enforcing vegetarianism , [the latter]426-the latter had pretty well reached the point of defending cannibalism .

Being surrounded with every conceivable kind of revolt from infancy , [Gabriel]93-syme had to revolt into something , so [he]93-syme revolted into the only thing left sanity . But there was just enough in [him]93-syme of the blood of [these fanatics]427-these fanatics to make even [his]93-syme protest for common sense a little too fierce to be sensible . [His]93-syme hatred of modern lawlessness had been crowned also by an accident . It happened that [he]93-syme was walking in [a side street]428-a side street at the instant of a dynamite outrage . [He]93-syme had been blind and deaf for a moment , and then seen , the smoke clearing , the broken windows and the bleeding faces . After that [he]93-syme went about as usual quiet , courteous , rather gentle ; but there was a spot on [his]93-syme mind that was not sane . [He]93-syme did not regard [anarchists]371-anarchists , as most of [us]430-us do , as [a handful of [morbid men]432-morbid men]431-a handful of morbid men , combining ignorance with intellectualism . [He]93-syme regarded [them]371-anarchists as a huge and pitiless peril , like a Chinese invasion .

[He]93-syme poured perpetually into newspapers and [their]433-their waste - paper baskets a torrent of tales , verses and violent articles , warning [men]179-men of this deluge of barbaric denial . But [he]93-syme seemed to be getting no nearer [[his]93-syme enemy]435-his enemy , and , what was worse , [no nearer a living]436-no nearer a living . As [he]93-syme paced [the Thames embankment]437-the thames embankment , bitterly biting a cheap cigar and brooding on the advance of Anarchy , there was [no anarchist with a bomb in [his]93-syme pocket]438-no anarchist with a bomb in his pocket so savage or so solitary as [he]93-syme . Indeed , [he]93-syme always felt that [Government]18-government stood alone and desperate , with its back to the wall . [He]93-syme was too quixotic to have cared for it otherwise .

[He]93-syme walked on [the Embankment]439-the embankment once under a dark red sunset . [The red river]440-the red river reflected the red sky , and they both reflected [his]93-syme anger . The sky , indeed , was so swarthy , and the light on [the river]2282-the river relatively so lurid , that the water almost seemed of fiercer flame than the sunset it mirrored . It looked like a stream of literal fire winding under [the vast caverns of [a subterranean country]443-a subterranean country]442-the vast caverns of a subterranean country .

[Syme]93-syme was shabby in those days . [He]93-syme wore an old - fashioned black chimney - pot hat ; [he]93-syme was wrapped in a yet more old - fashioned cloak , black and ragged ; and the combination gave [him]93-syme the look of [the early villains in Dickens and [Bulwer Lytton]19-bulwer lytton]444-the early villains in dickens and bulwer lytton . Also [his]93-syme yellow beard and hair were more unkempt and leonine than when they appeared long afterwards , cut and pointed , on [the lawns of [Saffron Park]2-saffron park]445-the lawns of saffron park . A long , lean , black cigar , bought in [Soho]20-soho for twopence , stood out from between [his]93-syme tightened teeth , and altogether [he]93-syme looked [a very satisfactory specimen of [the anarchists upon whom [he]93-syme had vowed a holy war]447-the anarchists upon whom he had vowed a holy war]446-a very satisfactory specimen of the anarchists upon whom he had vowed a holy war . Perhaps this was why [a policeman on [the Embankment]439-the embankment]448-a policeman on the embankment spoke to [him]93-syme , and said " Good evening . "[448-a policeman on the embankment]

[Syme]93-syme , at a crisis of [his]93-syme morbid fears for humanity , seemed stung by the mere stolidity of [the automatic official]450-the automatic official , a mere bulk of blue in the twilight .

" A good evening is it ? "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said sharply . " [[You]2416-you fellows]2417-you fellows would call the end of [the world]182-the world a good evening . Look at that bloody red sun and [that bloody river]2419-that bloody river ! [I]93-syme tell [you]2416-you that if that were literally human blood , spilt and shining , [you]2416-you would still be standing here as solid as ever , looking out for [some poor harmless tramp whom [you]2416-you could move on]2420-some poor harmless tramp whom you could move on . But this new movement of [ours]2459-we is a very different affair . [We]2459-we deny the snobbish English assumption that [the uneducated]2467-the uneducated are [the dangerous criminals]2468-the dangerous criminals . [We]2459-we remember [the Roman Emperors]2469-the roman emperors . [We]2459-we remember [the great poisoning princes of the Renaissance]2470-the great poisoning princes of the renaissance . Compared to [him]2474-the entirely lawless modern philosopher , [burglars]2475-burglars and [bigamists]2476-bigamists are essentially [moral men]2477-moral men ; [my]451-the policeman heart goes out to [them]2477-moral men . [They]2477-moral men accept the essential ideal of [man]2148-man ; [they]2477-moral men merely seek it wrongly . [Thieves]2458-thieves respect property . [They]2458-thieves merely wish the property to become [their]2458-thieves property that [they]2458-thieves may more perfectly respect it . But [philosophers]2480-philosophers dislike property as property ; [they]2480-philosophers wish to destroy the very idea of personal possession . [Bigamists]120-bigamists respect marriage , or [they]120-bigamists would not go through the highly ceremonial and even ritualistic formality of bigamy . But [philosophers]2480-philosophers despise marriage as marriage . [Murderers]121-murderers respect human life ; [they]121-murderers merely wish to attain a greater fulness of human life in [themselves]121-murderers by the sacrifice of what seems to [them]121-murderers to be lesser lives . But [philosophers]2480-philosophers hate life itself , [their]2480-philosophers own as much as [other people]2483-other people 's . "[451-the policeman]

[The common criminal]2484-the common criminal is [a bad man]2485-a bad man , but at least [he]2484-the common criminal is , as it were , [a conditional good man]2486-a conditional good man . [He]2484-the common criminal says that if only a certain obstacle be removed say [a wealthy uncle]2487-a wealthy uncle [he]2487-a wealthy uncle is then prepared to accept [the universe]2488-the universe and to praise [God]90-god . Yes , [the modern world]2493-the modern world has retained all those parts of police work which are really oppressive and ignominious , the harrying of [the poor]2423-the poor , the spying upon [the unfortunate]2495-the unfortunate . [They]2502-our special army do not believe that the crime creates the punishment . [They]2502-our special army believe that the punishment has created the crime . It was not the ordinary darkness , in which forms can be faintly traced ; it was like going suddenly stone - blind .

Thus it was that when [Gabriel Syme]93-syme came out again into the crimson light of evening , in [his]93-syme shabby black hat and shabby , lawless cloak , [he]93-syme came out a member of [the New Detective Corps]476-the new detective corps for the frustration of the great conspiracy . Acting under the advice of [[his]93-syme friend]477-his friend [the policeman ( who was professionally inclined to neatness )]478-the policeman ( who was professionally inclined to neatness ) , [he]93-syme trimmed [his]93-syme hair and beard , bought a good hat , clad [himself]93-syme in an exquisite summer suit of light blue - grey , with a pale yellow flower in the button - hole , and , in short , became [that elegant and rather insupportable person whom [Gregory]112-gregory had first encountered in [the little garden of [Saffron Park]2-saffron park]480-the little garden of saffron park]479-that elegant and rather insupportable person whom gregory had first encountered in the little garden of saffron park . Before [he]93-syme finally left [the police]2193-the police premises [[his]93-syme friend]477-his friend provided [him]93-syme with a small blue card , on which was written , " [The Last Crusade]2544-the last crusade , "[2193-the police] and a number , the sign of [his]93-syme official authority . [He]93-syme put this carefully in [his]93-syme upper waistcoat pocket , lit a cigarette , and went forth to track and fight [the enemy]483-the enemy in [all the drawing - rooms of [London]3-london]484-all the drawing - rooms of london . Where [his]93-syme adventure ultimately led [him]93-syme [we]485-we have already seen . At about half - past one on a February night [he]93-syme found [himself]93-syme steaming in a small tug up [the silent Thames]28-the thames , armed with swordstick and revolver , [the duly elected Thursday of [the Central Council of Anarchists]487-the central council of anarchists]486-the duly elected thursday of the central council of anarchists .

When [Syme]93-syme stepped out on to [the steam - tug]2319-the steam - tug [he]93-syme had a singular sensation of stepping out into something entirely new ; not merely into the landscape of [a new land]489-a new land , but even into the landscape of [a new planet]490-a new planet . This was mainly due to the insane yet solid decision of that evening , though partly also to an entire change in the weather and the sky since [he]93-syme entered [the little tavern]491-the little tavern some two hours before . Every trace of the passionate plumage of the cloudy sunset had been swept away , and a naked moon stood in a naked sky . The moon was so strong and full that ( by a paradox often to be noticed ) it seemed like a weaker sun . It gave , not the sense of bright moonshine , but rather of a dead daylight .

Over [the whole landscape]492-the whole landscape lay a luminous and unnatural discoloration , as of that disastrous twilight which [Milton]123-milton spoke of as shed by the sun in eclipse ; so that [Syme]93-syme fell easily into [his]93-syme first thought , that [he]93-syme was actually on [some other and emptier planet , which circled round some sadder star]493-some other and emptier planet , which circled round some sadder star . But the more [he]93-syme felt this glittering desolation in [the moonlit land]494-the moonlit land , the more [his]93-syme own chivalric folly glowed in the night like a great fire . Even the common things [he]93-syme carried with [him]93-syme the food and the brandy and the loaded pistol took on exactly that concrete and material poetry which [a child]495-a child feels when [he]495-a child takes a gun upon a journey or a bun with [him]495-a child to bed . The sword - stick and the brandy - flask , though in themselves only the tools of [morbid conspirators]496-morbid conspirators , became the expressions of [his]93-syme own more healthy romance . The sword - stick became almost the sword of chivalry , and the brandy the wine of the stirrup - cup . For even the most dehumanised modern fantasies depend on [some older and simpler figure]497-some older and simpler figure ; the adventures may be mad , but [the adventurer]498-the adventurer must be sane . The dragon without [St. George]124-george would not even be grotesque . So this inhuman landscape was only imaginative by the presence of [a man really human]499-a man really human . To [Syme]93-syme 's exaggerative mind [the bright , bleak houses and terraces by [the Thames]28-the thames]500-the bright , bleak houses and terraces by the thames looked as empty as [the mountains of the moon]501-the mountains of the moon . But even the moon is only poetical because there is [a man in the moon]502-a man in the moon .

The tug was worked by [two men]503-two men , and with much toil went comparatively slowly . The clear moon that had lit up [Chiswick]29-chiswick had gone down by the time that [they]503-two men passed [Battersea]30-battersea , and when [they]503-two men came under the enormous bulk of Westminster day had already begun to break . It broke like the splitting of great bars of lead , showing bars of silver ; and these had brightened like white fire when the tug , changing its onward course , turned inward to a large landing stage rather beyond [Charing Cross]31-charing cross .

[The great stones of [the Embankment]32-the embankment]504-the great stones of the embankment seemed equally dark and gigantic as [Syme]93-syme looked up at [them]504-the great stones of the embankment . [They]504-the great stones of the embankment were big and black against the huge white dawn . They made [him]93-syme feel that [he]93-syme was landing on the colossal steps of [some Egyptian palace]505-some egyptian palace ; and , indeed , the thing suited [his]93-syme mood , for [he]93-syme was , in [his]93-syme own mind , mounting to attack the solid thrones of [horrible and heathen kings]506-horrible and heathen kings . [He]93-syme leapt out of [the boat]2414-the boat on to one slimy step , and stood , [a dark and slender figure , amid the enormous masonry]508-a dark and slender figure , amid the enormous masonry . [The two men in the tug]509-the two men in the tug put [her]510-her off again and turned up [stream]511-stream . [They]509-the two men in the tug had never spoken a word .

CHAPTER V. [THE FEAST OF FEAR]512-the feast of fear

At first the large stone stair seemed to [Syme]93-syme as deserted as [a pyramid]513-a pyramid ; but before [he]93-syme reached the top [he]93-syme had realised that there was [a man leaning over the parapet of [the Embankment]439-the embankment and looking out across [the river]2282-the river]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river . As [a figure]517-a figure [he]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river was quite conventional , clad in a silk hat and frock - coat of the more formal type of fashion ; [he]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river had a red flower in [his]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river buttonhole . As [Syme]93-syme drew nearer to [him]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river step by step , [he]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river did not even move a hair ; and [Syme]93-syme could come close enough to notice even in the dim , pale morning light that [his]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river face was long , pale and intellectual , and ended in a small triangular tuft of dark beard at the very point of the chin , all else being clean - shaven . This scrap of hair almost seemed a mere oversight ; the rest of the face was of the type that is best shaven clear - cut , ascetic , and in its way noble . [Syme]93-syme drew closer and closer , noting all this , and still [the figure]518-the figure did not stir .

At first an instinct had told [Syme]93-syme that this was [the man whom [he]93-syme was meant to meet]519-the man whom he was meant to meet . Then , seeing that [the man]315-the man made no sign , [he]93-syme had concluded that [he]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river was not . And now again [he]93-syme had come back to a certainty that [the man]315-the man had something to do with [his]514-a man leaning over the parapet of the embankment and looking out across the river mad adventure . For [the man]315-the man remained more still than would have been natural if [a stranger]523-a stranger had come so close . [He]315-the man was as motionless as a wax - work , and got on the nerves somewhat in the same way . [Syme]93-syme looked again and again at the pale , dignified and delicate face , and the face still looked blankly across [the river]2282-the river . Then [he]93-syme took out of [his]93-syme pocket the note from Buttons proving [his]93-syme election , and put it before that sad and beautiful face . Then [the man]315-the man smiled , and [his]315-the man smile was a shock , for it was all on one side , going up in the right cheek and down in the left .

There was nothing , rationally speaking , to scare [anyone]2313-anyone about this . [Many people]527-many people have this nervous trick of a crooked smile , and in many it is even attractive . But in all [Syme]93-syme 's circumstances , with the dark dawn and the deadly errand and the loneliness on the great dripping stones , there was something unnerving in it .

There was [the silent river]528-the silent river and [the silent man]529-the silent man , [a man of even classic face]530-a man of even classic face . And there was the last nightmare touch that [his]315-the man smile suddenly went wrong .

The spasm of smile was instantaneous , and [the man]315-the man 's face dropped at once into its harmonious melancholy . [He]315-the man spoke without further explanation or inquiry , like [a man]240-a man speaking to [an old colleague]533-an old colleague .

" If [we]2545-we walk up towards [Leicester Square]33-leicester square , "[315-the man] [he]315-the man said , " [we]2545-we shall just be in time for breakfast . [Sunday]110-sunday always insists on an early breakfast . Have [you]93-syme had any sleep ? "[315-the man]

" No , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme .

" Nor have [I]315-the man , "[315-the man] answered [the man]315-the man in an ordinary tone . " [I]315-the man shall try to get to bed after breakfast . "[315-the man]

[He]315-the man spoke with casual civility , but in an utterly dead voice that contradicted the fanaticism of [his]315-the man face . It seemed almost as if all friendly words were to [him]315-the man lifeless conveniences , and that [his]315-the man only life was hate . After a pause [the man]315-the man spoke again .

" Of course , [the Secretary of the branch]2546-the secretary of the branch told [you]93-syme everything that can be told . But the one thing that can never be told is the last notion of [the President]2547-the president , for [his]2547-the president notions grow like [a tropical forest]2548-a tropical forest . So in case [you]93-syme do n't know , [I]315-the man 'd better tell [you]93-syme that [he]2547-the president is carrying out [his]2547-the president notion of concealing [ourselves]2549-we by not concealing [ourselves]2549-we to the most extraordinary lengths just now . Originally , of course , [we]2549-we met in [a cell underground]2550-a cell underground , just as [your]93-syme branch does . Then [Sunday]110-sunday made [us]2549-we take [a private room at [an ordinary restaurant]2552-an ordinary restaurant]2551-a private room at an ordinary restaurant . [He]2547-the president said that if [you]93-syme did n't seem to be hiding [nobody]2260-nobody hunted [you]93-syme out . Well , [he]2547-the president is [the only man on [earth]2207-earth]2554-the only man on earth , [I]315-the man know ; but sometimes [I]315-the man really think that [his]2547-the president huge brain is going a little mad in its old age . For now [we]2549-we flaunt [ourselves]2549-we before [the public]2556-the public . [We]2549-we have [our]2549-we breakfast on a balcony on [a balcony]2557-a balcony , if [you]93-syme please overlooking [Leicester Square]33-leicester square . "[315-the man]

" And what do [the people]212-the people say ? "[93-syme] asked [Syme]93-syme .

" It 's quite simple what [they]212-the people say , "[536-his guide] answered [[his]93-syme guide]536-his guide . " [They]212-the people say [we]2549-we are a lot of [jolly gentlemen who pretend [they]212-the people are [anarchists]371-anarchists]2559-jolly gentlemen who pretend they are anarchists . "[315-the man]

" It seems to [me]93-syme a very clever idea , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme .

" Clever ! [God]90-god blast [your]300-the other impudence ! Clever ! "[300-the other] cried out [the other]300-the other in a sudden , shrill voice which was as startling and discordant as [his]300-the other crooked smile . " When [you]300-the other 've seen [Sunday]110-sunday for a split second [you]300-the other 'll leave off calling [him]110-sunday clever . "[300-the other]

With this [they]538-they emerged out of [a narrow street]539-a narrow street , and saw the early sunlight filling [Leicester Square]33-leicester square . It will never be known , [I]0-i suppose , why [this square]540-this square [itself]540-this square should look so alien and in some ways so continental . It will never be known whether it was the foreign look that attracted [the foreigners]541-the foreigners or [the foreigners who gave it the foreign look]542-the foreigners who gave it the foreign look . But on this particular morning the effect seemed singularly bright and clear . Between [the open square]543-the open square and the sunlit leaves and the statue and the Saracenic outlines of [the Alhambra]34-the alhambra , [it]540-this square looked the replica of some French or even [Spanish public place]544-spanish public place . And this effect increased in [Syme]93-syme the sensation , which in many shapes [he]93-syme had had through the whole adventure , the eerie sensation of having strayed into [a new world]545-a new world . As a fact , [he]93-syme had bought bad cigars round [Leicester Square]33-leicester square ever since [he]93-syme was [a boy]546-a boy . But as [he]93-syme turned that corner , and saw the trees and the Moorish cupolas , [he]93-syme could have sworn that [he]93-syme was turning into [an unknown Place de something]547-an unknown place de something or other in [some foreign town]548-some foreign town .

At one corner of [the square]549-the square there projected a kind of angle of [a prosperous but quiet hotel]550-a prosperous but quiet hotel , the bulk of which belonged to [a street]551-a street behind . In the wall there was one large French window , probably the window of [a large coffee - room]552-a large coffee - room ; and outside this window , almost literally overhanging [the square]549-the square , was a formidably buttressed balcony , big enough to contain a dining - table . In fact , [it]554-it did contain a dining - table , or more strictly a breakfast - table ; and round the breakfast - table , glowing in the sunlight and evident to [the street]298-the street , were a group of [noisy and talkative men , all dressed in the insolence of fashion]556-noisy and talkative men , all dressed in the insolence of fashion , with white waistcoats and expensive button - holes . Some of [their]556-noisy and talkative men , all dressed in the insolence of fashion jokes could almost be heard across [the square]549-the square . Then [the grave Secretary]558-the grave secretary gave [his]558-the grave secretary unnatural smile , and [Syme]93-syme knew that this boisterous breakfast party was [the secret conclave of [the European Dynamiters]560-the european dynamiters]559-the secret conclave of the european dynamiters .

Then , as [Syme]93-syme continued to stare at [them]556-noisy and talkative men , all dressed in the insolence of fashion , [he]93-syme saw something that [he]93-syme had not seen before . [He]93-syme had not seen it literally because it was too large to see . At the nearest end of [the balcony]561-the balcony , blocking up a great part of the perspective , was the back of [a great mountain of [a man]240-a man]562-a great mountain of a man . When [Syme]93-syme had seen [him]240-a man , [his]93-syme first thought was that the weight of [him]240-a man must break down [the balcony of stone]564-the balcony of stone . [His]240-a man vastness did not lie only in the fact that [he]240-a man was abnormally tall and quite incredibly fat . [This man]2311-this man was planned enormously in [his]240-a man original proportions , like a statue carved deliberately as colossal . [His]240-a man head , crowned with white hair , as seen from behind looked bigger than a head ought to be . The ears that stood out from it looked larger than human ears . [He]240-a man was enlarged terribly to scale ; and this sense of size was so staggering , that when [Syme]93-syme saw [him]240-a man [all the other figures]566-all the other figures seemed quite suddenly to dwindle and become dwarfish . [They]566-all the other figures were still sitting there as before with [their]566-all the other figures flowers and frock - coats , but now it looked as if [the big man]567-the big man was entertaining [five children]568-five children to tea .

As [Syme]93-syme and [the guide]569-the guide approached the side door of [the hotel]570-the hotel , [a waiter]571-a waiter came out smiling with every tooth in [his]571-a waiter head .

" [The gentlemen]2561-the gentlemen are up there , [sare]2562-sare , "[571-a waiter] [he]571-a waiter said . " [They]2561-the gentlemen do talk and [they]2561-the gentlemen do laugh at what [they]2561-the gentlemen talk . [They]2561-the gentlemen do say [they]2561-the gentlemen will throw bombs at [ze king]2563-ze king . "[571-a waiter]

And [the waiter]572-the waiter hurried away with a napkin over [his]571-a waiter arm , much pleased with the singular frivolity of [the gentlemen]2561-the gentlemen [upstairs]574-upstairs .

[The two men]575-the two men mounted [the stairs]576-the stairs in silence .

[Syme]93-syme had never thought of asking whether [the monstrous man who almost filled and broke the balcony]577-the monstrous man who almost filled and broke the balcony was [the great President of whom [the others]579-the others stood in awe]578-the great president of whom the others stood in awe . [He]93-syme knew it was so , with an unaccountable but instantaneous certainty . [Syme]93-syme , indeed , was one of [those men who are open to all the more nameless psychological influences in a degree a little dangerous to mental health]580-those men who are open to all the more nameless psychological influences in a degree a little dangerous to mental health . Utterly devoid of fear in physical dangers , [he]93-syme was a great deal too sensitive to the smell of spiritual evil . Twice already that night little unmeaning things had peeped out at [him]93-syme almost pruriently , and given [him]93-syme a sense of drawing nearer and nearer to [the head - quarters of hell]581-the head - quarters of hell . And this sense became overpowering as [he]93-syme drew nearer to [the great President]582-the great president .

The form it took was a childish and yet hateful fancy . As [he]93-syme walked across [the inner room]583-the inner room towards [the balcony]561-the balcony , the large face of [Sunday]110-sunday grew larger and larger ; and [Syme]93-syme was gripped with a fear that when [he]93-syme was quite close the face would be too big to be possible , and that [he]93-syme would scream aloud . [He]93-syme remembered that as [a child]495-a child [he]93-syme would not look at the mask of [Memnon]125-memnon in [the British Museum]586-the british museum , because it was a face , and so large .

By an effort , braver than that of leaping over [a cliff]587-a cliff , [he]93-syme went to an empty seat at the breakfast - table and sat down . [The men]588-the men greeted [him]93-syme with good - humoured raillery as if [they]588-the men had always known [him]93-syme . [He]93-syme sobered [himself]93-syme a little by looking at [their]588-the men conventional coats and solid , shining coffee - pot ; then [he]93-syme looked again at [Sunday]110-sunday . [His]110-sunday face was very large , but it was still possible to humanity .

In the presence of [the President]2547-the president [the whole company]590-the whole company looked sufficiently commonplace ; nothing about [them]590-the whole company caught the eye at first , except that by [the President]2547-the president 's caprice [they]590-the whole company had been dressed up with a festive respectability , which gave the meal the look of a wedding breakfast . [One man]592-one man indeed stood out at even a superficial glance . [He]592-one man at least was [the common or garden Dynamiter]593-the common or garden dynamiter . [He]592-one man wore , indeed , the high white collar and satin tie that were the uniform of the occasion ; but out of this collar there sprang [a head quite unmanageable and quite unmistakable , a bewildering bush of brown hair and beard that almost obscured the eyes like those of a Skye terrier]594-a head quite unmanageable and quite unmistakable , a bewildering bush of brown hair and beard that almost obscured the eyes like those of a skye terrier . But the eyes did look out of the tangle , and they were the sad eyes of [some Russian serf]595-some russian serf . The effect of [this figure]596-this figure was not terrible like that of [the President]2547-the president , but it had every diablerie that can come from the utterly grotesque . If out of that stiff tie and collar there had come abruptly the head of a cat or a dog , it could not have been a more idiotic contrast .

[The man]315-the man 's name , it seemed , was [Gogol]126-gogol ; [he]315-the man was [a Pole]599-a pole , and in this circle of days [he]315-the man was called [Tuesday]127-tuesday . [His]315-the man soul and speech were incurably tragic ; [he]315-the man could not force [himself]315-the man to play the prosperous and frivolous part demanded of [him]315-the man by [President Sunday]110-sunday . And , indeed , when [Syme]93-syme came in [the President]2547-the president , with that daring disregard of public suspicion which was [his]2547-the president policy , was actually chaffing [Gogol]126-gogol upon [his]315-the man inability to assume conventional graces .

" [[Our]2564-our friend]2565-our friend [Tuesday]127-tuesday , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president in a deep voice at once of quietude and volume , " [[our]2564-our friend]2565-our friend [Tuesday]127-tuesday does n't seem to grasp the idea . [He]315-the man dresses up like [a gentleman]2209-a gentleman , but [he]315-the man seems to be too great a soul to behave like [one]244-one . [He]315-the man insists on the ways of [the stage conspirator]2569-the stage conspirator . Now if [a gentleman]2209-a gentleman goes about [London]3-london in a top hat and a frock - coat , [no one]2257-no one need know that [he]2209-a gentleman is [an anarchist]2127-an anarchist . But if [a gentleman]2209-a gentleman puts on a top hat and a frock - coat , and then goes about on [his]2209-a gentleman hands and knees well , [he]2209-a gentleman may attract attention . That 's what [Brother Gogol]126-gogol does . [He]126-gogol goes about on [his]126-gogol hands and knees with such inexhaustible diplomacy , that by this time [he]126-gogol finds it quite difficult to walk upright . "[2547-the president]

" [I]126-gogol am not good at concealment , "[126-gogol] said [Gogol]126-gogol sulkily , with a thick foreign accent ; " [I]126-gogol am not ashamed of the cause . "[126-gogol]

" Yes [you]126-gogol are , [[my]2547-the president boy]2574-my boy , and so is the cause of [you]126-gogol , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president good - naturedly . " [You]126-gogol hide as much as [anybody]2507-anybody ; but [you]126-gogol ca n't do it , [you]126-gogol see , [you]126-gogol 're such [an ass]2284-an ass ! [You]126-gogol try to combine two inconsistent methods . When [a householder]2577-a householder finds [a man]240-a man under [his]2577-a householder bed , [he]2577-a householder will probably pause to note the circumstance . But if [he]2577-a householder finds [a man]240-a man under [his]2577-a householder bed in a top hat , [you]127-tuesday will agree with [me]2547-the president , [[my]2547-the president dear]2169-my dear [Tuesday]127-tuesday , that [he]2577-a householder is not likely even to forget it . " [I]127-tuesday am not good at deception , "[127-tuesday] said [Tuesday]127-tuesday gloomily , flushing .

" Right , [[my]2547-the president boy]2574-my boy , right , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president with a ponderous heartiness , " [you]2574-my boy are n't good at anything . "[2547-the president]

While this stream of conversation continued , [Syme]93-syme was looking more steadily at [the men around [him]93-syme]604-the men around him . As [he]93-syme did so , [he]93-syme gradually felt all [his]93-syme sense of something spiritually queer return .

[He]93-syme had thought at first that [they]604-the men around him were all of common stature and costume , with the evident exception of [the hairy Gogol]126-gogol . But as [he]93-syme looked at [the others]579-the others , [he]93-syme began to see in each of [them]604-the men around him exactly what [he]93-syme had seen in [the man by [the river]2282-the river]606-the man by the river , a demoniac detail somewhere . That lop - sided laugh , which would suddenly disfigure the fine face of [[his]93-syme original guide]608-his original guide , was typical of all these types . [Each man]609-each man had something about [him]609-each man , perceived perhaps at the tenth or twentieth glance , which was not normal , and which seemed hardly human . The only metaphor [he]93-syme could think of was this , that [they]604-the men around him all looked as [men of fashion and presence would look , with the additional twist given in a false and curved mirror]610-men of fashion and presence would look , with the additional twist given in a false and curved mirror .

Only the individual examples will express this half - concealed eccentricity . [[Syme]93-syme 's original cicerone]611-syme 's original cicerone bore the title of Monday ; [he]93-syme was [the Secretary of the Council]612-the secretary of the council , and [his]93-syme twisted smile was regarded with more terror than anything , except [the President]2547-the president 's horrible , happy laughter . But now that [Syme]93-syme had more space and light to observe [him]93-syme , there were other touches . [His]93-syme fine face was so emaciated , that [Syme]93-syme thought it must be wasted with some disease ; yet somehow the very distress of [his]93-syme dark eyes denied this . It was no physical ill that troubled [him]93-syme . [His]93-syme eyes were alive with intellectual torture , as if pure thought was pain .

[He]93-syme was typical of each of [the tribe]614-the tribe ; [each man]609-each man was subtly and differently wrong . Next to [him]93-syme sat [Tuesday]127-tuesday , the tousle - headed [Gogol]126-gogol , [a man more obviously mad]616-a man more obviously mad . Next was [Wednesday]129-wednesday , a certain [Marquis de St. Eustache]130-the marquis , [a sufficiently characteristic figure]617-a sufficiently characteristic figure . The first few glances found nothing unusual about [him]93-syme , except that [he]93-syme was [the only man at table who wore the fashionable clothes as if they were really [his]93-syme own]618-the only man at table who wore the fashionable clothes as if they were really his own . [He]93-syme had a black French beard cut square and a black English frock - coat cut even squarer . But [Syme]93-syme , sensitive to such things , felt somehow that [the man]315-the man carried a rich atmosphere with [him]93-syme , a rich atmosphere that suffocated . It reminded one irrationally of drowsy odours and of dying lamps in the darker poems of [Byron]131-byron and [Poe]132-poe . With this went a sense of [his]93-syme being clad , not in lighter colours , but in softer materials ; [his]93-syme black seemed richer and warmer than the black shades about [him]93-syme , as if it were compounded of profound colour . [His]93-syme black coat looked as if it were only black by being too dense a purple . [His]93-syme black beard looked as if it were only black by being too deep a blue . And in the gloom and thickness of the beard [his]93-syme dark red mouth showed sensual and scornful . Whatever [he]93-syme was [he]93-syme was not [a Frenchman]620-a frenchman ; [he]93-syme might be [a Jew]621-a jew ; [he]93-syme might be something deeper yet in [the dark heart of [the East]35-the east]622-the dark heart of the east . In the bright coloured Persian tiles and pictures showing [tyrants]623-tyrants hunting , [you]624-you may see just those almond eyes , those blue - black beards , those cruel , crimson lips .

Then came [Syme]93-syme , and next [a very old man]625-a very old man , [Professor de Worms]133-professor de worms , who still kept the chair of Friday , though every day it was expected that [his]93-syme death would leave [it]626-it empty . Save for [his]93-syme intellect , [he]93-syme was in the last dissolution of senile decay . [His]93-syme face was as grey as [his]93-syme long grey beard , [his]93-syme forehead was lifted and fixed finally in a furrow of mild despair . In no other case , not even that of [Gogol]126-gogol , did [the bridegroom brilliancy of the morning dress]627-the bridegroom brilliancy of the morning dress express a more painful contrast . For the red flower in [his]93-syme button - hole showed up against a face that was literally discoloured like lead ; the whole hideous effect was as if [some drunken dandies]628-some drunken dandies had put [their]628-some drunken dandies clothes upon a corpse . When [he]93-syme rose or sat down , which was with long labour and peril , something worse was expressed than mere weakness , something indefinably connected with the horror of the whole scene . It did not express decrepitude merely , but corruption . Another hateful fancy crossed [Syme]93-syme 's quivering mind . [He]93-syme could not help thinking that whenever [the man]315-the man moved a leg or arm might fall off .

Right at the end sat [the man called [Saturday]134-saturday]630-the man called saturday , [the simplest and the most baffling of all]631-the simplest and the most baffling of all . [He]630-the man called saturday was [a short , square man with a dark , square face clean - shaven]632-a short , square man with a dark , square face clean - shaven , [a medical practitioner going by the name of Bull]633-a medical practitioner going by the name of bull . [He]630-the man called saturday had that combination of _ savoir - faire _ with a sort of well - groomed coarseness which is not uncommon in [young doctors]634-young doctors . [He]630-the man called saturday carried [his]630-the man called saturday fine clothes with confidence rather than ease , and [he]630-the man called saturday mostly wore a set smile . There was nothing whatever odd about [him]630-the man called saturday , except that [he]630-the man called saturday wore a pair of dark , almost opaque spectacles . It may have been merely a crescendo of nervous fancy that had gone before , but those black discs were dreadful to [Syme]93-syme ; they reminded [him]93-syme of half - remembered ugly tales , of some story about pennies being put on the eyes of the dead . [Syme]93-syme 's eye always caught the black glasses and the blind grin . Had [the dying Professor]635-the dying professor worn them , or even [the pale Secretary]636-the pale secretary , they would have been appropriate . But on [the younger and grosser man]637-the younger and grosser man [they]638-they seemed only an enigma . [They]638-they took away the key of the face . [You]639-you could not tell what [his]630-the man called saturday smile or [his]630-the man called saturday gravity meant . Partly from this , and partly because [he]630-the man called saturday had a vulgar virility wanting in most of the others it seemed to [Syme]93-syme that [he]630-the man called saturday might be [the wickedest of all [those wicked men]641-those wicked men]640-the wickedest of all those wicked men . [Syme]93-syme even had the thought that [his]630-the man called saturday eyes might be covered up because they were too frightful to see .

CHAPTER VI . THE EXPOSURE

Such were [the six men who had sworn to destroy [the world]182-the world]642-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world . Again and again [Syme]93-syme strove to pull together [his]93-syme common sense in [their]642-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world presence . Sometimes [he]93-syme saw for an instant that these notions were subjective , that [he]93-syme was only looking at [ordinary men]644-ordinary men , [one of whom was old]645-one of whom was old , [another nervous]646-another nervous , another short - sighted . The sense of an unnatural symbolism always settled back on [him]93-syme again . [Each figure]647-each figure seemed to be , somehow , on the borderland of things , just as [their]642-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world theory was on the borderland of thought . [He]93-syme knew that [each one of [these men]2389-these men]648-each one of these men stood at the extreme end , so to speak , of some wild road of reasoning . [He]93-syme could only fancy , as in some old - world fable , that if [a man]240-a man went westward to [the end of [the world]182-the world]651-the end of the world [he]240-a man would find something say a tree that was more or less than a tree , a tree possessed by [a spirit]653-a spirit ; and that if [he]240-a man went [east to the end of the world]654-east to the end of the world [he]240-a man would find something else that was not wholly itself a tower , perhaps , of which the very shape was wicked . So these figures seemed to stand up , violent and unaccountable , against an ultimate horizon , visions from the verge . The ends of [the earth]253-the earth were closing in .

Talk had been going on steadily as [he]93-syme took in the scene ; and not the least of the contrasts of that bewildering breakfast - table was the contrast between the easy and unobtrusive tone of talk and its terrible purport . [They]642-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world were deep in the discussion of an actual and immediate plot . [The waiter downstairs]656-the waiter downstairs had spoken quite correctly when [he]656-the waiter downstairs said that [they]642-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world were talking about bombs and [kings]657-kings . Only three days afterwards [the Czar]658-the czar was to meet [the President of [the French Republic]660-the french republic]659-the president of the french republic in [Paris]36-paris , and over [their]642-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world bacon and eggs upon [[their]642-the six men who had sworn to destroy the world sunny balcony]661-their sunny balcony [these beaming gentlemen]662-these beaming gentlemen had decided how [both]663-both should die . [Even the instrument]664-even the instrument was chosen ; [the black - bearded Marquis]665-the black - bearded marquis , it appeared , was to carry the bomb .

Ordinarily speaking , the proximity of this positive and objective crime would have sobered [Syme]93-syme , and cured [him]93-syme of all [his]93-syme merely mystical tremors . [He]93-syme would have thought of nothing but the need of saving [at least two human bodies]666-at least two human bodies from being ripped in pieces with iron and roaring gas . But the truth was that by this time [he]93-syme had begun to feel a third kind of fear , more piercing and practical than either [his]93-syme moral revulsion or [his]93-syme social responsibility . Very simply , [he]93-syme had no fear to spare for [the French President]110-sunday or [the Czar]658-the czar ; [he]93-syme had begun to fear for [himself]93-syme . [Most of [the talkers]669-the talkers]668-most of the talkers took little heed of [him]93-syme , debating now with [their]668-most of the talkers faces closer together , and almost uniformly grave , save when for an instant the smile of [the Secretary]670-the secretary ran aslant across [his]93-syme face as the jagged lightning runs aslant across the sky . But there was one persistent thing which first troubled [Syme]93-syme and at last terrified [him]93-syme . [The President]2547-the president was always looking at [him]93-syme , steadily , and with a great and baffling interest . [The enormous man]672-the enormous man was quite quiet , but [his]672-the enormous man blue eyes stood out of [his]672-the enormous man head . And they were always fixed on [Syme]93-syme .

[Syme]93-syme felt moved to spring up and leap over [the balcony]561-the balcony . When [the President]2547-the president 's eyes were on [him]93-syme [he]93-syme felt as if [he]93-syme were made of glass . [He]93-syme had hardly the shred of a doubt that in some silent and extraordinary way [Sunday]110-sunday had found out that [he]93-syme was [a spy]675-a spy . [He]93-syme looked over the edge of [the balcony]561-the balcony , and saw [a policeman]2304-a policeman , standing abstractedly just beneath , staring at the bright railings and the sunlit trees .

Then there fell upon [him]93-syme the great temptation that was to torment [him]93-syme for many days . In the presence of [these powerful and repulsive men , who were [the princes of anarchy]679-the princes of anarchy]678-these powerful and repulsive men , who were the princes of anarchy , [he]93-syme had almost forgotten the frail and fanciful figure of [the poet [Gregory]112-gregory]680-the poet gregory , [the mere aesthete of anarchism]681-the mere aesthete of anarchism . [He]93-syme even thought of [him]680-the poet gregory now with an old kindness , as if [they]682-they had played together when [children]683-children . But [he]93-syme remembered that [he]93-syme was still tied to [Gregory]112-gregory by a great promise . [He]93-syme had promised never to do the very thing that [he]93-syme now felt [himself]93-syme almost in the act of doing . [He]93-syme had promised not to jump over [that balcony]684-that balcony and speak to [that policeman]685-that policeman . [He]93-syme took [his]93-syme cold hand off the cold stone balustrade . [His]93-syme soul swayed in a vertigo of moral indecision . [He]93-syme had only to snap the thread of a rash vow made to a villainous society , and all [his]93-syme life could be as open and sunny as [the square beneath [him]93-syme]686-the square beneath him . [He]93-syme had , on the other hand , only to keep [his]93-syme antiquated honour , and be delivered inch by inch into the power of [this great enemy of mankind , whose very intellect was a torture - chamber]687-this great enemy of mankind , whose very intellect was a torture - chamber . Whenever [he]93-syme looked down into [the square]549-the square [he]93-syme saw [the comfortable policeman]689-the comfortable policeman , [a pillar of common sense and common order]690-a pillar of common sense and common order . Whenever [he]93-syme looked back at the breakfast - table [he]93-syme saw [the President]2547-the president still quietly studying [him]93-syme with big , unbearable eyes .

In all the torrent of [his]93-syme thought there were two thoughts that never crossed [his]93-syme mind . First , it never occurred to [him]93-syme to doubt that [the President]2547-the president and [[his]2547-the president Council]693-his council could crush [him]93-syme if [he]93-syme continued to stand alone . [The place]214-the place might be public , the project might seem impossible . But [Sunday]110-sunday was not [the man who would carry [himself]110-sunday thus easily without having , somehow or somewhere , set open [his]110-sunday iron trap]695-the man who would carry himself thus easily without having , somehow or somewhere , set open his iron trap . Either by anonymous poison or sudden street accident , by hypnotism or by fire from hell , [Sunday]110-sunday could certainly strike [him]93-syme . If [he]93-syme defied [the man]315-the man [he]93-syme was probably dead , either struck stiff there in [his]93-syme chair or long afterwards as by an innocent ailment . If [he]93-syme called in [the police]2193-the police promptly , arrested [everyone]291-everyone , told all , and set against [them]2193-the police the whole energy of [England]14-england , [he]93-syme would probably escape ; certainly not otherwise . [They]2193-the police were [a balconyful of [gentlemen]700-gentlemen overlooking [a bright and busy square]701-a bright and busy square]699-a balconyful of gentlemen overlooking a bright and busy square ; but [he]93-syme felt no more safe with [them]2193-the police than if [they]2193-the police had been [a boatful of armed pirates overlooking [an empty sea]703-an empty sea]702-a boatful of armed pirates overlooking an empty sea .

There was a second thought that never came to [him]93-syme . It never occurred to [him]93-syme to be spiritually won over to [the enemy]483-the enemy . [Many moderns , inured to a weak worship of intellect and force]705-many moderns , inured to a weak worship of intellect and force , might have wavered in [their]705-many moderns , inured to a weak worship of intellect and force allegiance under this oppression of a great personality . [They]705-many moderns , inured to a weak worship of intellect and force might have called [Sunday]110-sunday [the super - man]706-the super - man . If [any such creature]707-any such creature be conceivable , [he]110-sunday looked , indeed , somewhat like [it]708-it , with [his]110-sunday earth - shaking abstraction , as of a stone statue walking . [He]110-sunday might have been called [something above man]709-something above man , with [his]110-sunday large plans , which were too obvious to be detected , with [his]110-sunday large face , which was too frank to be understood . But this was a kind of modern meanness to which [Syme]93-syme could not sink even in [his]93-syme extreme morbidity . Like [any man]710-any man , [he]110-sunday was coward enough to fear great force ; but [he]110-sunday was not quite coward enough to admire it .

[The men]588-the men were eating as [they]588-the men talked , and even in this [they]588-the men were typical . [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull and [the Marquis]712-the marquis ate casually and conventionally of the best things on the table cold pheasant or Strasbourg pie . But [the Secretary]670-the secretary was a vegetarian , and [he]670-the secretary spoke earnestly of the projected murder over half a raw tomato and three quarters of a glass of tepid water . [The old Professor]714-the old professor had such slops as suggested a sickening second childhood . And even in [this President]715-this president Sunday preserved [his]110-sunday curious predominance of mere mass . For [he]110-sunday ate like [twenty men]716-twenty men ; [he]110-sunday ate incredibly , with a frightful freshness of appetite , so that it was like watching [a sausage factory]717-a sausage factory . Yet continually , when [he]110-sunday had swallowed a dozen crumpets or drunk a quart of coffee , [he]110-sunday would be found with [his]110-sunday great head on one side staring at [Syme]93-syme .

" [I]712-the marquis have often wondered , "[712-the marquis] said [the Marquis]712-the marquis , taking a great bite out of a slice of bread and jam , " whether it would n't be better for [me]712-the marquis to do it with a knife . Most of the best things have been brought off with a knife . And it would be a new emotion to get a knife into [a French President]2582-a french president and wriggle it round . "[712-the marquis]

" [You]670-the secretary are wrong , "[670-the secretary] said [the Secretary]670-the secretary , drawing [his]670-the secretary black brows together . " The knife was merely the expression of the old personal quarrel with [a personal tyrant]2583-a personal tyrant . Dynamite is not only [our]2584-our best tool , but [our]2584-our best symbol . It is as perfect a symbol of [us]2584-our as is incense of the prayers of [the Christians]136-the christians . It expands ; it only destroys because it broadens ; even so , thought only destroys because it broadens . [The old Professor]714-the old professor was staring at the ceiling with dull eyes .

[Syme]93-syme stood up before [any of [the others]579-the others]724-any of the others . The instant of choice had come at last , the pistol was at [his]93-syme head . On [the pavement]726-the pavement before [he]93-syme could hear [the policeman]451-the policeman idly stir and stamp , for the morning , though bright , was cold .

A barrel - organ in [the street]298-the street suddenly sprang with a jerk into a jovial tune . [Syme]93-syme stood up taut , as if it had been a bugle before the battle . [He]93-syme found [himself]93-syme filled with a supernatural courage that came from nowhere . That jingling music seemed full of the vivacity , the vulgarity , and the irrational valour of [the poor]2423-the poor , who in all [those unclean streets]730-those unclean streets were all clinging to the decencies and the charities of [Christendom]37-christendom . [His]93-syme youthful prank of being [a policeman]2304-a policeman had faded from [his]93-syme mind ; [he]93-syme did not think of [himself]93-syme as [the representative of [the corps of [gentlemen]700-gentlemen]733-the corps of gentlemen turned into [fancy constables]735-fancy constables , or of [the old eccentric who lived in [the dark room]737-the dark room]736-the old eccentric who lived in the dark room]732-the representative of the corps of gentlemen turned into fancy constables , or of the old eccentric who lived in the dark room . But [he]93-syme did feel [himself]93-syme as [the ambassador of [all these common and kindly people in [the street]298-the street]739-all these common and kindly people in the street [, who every day marched into battle to the music of the barrel - organ]741-, who every day marched into battle to the music of the barrel - organ]738-the ambassador of all these common and kindly people in the street , who every day marched into battle to the music of the barrel - organ . And this high pride in being human had lifted [him]93-syme unaccountably to an infinite height above [the monstrous men around [him]93-syme]742-the monstrous men around him . For an instant , at least , [he]93-syme looked down upon all [their]739-all these common and kindly people in the street sprawling eccentricities from the starry pinnacle of the commonplace . [He]93-syme felt towards [them]739-all these common and kindly people in the street all that unconscious and elementary superiority that [a brave man]743-a brave man feels over powerful beasts or [a wise man over powerful errors]744-a wise man over powerful errors . [He]93-syme knew that [he]93-syme had neither the intellectual nor the physical strength of [President Sunday]110-sunday ; but in that moment [he]93-syme minded it no more than the fact that [he]93-syme had not the muscles of a tiger or a horn on [his]93-syme nose like a rhinoceros . All was swallowed up in an ultimate certainty that [the President]2547-the president was wrong and that the barrel - organ was right . There clanged in [his]93-syme mind that unanswerable and terrible truism in the song of [Roland]137-roland

" Pa ens ont tort et Chr tiens ont droit . "[746-the people of the barrel - organ]

which in the old nasal French has the clang and groan of great iron . This liberation of [his]93-syme spirit from the load of [his]93-syme weakness went with a quite clear decision to embrace death . If [the people of the barrel - organ]746-the people of the barrel - organ could keep [their]746-the people of the barrel - organ old - world obligations , so could [he]93-syme . This very pride in keeping [his]93-syme word was that [he]93-syme was keeping it to [miscreants]747-miscreants . It was [his]93-syme last triumph over [these lunatics]748-these lunatics to go down into [[their]748-these lunatics dark room]749-their dark room and die for something that [they]748-these lunatics could not even understand . [The barrel - organ]750-the barrel - organ seemed to give the marching tune with the energy and the mingled noises of a whole orchestra ; and [he]93-syme could hear deep and rolling , under all the trumpets of the pride of life , the drums of the pride of death .

[The conspirators]335-the conspirators were already filing through the open window and into [the rooms]752-the rooms behind . [Syme]93-syme went last , outwardly calm , but with all [his]93-syme brain and body throbbing with romantic rhythm . [The President]2547-the president led [them]335-the conspirators down an irregular side stair , such as might be used by [servants]754-servants , and into [a dim , cold , empty room]755-a dim , cold , empty room , with a table and benches , like [an abandoned boardroom]756-an abandoned boardroom . When [they]335-the conspirators were all in , [he]93-syme closed and locked the door .

[The first to speak]757-the first to speak was [Gogol]126-gogol , the irreconcilable , who seemed bursting with inarticulate grievance .

[They]765-they all stared at [him]93-syme ; then [they]765-they all started in [their]765-they seats , for the next words , though not loud , had a living and sensational emphasis . [Sunday]110-sunday struck the table .

[Sunday]110-sunday had spent [his]110-sunday life in astonishing [[his]110-sunday followers]766-his followers ; but it seemed as if [he]110-sunday had never really astonished [them]766-his followers until now .
