But [Syme]93-syme saw little of the scene , for [he]93-syme was blinded with a beneficent darkness ; [he]93-syme had sunk down into [his]93-syme seat shuddering , in a palsy of passionate relief .

CHAPTER VII . THE UNACCOUNTABLE CONDUCT OF [PROFESSOR DE WORMS]133-professor de worms

" Sit down ! "[110-sunday] said [Sunday]110-sunday in a voice that [he]110-sunday used once or twice in [his]110-sunday life , a voice that made [men drop drawn swords]774-men drop drawn swords .

[The three who had risen]775-the three who had risen fell away from [Gogol]126-gogol , and [that equivocal person]776-that equivocal person [himself]776-that equivocal person resumed [his]776-that equivocal person seat .

" Well , [[my]2547-the president man]2621-my man , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president briskly , addressing [him]776-that equivocal person as one addresses [a total stranger]778-a total stranger , " will [you]776-that equivocal person oblige [me]2547-the president by putting [your]776-that equivocal person hand in [your]776-that equivocal person upper waistcoat pocket and showing [me]2547-the president what [you]776-that equivocal person have there ? "[2547-the president]

[The alleged Pole]779-the alleged pole was a little pale under [his]776-that equivocal person tangle of dark hair , but [he]776-that equivocal person put two fingers into the pocket with apparent coolness and pulled out a blue strip of card . When [Syme]93-syme saw it lying on the table , [he]93-syme woke up again to the world outside [him]93-syme . For although the card lay at the other extreme of the table , and [he]776-that equivocal person could read nothing of the inscription on it , it bore a startling resemblance to the blue card in [his]776-that equivocal person own pocket , the card which had been given to [him]776-that equivocal person when [he]776-that equivocal person joined [the anti - anarchist constabulary]780-the anti - anarchist constabulary .

" [Pathetic Slav]139-pathetic slav , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president , " [tragic child of [Poland]38-poland]2622-tragic child of poland , are [you]2622-tragic child of poland prepared in the presence of that card to deny that [you]2622-tragic child of poland are in [this company]2611-this company shall [we]2624-we say _ de trop ? _ "[2547-the president]

" Right oh ! "[126-gogol] said [the late Gogol]126-gogol . It made [everyone]291-everyone jump to hear a clear , commercial and somewhat cockney voice coming out of that forest of foreign hair . It was irrational , as if [a Chinaman]783-a chinaman had suddenly spoken with a Scotch accent .

" [I]110-sunday gather that [you]2622-tragic child of poland fully understand [your]2622-tragic child of poland position , "[110-sunday] said [Sunday]110-sunday .

" [You]2622-tragic child of poland bet , "[760-the pole] answered [the Pole]760-the pole . " [I]760-the pole see it 's [a fair cop]2625-a fair cop . All [I]760-the pole say is , [I]760-the pole do n't believe [any Pole]2626-any pole could have imitated [my]760-the pole accent like [I]760-the pole did [his]760-the pole . "[760-the pole]

" [I]110-sunday concede the point , "[110-sunday] said [Sunday]110-sunday . " [I]110-sunday believe [your]2622-tragic child of poland own accent to be inimitable , though [I]110-sunday shall practise it in [my]110-sunday bath . Do [you]2622-tragic child of poland mind leaving [your]2622-tragic child of poland beard with [your]2622-tragic child of poland card ? "[110-sunday]

" Not a bit , "[126-gogol] answered [Gogol]126-gogol ; and with one finger [he]126-gogol ripped off the whole of [his]126-gogol shaggy head - covering , emerging with thin red hair and a pale , pert face . " It was hot , "[126-gogol] [he]126-gogol added .

" [I]110-sunday will do [you]2622-tragic child of poland the justice to say , "[110-sunday] said [Sunday]110-sunday , not without a sort of brutal admiration , " that [you]2622-tragic child of poland seem to have kept pretty cool under it . Now listen to [me]110-sunday . [I]110-sunday like [you]2622-tragic child of poland . The consequence is that it would annoy [me]110-sunday for just about two and a half minutes if [I]110-sunday heard that [you]2622-tragic child of poland had died in torments . Well , if [you]2622-tragic child of poland ever tell [the police]2193-the police or [any human soul]2628-any human soul about [us]2629-us , [I]110-sunday shall have that two and a half minutes of discomfort . On [your]2622-tragic child of poland discomfort [I]110-sunday will not dwell . Good day . Mind the step . "[110-sunday]

[The red - haired detective who had masqueraded as [Gogol]126-gogol]785-the red - haired detective who had masqueraded as gogol rose to [his]785-the red - haired detective who had masqueraded as gogol feet without a word , and walked out of [the room]313-the room with an air of perfect nonchalance . Yet [the astonished Syme]93-syme was able to realise that this ease was suddenly assumed ; for there was a slight stumble outside the door , which showed that [the departing detective]787-the departing detective had not minded the step .

" Time is flying , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president in [his]2547-the president gayest manner , after glancing at [his]2547-the president watch , which like everything about [him]2547-the president seemed bigger than it ought to be . " [I]2547-the president must go off at once ; [I]2547-the president have to take the chair at a Humanitarian meeting . "[2547-the president]

[The Secretary]670-the secretary turned to [him]2547-the president with working eyebrows .

" Would it not be better , "[670-the secretary] [he]670-the secretary said a little sharply , " to discuss further the details of [our]2630-our project , now that [the spy]2631-the spy has left [us]2630-our ? "[670-the secretary]

" No , [I]2547-the president think not , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president with a yawn like an unobtrusive earthquake . " Leave it as it is . [Let Saturday]134-saturday settle it . [I]2547-the president must be off . Breakfast here next Sunday . "[2547-the president]

But the late loud scenes had whipped up the almost naked nerves of [the Secretary]670-the secretary . [He]670-the secretary was one of [those men who are conscientious even in crime]792-those men who are conscientious even in crime .

" [I]670-the secretary must protest , [President]2632-president , that the thing is irregular , "[670-the secretary] [he]670-the secretary said . " It is a fundamental rule of [[our]2630-our society]2359-our society that all plans shall be debated in full council . Of course , [I]670-the secretary fully appreciate [your]670-the secretary forethought when in the actual presence of [a traitor]2634-a traitor "[670-the secretary]

" [Secretary]2635-secretary , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president seriously , " if [you]2635-secretary 'd take [your]2635-secretary head [home]2636-home and boil it for a turnip it might be useful . [I]2547-the president ca n't say . But it might . "[2547-the president]

[The Secretary]670-the secretary reared back in a kind of equine anger .

" [I]670-the secretary really fail to understand "[670-the secretary] [he]670-the secretary began in high offense .

" That 's it , that 's it , "[2547-the president] said [the President]2547-the president , nodding a great many times . " That 's where [you]2635-secretary fail right enough . [You]2635-secretary fail to understand . Why , [you]2635-secretary dancing donkey , "[2547-the president] [he]2547-the president roared , rising , " [you]2635-secretary did n't want to be overheard by [a spy]675-a spy , did n't [you]2635-secretary ? How do [you]2635-secretary know [you]2635-secretary are n't overheard now ? "[2547-the president]

And with these words [he]2547-the president shouldered [his]2547-the president way out of [the room]313-the room , shaking with incomprehensible scorn .

[Four of [the men left behind]798-the men left behind]797-four of the men left behind gaped after [him]2547-the president without any apparent glimmering of [his]2547-the president meaning . [Syme]93-syme alone had even a glimmering , and such as it was it froze [him]93-syme to the bone . If the last words of [the President]2547-the president meant anything , [they]800-they meant that [he]2547-the president had not after all passed unsuspected . [They]800-they meant that while [Sunday]110-sunday could not denounce [him]2547-the president like [Gogol]126-gogol , [he]2547-the president still could not trust [him]2547-the president like [the others]579-the others .

[The other four]802-the other four got to [their]802-the other four feet grumbling more or less , and betook [themselves]802-the other four elsewhere to find lunch , for it was already well past midday . [The Professor]773-the professor went last , very slowly and painfully . [Syme]93-syme sat long after [the rest]804-the rest had gone , revolving [his]93-syme strange position . [He]93-syme had escaped a thunderbolt , but [he]93-syme was still under a cloud . At last [he]93-syme rose and made [his]93-syme way out of [the hotel]570-the hotel into [Leicester Square]33-leicester square . The bright , cold day had grown increasingly colder , and when [he]93-syme came out into [the street]298-the street [he]93-syme was surprised by a few flakes of snow . While [he]93-syme still carried the sword - stick and the rest of [Gregory]112-gregory 's portable luggage , [he]93-syme had thrown the cloak down and left it somewhere , perhaps on the steam - tug , perhaps on [the balcony]561-the balcony . Hoping , therefore , that the snow - shower might be slight , [he]93-syme stepped back out of [the street]298-the street for a moment and stood up under the doorway of [a small and greasy hair - dresser 's shop]809-a small and greasy hair - dresser 's shop , the front window of which was empty , except for [a sickly wax lady in evening dress]810-a sickly wax lady in evening dress .

Snow , however , began to thicken and fall fast ; and [Syme]93-syme , having found one glance at [the wax lady]811-the wax lady quite sufficient to depress [his]93-syme spirits , stared out instead into [the white and empty street]812-the white and empty street . [He]93-syme was considerably astonished to see , standing quite still outside [the shop]813-the shop and staring into the window , [a man]240-a man . [His]240-a man top hat was loaded with snow like the hat of [Father Christmas]140-father christmas , the white drift was rising round [his]240-a man boots and ankles ; but it seemed as if nothing could tear [him]240-a man away from the contemplation of the colourless wax doll in dirty evening dress . That [any human being]815-any human being should stand in such weather looking into [such a shop]816-such a shop was a matter of sufficient wonder to [Syme]93-syme ; but [his]93-syme idle wonder turned suddenly into a personal shock ; for [he]93-syme realised that [the man standing there]817-the man standing there was [the paralytic old [Professor de Worms]133-professor de worms]818-the paralytic old professor de worms . It scarcely seemed the place for [a person of [his]240-a man years and infirmities]819-a person of his years and infirmities .

[Syme]93-syme was ready to believe anything about the perversions of [this dehumanized brotherhood]820-this dehumanized brotherhood ; but even [he]93-syme could not believe that [the Professor]773-the professor had fallen in love with [that particular wax lady]822-that particular wax lady . [He]93-syme could only suppose that [the man]315-the man 's malady ( whatever it was ) involved some momentary fits of rigidity or trance . [He]93-syme was not inclined , however , to feel in this case any very compassionate concern . On the contrary , [he]93-syme rather congratulated [himself]93-syme that [the Professor]773-the professor 's stroke and [his]773-the professor elaborate and limping walk would make it easy to escape from [him]773-the professor and leave [him]773-the professor miles behind . For [Syme]93-syme thirsted first and last to get clear of the whole poisonous atmosphere , if only for an hour . Then [he]93-syme could collect [his]93-syme thoughts , formulate [his]93-syme policy , and decide finally whether [he]93-syme should or should not keep faith with [Gregory]112-gregory .

[He]93-syme strolled away through the dancing snow , turned up [two or three streets]825-two or three streets , down through [two or three others]826-two or three others , and entered [a small Soho restaurant]827-a small soho restaurant for lunch . [He]93-syme partook reflectively of four small and quaint courses , drank half a bottle of red wine , and ended up over black coffee and a black cigar , still thinking . [He]93-syme had taken [his]93-syme seat in [the upper room of [the restaurant]829-the restaurant , which was full of the chink of knives and the chatter of [foreigners]830-foreigners]828-the upper room of the restaurant , which was full of the chink of knives and the chatter of foreigners . [He]93-syme remembered that in old days [he]93-syme had imagined that [all these harmless and kindly aliens]831-all these harmless and kindly aliens were [anarchists]371-anarchists . [He]93-syme shuddered , remembering the real thing . But even the shudder had the delightful shame of escape . The wine , the common food , [the familiar place]833-the familiar place , the faces of [natural and talkative men]834-natural and talkative men , made [him]93-syme almost feel as if [the Council of the Seven Days]835-the council of the seven days had been a bad dream ; and although [he]93-syme knew it was nevertheless an objective reality , it was at least a distant one . [Tall houses]836-tall houses and [populous streets]837-populous streets lay between [him]93-syme and [his]93-syme last sight of [the shameful seven]838-the shameful seven ; [he]93-syme was free in free [London]3-london , and drinking wine among [the free]839-the free . With a somewhat easier action , [he]93-syme took [his]93-syme hat and stick and strolled down the stair into [the shop below]840-the shop below .

When [he]93-syme entered [that lower room]841-that lower room [he]93-syme stood stricken and rooted to the spot . At a small table , close up to the blank window and [the white street of snow]842-the white street of snow , sat [the old anarchist Professor]843-the old anarchist professor over a glass of milk , with [his]843-the old anarchist professor lifted livid face and pendent eyelids . For an instant [Syme]93-syme stood as rigid as the stick [he]93-syme leant upon . Then with a gesture as of blind hurry , [he]93-syme brushed past [the Professor]773-the professor , dashing open the door and slamming it behind [him]93-syme , and stood outside in the snow .

" Can that old corpse be following [me]93-syme ? "[93-syme] [he]93-syme asked [himself]93-syme , biting [his]93-syme yellow moustache . " [I]93-syme stopped too long up in [that room]2638-that room , so that even such leaden feet could catch [me]93-syme up . One comfort is , with a little brisk walking [I]93-syme can put [a man like that as far away as [Timbuctoo]39-timbuctoo]2639-a man like that as far away as timbuctoo . Or am [I]93-syme too fanciful ? Was [he]2639-a man like that as far away as timbuctoo really following [me]93-syme ? Surely [Sunday]110-sunday would not be such a fool as to send [a lame man]2640-a lame man ? "[93-syme]

[He]93-syme set off at a smart pace , twisting and whirling [his]93-syme stick , in the direction of [Covent Garden]40-covent garden . As [he]93-syme crossed [the great market]845-the great market the snow increased , growing blinding and bewildering as the afternoon began to darken . The snow - flakes tormented [him]93-syme like a swarm of silver bees . Getting into [his]93-syme eyes and beard , they added [their]846-their unremitting futility to [his]93-syme already irritated nerves ; and by the time that [he]93-syme had come at a swinging pace to the beginning of [Fleet Street]41-fleet street , [he]93-syme lost patience , and finding [a Sunday teashop]847-a sunday teashop , turned into [it]847-a sunday teashop to take shelter . [He]93-syme ordered another cup of black coffee as an excuse . Scarcely had [he]93-syme done so , when [Professor de Worms]133-professor de worms hobbled heavily into [the shop]813-the shop , sat down with difficulty and ordered a glass of milk .

[Syme]93-syme 's walking - stick had fallen from [his]93-syme hand with a great clang , which confessed the concealed steel . But [the Professor]773-the professor did not look round . [Syme]93-syme , who was commonly [a cool character]850-a cool character , was literally gaping as [a rustic gapes at a conjuring trick]851-a rustic gapes at a conjuring trick . [He]93-syme had seen [no cab]852-no cab following ; [he]93-syme had heard no wheels outside [the shop]813-the shop ; to all mortal appearances [the man]315-the man had come on foot . But [the old man]855-the old man could only walk like a snail , and [Syme]93-syme had walked like the wind . [He]93-syme started up and snatched [his]93-syme stick , half crazy with the contradiction in mere arithmetic , and swung out of the swinging doors , leaving [his]93-syme coffee untasted . An omnibus going to [the Bank]856-the bank went rattling by with an unusual rapidity . [He]93-syme had a violent run of a hundred yards to reach [it]857-it ; but [he]93-syme managed to spring , swaying upon the splash - board and , pausing for an instant to pant , [he]93-syme climbed on to the top . When [he]93-syme had been seated for about half a minute , [he]93-syme heard behind [him]93-syme a sort of heavy and asthmatic breathing .

Turning sharply , [he]93-syme saw rising gradually higher and higher up [the omnibus steps]858-the omnibus steps a top hat soiled and dripping with snow , and under the shadow of its brim the short - sighted face and shaky shoulders of [Professor de Worms]133-professor de worms . [He]93-syme let [himself]93-syme into a seat with characteristic care , and wrapped [himself]93-syme up to the chin in the mackintosh rug .

Every movement of [the old man]855-the old man 's tottering figure and vague hands , every uncertain gesture and panic - stricken pause , seemed to put it beyond question that [he]93-syme was helpless , that [he]93-syme was in the last imbecility of the body . [He]93-syme moved by inches , [he]93-syme let [himself]93-syme down with little gasps of caution . And yet , unless the philosophical entities called time and space have no vestige even of a practical existence , it appeared quite unquestionable that [he]93-syme had run after [the omnibus]860-the omnibus .

[Syme]93-syme sprang erect upon [the rocking car]861-the rocking car , and after staring wildly at the wintry sky , that grew gloomier every moment , [he]93-syme ran down the steps . [He]93-syme had repressed an elemental impulse to leap over the side .

Too bewildered to look back or to reason , [he]93-syme rushed into [one of [the little courts at the side of [Fleet Street]41-fleet street]863-the little courts at the side of fleet street]862-one of the little courts at the side of fleet street as a rabbit rushes into a hole . [He]93-syme had a vague idea , if [this incomprehensible old Jack - in - the - box]864-this incomprehensible old jack - in - the - box was really pursuing [him]93-syme , that in [that labyrinth of [little streets]866-little streets]865-that labyrinth of little streets [he]93-syme could soon throw [him]93-syme off the scent . [He]93-syme dived in and out of [those crooked lanes]867-those crooked lanes , which were more like cracks than [thoroughfares]868-thoroughfares ; and by the time that [he]93-syme had completed about twenty alternate angles and described an unthinkable polygon , [he]93-syme paused to listen for any sound of pursuit . There was none ; there could not in any case have been much , for [the little streets]869-the little streets were thick with the soundless snow . Somewhere behind [Red Lion Court]42-red lion court , however , [he]93-syme noticed [a place where [some energetic citizen]871-some energetic citizen had cleared away the snow for a space of about twenty yards , leaving the wet , glistening cobble - stones]870-a place where some energetic citizen had cleared away the snow for a space of about twenty yards , leaving the wet , glistening cobble - stones . [He]93-syme thought little of this as [he]93-syme passed [it]870-a place where some energetic citizen had cleared away the snow for a space of about twenty yards , leaving the wet , glistening cobble - stones , only plunging into yet another arm of the maze . But when a few hundred yards farther on [he]93-syme stood still again to listen , [his]93-syme heart stood still also , for [he]93-syme heard from [that space of rugged stones]872-that space of rugged stones the clinking crutch and labouring feet of [the infernal cripple]873-the infernal cripple .

The sky above was loaded with the clouds of snow , leaving [London]3-london in a darkness and oppression premature for that hour of the evening . On each side of [Syme]93-syme the walls of [the alley]874-the alley were blind and featureless ; there was no little window or any kind of eve . [He]93-syme felt a new impulse to break out of [this hive of [houses]876-houses]875-this hive of houses , and to get once more into [the open and lamp - lit street]877-the open and lamp - lit street . Yet [he]93-syme rambled and dodged for a long time before [he]93-syme struck [the main thoroughfare]878-the main thoroughfare . When [he]93-syme did so , [he]93-syme struck it much farther up than [he]93-syme had fancied . [He]93-syme came out into what seemed the vast and void of [Ludgate Circus]43-ludgate circus , and saw [St. Paul 's Cathedral]44-st. paul 's cathedral sitting in the sky .

At first [he]93-syme was startled to find [these great roads]879-these great roads so empty , as if a pestilence had swept through [the city]880-the city . Then [he]93-syme told [himself]93-syme that some degree of emptiness was natural ; first because the snow - storm was even dangerously deep , and secondly because it was Sunday . And at the very word [Sunday]110-sunday [he]93-syme bit [his]93-syme lip ; the word was henceforth for hire like some indecent pun . Under the white fog of snow high up in the heaven the whole atmosphere of [the city]880-the city was turned to a very queer kind of green twilight , as of men under [the sea]396-the sea . The sealed and sullen sunset behind [the dark dome of [St. Paul 's]45-st. paul 's]883-the dark dome of st. paul 's had in [it]884-it smoky and sinister colours colours of sickly green , dead red or decaying bronze , that were just bright enough to emphasise the solid whiteness of the snow . But right up against these dreary colours rose the black bulk of [the cathedral]885-the cathedral ; and upon the top of [the cathedral]885-the cathedral was a random splash and great stain of snow , still clinging as to an Alpine peak . It had fallen accidentally , but just so fallen as to half drape the dome from [its]883-the dark dome of st. paul 's very topmost point , and to pick out in perfect silver the great orb and the cross . When [Syme]93-syme saw it [he]93-syme suddenly straightened [himself]93-syme , and made with [his]93-syme sword - stick an involuntary salute .

[He]93-syme knew that [that evil figure]887-that evil figure , [his]93-syme shadow , was creeping quickly or slowly behind [him]93-syme , and [he]93-syme did not care .

It seemed a symbol of human faith and valour that while the skies were darkening [that high place of the earth]888-that high place of the earth was bright . [The devils]889-the devils might have captured [heaven]890-heaven , but [they]889-the devils had not yet captured the cross . [He]93-syme had a new impulse to tear out the secret of [this dancing , jumping and pursuing paralytic]891-this dancing , jumping and pursuing paralytic ; and at the entrance of [the court]892-the court as it opened upon [the Circus]893-the circus [he]93-syme turned , stick in hand , to face [[his]93-syme pursuer]894-his pursuer .

[Professor de Worms]133-professor de worms came slowly round the corner of [the irregular alley]895-the irregular alley behind [him]133-professor de worms , [his]133-professor de worms unnatural form outlined against a lonely gas - lamp , irresistibly recalling that very imaginative figure in the nursery rhymes , " the crooked man who went a crooked mile . "[133-professor de worms] [He]133-professor de worms really looked as if [he]133-professor de worms had been twisted out of shape by [the tortuous streets [he]133-professor de worms had been threading]896-the tortuous streets he had been threading . [He]133-professor de worms came nearer and nearer , the lamplight shining on [his]133-professor de worms lifted spectacles , [his]133-professor de worms lifted , patient face . [Syme]93-syme waited for [him]133-professor de worms as [St. George]124-george waited for the dragon , as [a man waits for a final explanation or for death]897-a man waits for a final explanation or for death . And [the old Professor]714-the old professor came right up to [him]133-professor de worms and passed [him]133-professor de worms like [a total stranger]778-a total stranger , without even a blink of [his]133-professor de worms mournful eyelids .

There was something in this silent and unexpected innocence that left [Syme]93-syme in a final fury . [The man]315-the man 's colourless face and manner seemed to assert that the whole following had been an accident . [Syme]93-syme was galvanised with an energy that was something between bitterness and a burst of boyish derision . [He]93-syme made a wild gesture as if to knock [the old man]855-the old man 's hat off , called out something like " Catch [me]93-syme if [you]855-the old man can , "[93-syme] and went racing away across [the white , open Circus]902-the white , open circus . Concealment was impossible now ; and looking back over [his]93-syme shoulder , [he]93-syme could see the black figure of [the old gentleman]903-the old gentleman coming after [him]93-syme with long , swinging strides like [a man winning a mile race]904-a man winning a mile race . But the head upon that bounding body was still pale , grave and professional , like the head of [a lecturer upon the body of [a harlequin]906-a harlequin]905-a lecturer upon the body of a harlequin .

This outrageous chase sped across [Ludgate Circus]43-ludgate circus , up [Ludgate Hill]46-ludgate hill , round [St. Paul 's Cathedral]44-st. paul 's cathedral , along [Cheapside]47-cheapside , [Syme]93-syme remembering all the nightmares [he]93-syme had ever known . Then [Syme]93-syme broke away towards [the river]2282-the river , and ended almost down by [the docks]908-the docks . [He]93-syme saw the yellow panes of [a low , lighted public - house]909-a low , lighted public - house , flung [himself]93-syme into [it]909-a low , lighted public - house and ordered beer . It was [a foul tavern]910-a foul tavern , sprinkled with [foreign sailors]911-foreign sailors , a place where opium might be smoked or knives drawn .

A moment later [Professor de Worms]133-professor de worms entered [the place]214-the place , sat down carefully , and asked for a glass of milk .

CHAPTER VIII . [THE PROFESSOR]773-the professor EXPLAINS

When [Gabriel Syme]93-syme found [himself]93-syme finally established in a chair , and opposite to [him]773-the professor , fixed and final also , the lifted eyebrows and leaden eyelids of [the Professor]773-the professor , [his]93-syme fears fully returned . [This incomprehensible man from [the fierce council]916-the fierce council]915-this incomprehensible man from the fierce council , after all , had certainly pursued [him]93-syme . If [the man]315-the man had [one character]918-one character as [a paralytic]919-a paralytic and [another character as a pursuer]920-another character as a pursuer , the antithesis might make [him]315-the man more interesting , but scarcely more soothing . [He]93-syme emptied a whole pewter pot of ale before [the professor]773-the professor had touched [his]93-syme milk .

One possibility , however , kept [him]93-syme hopeful and yet helpless . It was just possible that this escapade signified something other than even a slight suspicion of [him]93-syme . Perhaps it was some regular form or sign . Perhaps [the foolish scamper]924-the foolish scamper was some sort of friendly signal that [he]93-syme ought to have understood . Perhaps it was a ritual . [Syme]93-syme had for a flash the sensation that the cosmos had turned exactly upside down , that all trees were growing downwards and that all stars were under [his]93-syme feet . Then came slowly the opposite conviction . For the last twenty - four hours [the cosmos]937-the cosmos had really been upside down , but now [the capsized universe]938-the capsized universe had come right side up again . [This devil from whom [he]93-syme had been fleeing all day]939-this devil from whom he had been fleeing all day was only [an elder brother of [[his]93-syme own house]941-his own house , who on the other side of the table lay back and laughed at [him]93-syme . [He]93-syme knew simultaneously that [he]93-syme was [a fool]2243-a fool and [a free man]944-a free man . For with any recovery from morbidity there must go a certain healthy humiliation . There comes a certain point in such conditions when only three things are possible : first a perpetuation of Satanic pride , secondly tears , and third laughter . [Syme]93-syme 's egotism held hard to the first course for a few seconds , and then suddenly adopted the third . Taking [his]93-syme own blue police ticket from [his]93-syme own waist coat pocket , [he]93-syme tossed it on to the table ; then [he]93-syme flung [his]93-syme head back until [his]93-syme spike of yellow beard almost pointed at the ceiling , and shouted with a barbaric laughter .

" [You]93-syme can find [good English inns left by accident everywhere]2716-good english inns left by accident everywhere , like fossils , "[773-the professor] explained [the Professor]773-the professor . " It is , "[773-the professor] said [the Professor]773-the professor reverently , and went in .

In [that place]249-that place [they]993-they dined and slept , both very thoroughly . Through all this ordeal [his]93-syme root horror had been isolation , and there are no words to express the abyss between isolation and having [one ally]1005-one ally . It may be conceded to [the mathematicians]1006-the mathematicians that four is twice two . But two is not twice one ; two is two thousand times one . That is why , in spite of a hundred disadvantages , [the world]182-the world will always return to monogamy .

[Syme]93-syme was able to pour out for the first time the whole of [his]93-syme outrageous tale , from the time when [Gregory]112-gregory had taken [him]93-syme to [the little tavern by [the river]2282-the river]1008-the little tavern by the river . " [I]1018-the impersonator need hardly say there was a collision . [He]93-syme was abnormally quick with [his]93-syme brains at puzzles , and with [his]93-syme hands at conjuring , and it did not take [him]93-syme long to learn how [he]93-syme might convey simple messages by what would seem to be idle taps upon a table or knee . [He]93-syme was awakened next morning while [the east]1032-the east was still sealed with darkness , and found [[his]93-syme grey - bearded ally]1033-his grey - bearded ally standing like a ghost beside [his]93-syme bed .

[Syme]93-syme sat up in bed blinking ; then slowly collected [his]93-syme thoughts , threw off the bed - clothes , and stood up . [He]93-syme still felt an entire trust and loyalty towards [[his]93-syme companion]311-his companion ; but it was the trust between [two men going to the scaffold]1035-two men going to the scaffold .

" Well , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme with a forced cheerfulness as [he]93-syme pulled on [his]93-syme trousers , " [I]93-syme dreamt of that alphabet of [yours]773-the professor . Did it take [you]773-the professor long to make it up ? "[93-syme]

" [I]93-syme say , did it take [you]773-the professor long to invent all this ? [I]93-syme 'm considered good at these things , and it was a good hour 's grind . Did [you]773-the professor learn it all on the spot ? "[93-syme]

[The Professor]773-the professor was silent ; [his]773-the professor eyes were wide open , and [he]773-the professor wore a fixed but very small smile .

" How long did it take [you]93-syme ? "[773-the professor]

[The Professor]773-the professor did not move .

" Confound [you]773-the professor , ca n't [you]773-the professor answer ? "[93-syme] called out [Syme]93-syme , in a sudden anger that had something like fear underneath . Whether or no [the Professor]773-the professor could answer , [he]773-the professor did not .

[Syme]93-syme stood staring back at the stiff face like parchment and the blank , blue eyes . [His]93-syme first thought was that [the Professor]773-the professor had gone mad , but [his]93-syme second thought was more frightful . After all , what did [he]93-syme know about [this queer creature whom [he]93-syme had heedlessly accepted as [a friend]2318-a friend]1042-this queer creature whom he had heedlessly accepted as a friend ? What did [he]93-syme know , except that [the man]315-the man had been at the anarchist breakfast and had told [him]93-syme a ridiculous tale ? How improbable it was that there should be [another friend there beside [Gogol]126-gogol]1045-another friend there beside gogol ! Was [this man]2311-this man 's silence a sensational way of declaring war ? Was this adamantine stare after all only the awful sneer of [some threefold traitor]1047-some threefold traitor , who had turned for the last time ? [He]93-syme stood and strained [his]93-syme ears in this heartless silence . [He]93-syme almost fancied [he]93-syme could hear [dynamiters]1048-dynamiters come to capture [him]93-syme shifting softly in [the corridor outside]1049-the corridor outside .

Then [his]93-syme eye strayed downwards , and [he]93-syme burst out laughing . Though [the Professor]773-the professor [himself]773-the professor stood there as voiceless as a statue , [his]773-the professor five dumb fingers were dancing alive upon the dead table . [Syme]93-syme watched the twinkling movements of the talking hand , and read clearly the message

" [I]93-syme will only talk like this . [We]1051-they must get used to it . "[93-syme]

[He]93-syme rapped out the answer with the impatience of relief

" All right . Let 's get out to breakfast . "[93-syme]

[They]1051-they took [their]1051-they hats and sticks in silence ; but as [Syme]93-syme took [his]93-syme sword - stick , [he]93-syme held it hard .

[They]1051-they paused for a few minutes only to stuff down coffee and coarse thick sandwiches at [a coffee stall]1052-a coffee stall , and then made [their]1051-they way across [the river]2282-the river , which under the grey and growing light looked as desolate as [Acheron]146-acheron . [They]1051-they reached the bottom of [the huge block of buildings which [they]1051-they had seen from across [the river]2282-the river]1054-the huge block of buildings which they had seen from across the river , and began in silence to mount the naked and numberless stone steps , only pausing now and then to make short remarks on the rail of the banisters . At about every other flight [they]1051-they passed a window ; each window showed [them]1051-they a pale and tragic dawn lifting itself laboriously over [London]3-london . From each the innumerable roofs of slate looked like the leaden surges of a grey , troubled sea after rain . [Syme]93-syme was increasingly conscious that [his]93-syme new adventure had somehow a quality of cold sanity worse than the wild adventures of the past . Last night , for instance , [the tall tenements]1056-the tall tenements had seemed to [him]93-syme like a tower in a dream . As [he]93-syme now went up the weary and perpetual steps , [he]93-syme was daunted and bewildered by [their]1051-they almost infinite series . But it was not the hot horror of a dream or of anything that might be exaggeration or delusion . [Their]1051-they infinity was more like the empty infinity of arithmetic , something unthinkable , yet necessary to thought . Or it was like the stunning statements of astronomy about the distance of the fixed stars . [He]93-syme was ascending [the house of reason]1057-the house of reason , a thing more hideous than unreason itself .

By the time [they]1051-they reached [[Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull 's landing]1058-dr. bull 's landing , a last window showed [them]1051-they a harsh , white dawn edged with banks of a kind of coarse red , more like red clay than red cloud . And when [they]1051-they entered [[Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull 's bare garret]1059-dr. bull 's bare garret it was full of light .

[Syme]93-syme had been haunted by a half historic memory in connection with [these empty rooms]1060-these empty rooms and that austere daybreak . The moment [he]93-syme saw the garret and [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull sitting writing at a table , [he]93-syme remembered what the memory was the French Revolution . There should have been the black outline of a guillotine against that heavy red and white of the morning . [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull was in [his]135-dr. bull white shirt and black breeches only ; [his]135-dr. bull cropped , dark head might well have just come out of its wig ; [he]135-dr. bull might have been [Marat]1061-marat or [a more slipshod Robespierre]1062-a more slipshod robespierre .

Yet when [he]135-dr. bull was seen properly , the French fancy fell away . [The Jacobins]147-the jacobins were [idealists]1063-idealists ; there was about [this man]2311-this man a murderous materialism . [His]135-dr. bull position gave [him]135-dr. bull a somewhat new appearance . The strong , white light of morning coming from one side creating sharp shadows , made [him]135-dr. bull seem both more pale and more angular than [he]135-dr. bull had looked at the breakfast on [the balcony]561-the balcony . Thus the two black glasses that encased [his]135-dr. bull eyes might really have been black cavities in [his]135-dr. bull skull , making [him]135-dr. bull look like a death's - head . And , indeed , if ever [Death]148-death [himself]148-death sat writing at a wooden table , it might have been [he]148-death .

[He]148-death looked up and smiled brightly enough as [the men]588-the men came in , and rose with the resilient rapidity of which [the Professor]773-the professor had spoken . The quiet good humour of [his]148-death manner left [[his]148-death two opponents]1068-his two opponents helpless . [CHAPTER X. THE DUEL

Syme]152-chapter x. the duel syme sat down at a caf table with [[his]116-syme companions]1156-his companions , [his]116-syme blue eyes sparkling like [the bright sea below]1157-the bright sea below , and ordered a bottle of Saumur with a pleased impatience . [He]116-syme was for some reason in a condition of curious hilarity . [His]116-syme spirits were already unnaturally high ; they rose as [the Saumur]60-the saumur sank , and in half an hour [his]116-syme talk was a torrent of nonsense . [He]116-syme professed to be making out a plan of the conversation which was going to ensue between [himself]116-syme and [the deadly Marquis]1158-the deadly marquis . [He]116-syme jotted it down wildly with a pencil . It was arranged like a printed catechism , with questions and answers , and was delivered with an extraordinary rapidity of utterance .

" [I]1158-the deadly marquis shall approach . Before taking off [his]130-the marquis hat , [I]1158-the deadly marquis shall take off [my]1158-the deadly marquis own . [I]1158-the deadly marquis shall say , [The Marquis de Saint Eustache]153-the marquis , [I]1158-the deadly marquis believe . ' [He]130-the marquis will say , [The celebrated Mr. Syme]93-syme , [I]1158-the deadly marquis presume . ' [He]130-the marquis will say in the most exquisite French , How are [you]1158-the deadly marquis ? ' [I]1158-the deadly marquis shall reply in the most exquisite Cockney , Oh , just [the Syme]93-syme ' "[1158-the deadly marquis]

" But it was a lovely catechism , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme pathetically . " Do let [me]93-syme read it [you]1158-the deadly marquis . "[93-syme]

And so [I]93-syme will , by [George]124-george ! "[93-syme] And [he]93-syme stood up suddenly , [his]93-syme yellow hair blowing in the slight sea breeze .

[A band]1162-a band was playing in a _ caf chantant _ hidden somewhere among the trees , and [a woman]245-a woman had just stopped singing . On [Syme]93-syme 's heated head the bray of the brass band seemed like the jar and jingle of that barrel - organ in [Leicester Square]33-leicester square , to the tune of which [he]93-syme had once stood up to die . [He]93-syme looked across to the little table where [the Marquis]712-the marquis sat . [The man]315-the man had [two companions]1166-two companions now , [solemn Frenchmen]1167-solemn frenchmen in frock - coats and silk hats , [one of [them]1167-solemn frenchmen with the red rosette of [the Legion of Honour]1169-the legion of honour]1168-one of them with the red rosette of the legion of honour , evidently [people of a solid social position]1170-people of a solid social position . Indeed , one might say that [he]712-the marquis looked [the king]2534-the king , with [his]712-the marquis animal elegance , [his]712-the marquis scornful eyes , and [his]712-the marquis proud head lifted against [the purple sea]1174-the purple sea . But [he]712-the marquis was [no Christian king]1175-no christian king , at any rate ; [he]712-the marquis was , rather , [some swarthy despot]1176-some swarthy despot , [half Greek]1177-half greek , [half Asiatic]1178-half asiatic , who in the days when slavery seemed natural looked down on [the Mediterranean]61-the mediterranean , on [[his]712-the marquis galley]1179-his galley and [[his]712-the marquis groaning slaves]1180-his groaning slaves . Just so , [Syme]93-syme thought , would the brown - gold face of [such a tyrant]1181-such a tyrant have shown against the dark green olives and the burning blue .

" [This man]2311-this man has insulted [me]93-syme ! "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , with gestures of explanation .

[Syme]93-syme bowed with a quite beautiful graciousness .

In three long strides [he]712-the marquis rejoined [[his]712-the marquis companions]1156-his companions , and [they]1156-his companions , who had seen [his]712-the marquis champagne - inspired attack and listened to [his]712-the marquis idiotic explanations , were quite startled at the look of [him]712-the marquis . For now that [he]712-the marquis came back to [them]1156-his companions [he]712-the marquis was quite sober , a little pale , and [he]712-the marquis spoke in a low voice of passionate practicality .

" [I]712-the marquis have done it , "[712-the marquis] [he]712-the marquis said hoarsely . " [I]1201-i have fixed a fight on the beast . But look here , and listen carefully . There is no time for talk . [You]2932-you are [my]1201-i seconds , and everything must come from [you]2932-you . Now [you]2932-you must insist , and insist absolutely , on the duel coming off after seven tomorrow , so as to give [me]1201-i the chance of preventing [him]712-the marquis from catching the 7.45 for [Paris]36-paris . If [he]712-the marquis misses that [he]712-the marquis misses [his]712-the marquis crime . [He]712-the marquis ca n't refuse to meet [you]2932-you on such a small point of time and place . But this is what [he]712-the marquis will do . [He]712-the marquis will choose [a field somewhere near [a wayside station]2934-a wayside station , where [he]712-the marquis can pick up [the train]2139-the train]2933-a field somewhere near a wayside station , where he can pick up the train . [He]712-the marquis is [a very good swordsman]2936-a very good swordsman , and [he]712-the marquis will trust to killing [me]1201-i in time to catch it . But [I]1201-i can fence well too , and [I]1201-i think [I]1201-i can keep [him]712-the marquis in play , at any rate , until [the train]2139-the train is lost . Then perhaps [he]712-the marquis may kill [me]1201-i to console [his]712-the marquis feelings . [You]1199-you understand ? Very well then , let [me]1201-i introduce [you]1199-you to [some charming friends of [mine]1201-i]2938-some charming friends of mine , "[1201-i] and leading [them]1199-you quickly across [the parade]1200-the parade , [he]1201-i presented [them]1199-you to [the Marquis]712-the marquis 's seconds by two very aristocratic names of which [they]1199-you had not previously heard .

[Syme]93-syme was subject to spasms of singular common sense , not otherwise a part of [his]93-syme character . [They]1203-they were ( as [he]93-syme said of [his]93-syme impulse about the spectacles ) poetic intuitions , and they sometimes rose to the exaltation of prophecy .

[He]93-syme had correctly calculated in this case the policy of [[his]93-syme opponent]1204-his opponent . When [the Marquis]712-the marquis was informed by [his]712-the marquis seconds that [Syme]93-syme could only fight in the morning , [he]712-the marquis must fully have realised that an obstacle had suddenly arisen between [him]712-the marquis and [his]712-the marquis bomb - throwing business in [the capital]1206-the capital . Naturally [he]712-the marquis could not explain this objection to [[his]712-the marquis friends]1207-his friends , so [he]712-the marquis chose the course which [Syme]93-syme had predicted . [He]712-the marquis induced [his]712-the marquis seconds to settle on [a small meadow not far from [the railway]1209-the railway]1208-a small meadow not far from the railway , and [he]712-the marquis trusted to the fatality of the first engagement .

When [he]712-the marquis came down very coolly to [the field of honour]1210-the field of honour , [no one]2257-no one could have guessed that [he]712-the marquis had any anxiety about a journey ; [his]712-the marquis hands were in [his]712-the marquis pockets , [his]712-the marquis straw hat on the back of [his]712-the marquis head , [his]712-the marquis handsome face brazen in the sun . But it might have struck [a stranger]523-a stranger as odd that there appeared in [[his]712-the marquis train]1213-his train , not only [[his]712-the marquis seconds]1214-his seconds carrying the sword - case , but [two of [[his]712-the marquis servants]1216-his servants]1215-two of his servants carrying a portmanteau and a luncheon basket .

Early as was the hour , the sun soaked everything in warmth , and [Syme]93-syme was vaguely surprised to see so many spring flowers burning gold and silver in the tall grass in which [the whole company]590-the whole company stood almost knee - deep .

With the exception of [the Marquis]712-the marquis , [all the men]1219-all the men were in sombre and solemn morning - dress , with hats like black chimney - pots ; [the little Doctor]2791-the little doctor especially , with the addition of [his]2791-the little doctor black spectacles , looked like [an undertaker in a farce]1221-an undertaker in a farce . [Syme]93-syme could not help feeling a comic contrast between this funereal church parade of apparel and [the rich and glistening meadow]1222-the rich and glistening meadow , growing wild flowers everywhere . But , indeed , this comic contrast between the yellow blossoms and the black hats was but a symbol of the tragic contrast between the yellow blossoms and the black business . On [his]93-syme right was a little wood ; far away to [his]93-syme left lay the long curve of [the railway line]1223-the railway line , which [he]93-syme was , so to speak , guarding from [the Marquis]712-the marquis , whose goal and escape it was . In front of [him]93-syme , behind [the black group of [[his]93-syme opponents]1226-his opponents]1225-the black group of his opponents , [he]93-syme could see , like a tinted cloud , a small almond bush in flower against the faint line of [the sea]396-the sea .

[The member of the Legion of Honour]1228-the member of the legion of honour , whose name it seemed was [Colonel Ducroix]155-colonel ducroix , approached [the Professor]773-the professor and [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull with great politeness , and suggested that the play should terminate with the first considerable hurt .

[Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull , however , having been carefully coached by [Syme]93-syme upon this point of policy , insisted , with great dignity and in very bad French , that it should continue until one of [the combatants]1230-the combatants was disabled . [Syme]93-syme had made up [his]93-syme mind that [he]93-syme could avoid disabling [the Marquis]712-the marquis and prevent [the Marquis]712-the marquis from disabling [him]712-the marquis for at least twenty minutes . In twenty minutes the [Paris]36-paris train would have gone by .

" To [a man of the well - known skill and valour]2939-a man of the well - known skill and valour of [Monsieur de St. Eustache]156-monsieur de st. eustache , "[773-the professor] said [the Professor]773-the professor solemnly , " it must be a matter of indifference which method is adopted , and [[our]2940-our principal]2941-our principal has strong reasons for demanding the longer encounter , reasons the delicacy of which prevent [me]773-the professor from being explicit , but for the just and honourable nature of which [I]773-the professor can "[773-the professor]

" _ Peste ! _ "[712-the marquis] broke from [the Marquis]712-the marquis behind , whose face had suddenly darkened , " let [us]2940-our stop talking and begin , "[712-the marquis] and [he]712-the marquis slashed off the head of a tall flower with [his]712-the marquis stick .

[Syme]93-syme understood [his]93-syme rude impatience and instinctively looked over [his]93-syme shoulder to see whether [the train]2139-the train was coming in sight . But there was no smoke on the horizon .

[Colonel Ducroix]155-colonel ducroix knelt down and unlocked the case , taking out a pair of twin swords , which took the sunlight and turned to two streaks of white fire . [He]155-colonel ducroix offered one to [the Marquis , who snatched it without ceremony]1236-the marquis , who snatched it without ceremony , and another to [Syme]93-syme , who took it , bent it , and poised it with as much delay as was consistent with dignity .

Then [the Colonel]1237-the colonel took out another pair of blades , and taking one [himself]1237-the colonel and giving another to [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull , proceeded to place [the men]588-the men .

[Both combatants]1239-both combatants had thrown off [their]1239-both combatants coats and waistcoats , and stood sword in hand . [The seconds]1240-the seconds stood on each side of the line of fight with drawn swords also , but still sombre in [their]1240-the seconds dark frock - coats and hats . [The principals]1241-the principals saluted . [The Colonel]1237-the colonel said quietly , " Engage ! "[1237-the colonel] and the two blades touched and tingled .

When the jar of the joined iron ran up [Syme]93-syme 's arm , all the fantastic fears that have been the subject of this story fell from [him]93-syme like dreams from [a man]240-a man waking up in bed . [He]93-syme remembered them clearly and in order as mere delusions of the nerves how the fear of [the Professor]773-the professor had been the fear of the tyrannic accidents of nightmare , and how the fear of [the Doctor]1073-the doctor had been the fear of the airless vacuum of science . The first was the old fear that any miracle might happen , the second the more hopeless modern fear that no miracle can ever happen . But [he]93-syme saw that these fears were fancies , for [he]93-syme found [himself]93-syme in the presence of the great fact of the fear of death , with its coarse and pitiless common sense . [He]93-syme felt like [a man who had dreamed all night of falling over precipices]1246-a man who had dreamed all night of falling over precipices , and had woke up on the morning when [he]93-syme was to be hanged . For as soon as [he]93-syme had seen the sunlight run down the channel of [[his]93-syme foe]296-his foe 's foreshortened blade , and as soon as [he]93-syme had felt the two tongues of steel touch , vibrating like two living things , [he]93-syme knew that [[his]93-syme enemy]435-his enemy was [a terrible fighter]1249-a terrible fighter , and that probably [his]93-syme last hour had come .

[He]93-syme felt a strange and vivid value in [all the earth around [him]93-syme]1250-all the earth around him , in the grass under [his]93-syme feet ; [he]93-syme felt the love of life in all living things . [He]93-syme could almost fancy that [he]93-syme heard the grass growing ; [he]93-syme could almost fancy that even as [he]93-syme stood fresh flowers were springing up and breaking into blossom in the meadow flowers blood red and burning gold and blue , fulfilling the whole pageant of the spring . And whenever [his]93-syme eyes strayed for a flash from the calm , staring , hypnotic eyes of [the Marquis]712-the marquis , [they]1252-they saw the little tuft of almond tree against the sky - line . [He]93-syme had the feeling that if by some miracle [he]93-syme escaped [he]93-syme would be ready to sit for ever before that almond tree , desiring nothing else in [the world]182-the world .

But while [earth]2207-earth and sky and everything had the living beauty of a thing lost , the other half of [his]93-syme head was as clear as glass , and [he]93-syme was parrying [[his]93-syme enemy]435-his enemy 's point with a kind of clockwork skill of which [he]93-syme had hardly supposed [himself]93-syme capable . Once [[his]93-syme enemy]435-his enemy 's point ran along [his]93-syme wrist , leaving a slight streak of blood , but it either was not noticed or was tacitly ignored . Every now and then [he]93-syme _ riposted _ , and once or twice [he]93-syme could almost fancy that [he]93-syme felt [his]93-syme point go [home]2636-home , but as there was no blood on blade or shirt [he]93-syme supposed [he]93-syme was mistaken . Then came an interruption and a change .

At the risk of losing all , [the Marquis]712-the marquis , interrupting [his]712-the marquis quiet stare , flashed one glance over [his]712-the marquis shoulder at [the line of railway on [his]712-the marquis right]1259-the line of railway on his right . Then [he]712-the marquis turned on [Syme]93-syme a face transfigured to that of [a fiend]1260-a fiend , and began to fight as if with twenty weapons . The attack came so fast and furious , that the one shining sword seemed a shower of shining arrows . [Syme]93-syme had no chance to look at [the railway]1209-the railway ; but also [he]93-syme had no need . [He]93-syme could guess the reason of [the Marquis]712-the marquis 's sudden madness of battle the [Paris]36-paris train was in sight .

But [the Marquis]153-the marquis 's morbid energy over - reached itself . Twice [Syme]93-syme , parrying , knocked [[his]93-syme opponent]1204-his opponent 's point far out of the fighting circle ; and the third time [his]93-syme _ riposte _ was so rapid , that there was no doubt about the hit this time . [Syme]93-syme 's sword actually bent under the weight of [the Marquis]712-the marquis 's body , which it had pierced .

[Syme]93-syme was as certain that [he]93-syme had stuck [his]93-syme blade into [[his]93-syme enemy]435-his enemy as a gardener that [he]93-syme has stuck [his]93-syme spade into the ground . Yet [the Marquis]712-the marquis sprang back from the stroke without a stagger , and [Syme]93-syme stood staring at [his]93-syme own sword - point like [an idiot]1267-an idiot . There was no blood on it at all .

There was an instant of rigid silence , and then [Syme]93-syme in [his]93-syme turn fell furiously on the other , filled with a flaming curiosity . [The Marquis]153-the marquis was probably , in a general sense , [a better fencer]1268-a better fencer than [he]712-the marquis , as [he]712-the marquis had surmised at the beginning , but at the moment [the Marquis]153-the marquis seemed distraught and at a disadvantage . [He]153-the marquis fought wildly and even weakly , and [he]153-the marquis constantly looked away at [the railway line]1223-the railway line , almost as if [he]153-the marquis feared [the train]2139-the train more than the pointed steel . [Syme]93-syme , on the other hand , fought fiercely but still carefully , in an intellectual fury , eager to solve the riddle of [his]93-syme own bloodless sword . For this purpose , [he]93-syme aimed less at [the Marquis]153-the marquis 's body , and more at [his]153-the marquis throat and head . A minute and a half afterwards [he]93-syme felt [his]93-syme point enter [the man]315-the man 's neck below the jaw . It came out clean . Half mad , [he]93-syme thrust again , and made what should have been a bloody scar on [the Marquis]712-the marquis 's cheek . But there was no scar .

For one moment the heaven of [Syme]93-syme again grew black with supernatural terrors . Surely [the man]315-the man had a charmed life . But this new spiritual dread was a more awful thing than had been the mere spiritual topsy - turvydom symbolised by [the paralytic who pursued [him]315-the man]1274-the paralytic who pursued him . [The Professor]773-the professor was only [a goblin]1276-a goblin ; [this man]2311-this man was [a devil]2411-a devil perhaps [he]2311-this man was [the Devil]2662-the devil ! Anyhow , this was certain , that three times had a human sword been driven into [him]315-the man and made no mark . When [Syme]93-syme had that thought [he]93-syme drew [himself]93-syme up , and all that was good in [him]93-syme sang high up in the air as a high wind sings in the trees . [He]93-syme thought of all the human things in [his]93-syme story of [the Chinese lanterns in [Saffron Park]2-saffron park]1280-the chinese lanterns in saffron park , of [the girl]275-the girl 's red hair in [the garden]281-the garden , of [the honest , beer - swilling sailors]1283-the honest , beer - swilling sailors down by [the dock]1284-the dock , of [[his]93-syme loyal companions]1285-his loyal companions standing by . Perhaps [he]93-syme had been chosen as a champion of all these fresh and kindly things to cross swords with [the enemy of all creation]1286-the enemy of all creation . " After all , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said to [himself]93-syme , " [I]93-syme am more than [a devil]2411-a devil ; [I]93-syme am [a man]240-a man . [I]93-syme can do the one thing which [Satan]157-satan [himself]157-satan can not do [I]93-syme can die , "[93-syme] and as the word went through [his]93-syme head , [he]93-syme heard a faint and far - off hoot , which would soon be the roar of [the Paris train]1287-the paris train .

[He]93-syme fell to fighting again with a supernatural levity , like [a Mohammedan]1288-a mohammedan panting for Paradise . As [the train]2139-the train came nearer and nearer [he]93-syme fancied [he]93-syme could see [people]2223-people putting up [the floral arches in [Paris]36-paris]1291-the floral arches in paris ; [he]93-syme joined in the growing noise and the glory of [the great Republic whose gate [he]93-syme was guarding against [Hell]62-hell]1292-the great republic whose gate he was guarding against hell . [His]93-syme thoughts rose higher and higher with the rising roar of [the train]2139-the train , which ended , as if proudly , in a long and piercing whistle . [The train]2139-the train stopped .

Suddenly , to the astonishment of [everyone]291-everyone [the Marquis]712-the marquis sprang back quite out of sword reach and threw down [his]712-the marquis sword . " [Gentlemen]700-gentlemen , "[712-the marquis] [he]712-the marquis said , " [we]2193-the police all owe [you]700-gentlemen a serious apology ; but [I]712-the marquis assure [you]700-gentlemen that [you]700-gentlemen have not been made [the victims of such a low joke]2973-the victims of such a low joke as [you]700-gentlemen imagine , or indeed of anything undignified in [a man of honour]2415-a man of honour . [You]700-gentlemen have not wasted [your]700-gentlemen time ; [you]700-gentlemen have helped to save [the world]182-the world . [We]2193-the police are [not buffoons]2976-not buffoons , but [very desperate men at war with a vast conspiracy]2977-very desperate men at war with a vast conspiracy . [A secret society of anarchists]2978-a secret society of anarchists is hunting [us]2193-the police like hares ; not such unfortunate madmen as may here or there throw a bomb through starvation or German philosophy , but [a rich and powerful and fanatical church]2979-a rich and powerful and fanatical church , [a church of eastern pessimism , which holds it]2980-a church of eastern pessimism , which holds it holy to destroy [mankind like vermin]2981-mankind like vermin . Then [he]1348-the new detective turned to [the others]579-the others and said somewhat austerely

[The others]579-the others gave one glance over [their]579-the others shoulders , and saw that the dark cloud of [men]179-men had detached itself from [the station]2953-the station and was moving with a mysterious discipline across [the plain]1354-the plain . [They]579-the others saw already , even with the naked eye , black blots on the foremost faces , which marked the masks [they]579-the others wore . [They]579-the others turned and followed [[their]579-the others leader]1355-their leader , who had already struck [the wood]1350-the wood , and disappeared among the twinkling trees .

The sun on the grass was dry and hot . So in plunging into [the wood]1350-the wood [they]579-the others had a cool shock of shadow , as of [divers who plunge into a dim pool]1358-divers who plunge into a dim pool . The inside of the wood was full of shattered sunlight and shaken shadows . [They]579-the others made a sort of shuddering veil , almost recalling the dizziness of a cinematograph . Even the solid figures walking with [him]1348-the new detective [Syme]161-syme could hardly see for the patterns of sun and shade that danced upon [them]579-the others . Now [a man]240-a man 's head was lit as with a light of Rembrandt , leaving all else obliterated ; now again [he]240-a man had strong and staring white hands with the face of [a negro]1360-a negro . [The ex - Marquis]1361-the ex - marquis had pulled the old straw hat over [his]1361-the ex - marquis eyes , and the black shade of the brim cut [his]1361-the ex - marquis face so squarely in two that it seemed to be wearing one of the black half - masks of [[their]579-the others pursuers]1362-their pursuers . The fancy tinted [Syme]161-syme 's overwhelming sense of wonder . Was [he]1361-the ex - marquis wearing a mask ? Was [anyone wearing a mask]1363-anyone wearing a mask ? Was [anyone]2313-anyone anything ? [This wood of witchery]1365-this wood of witchery , in which [men]179-men 's faces turned black and white by turns , in which [their]179-men figures first swelled into sunlight and then faded into formless night , this mere chaos of chiaroscuro ( after the clear daylight outside ) , seemed to [Syme]161-syme a perfect symbol of [the world in which [he]161-syme had been moving for three days]1367-the world in which he had been moving for three days , [this world where [men]179-men took off [their]179-men beards and [their]179-men spectacles and [their]179-men noses , and turned into [other people]2483-other people]1368-this world where men took off their beards and their spectacles and their noses , and turned into other people . That tragic self - confidence which [he]161-syme had felt when [he]161-syme believed that [the Marquis]712-the marquis was [a devil]2411-a devil had strangely disappeared now that [he]161-syme knew that [the Marquis]712-the marquis was [a friend]2318-a friend . [He]161-syme felt almost inclined to ask after all these bewilderments what was [a friend]2318-a friend and what [an enemy]1376-an enemy . Was there anything that was apart from what it seemed ? [The Marquis]712-the marquis had taken off [his]712-the marquis nose and turned out to be [a detective]413-a detective . Might [he]712-the marquis not just as well take off [his]712-the marquis head and turn out to be [a hobgoblin]1379-a hobgoblin ? Was not everything , after all , like this bewildering woodland , this dance of dark and light ? Everything only a glimpse , the glimpse always unforeseen , and always forgotten . For [Gabriel Syme]93-syme had found in the heart of that sun - splashed wood what [many modern painters]1380-many modern painters had found there . [He]93-syme had found the thing which [the modern people]1381-the modern people call Impressionism , which is another name for that final scepticism which can find no floor to [the universe]2488-the universe .

As [a man in an evil dream]1383-a man in an evil dream strains [himself]1383-a man in an evil dream to scream and wake , [Syme]93-syme strove with a sudden effort to fling off this last and worst of [his]93-syme fancies . " May [I]93-syme ask , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said , " where on earth [we]3040-we are all going to ? "[93-syme]

[He]1237-the colonel told [them]1405-they that the best thing [they]1405-they could do was to make [their]1405-they way down to [the little inn on [the hills above [Lancy]66-lancy]1413-the hills above lancy]1412-the little inn on the hills above lancy , where [the innkeeper]1414-the innkeeper , [an old soldier who had become _ d vot _ in [his]1414-the innkeeper latter years]1415-an old soldier who had become _ d vot _ in his latter years , would be certain to sympathise with [them]1405-they , and even to take risks in [their]1405-they support . [The whole company]590-the whole company , therefore , piled [themselves]1405-they on top of the stacks of wood , and went rocking in [the rude cart]1417-the rude cart down [the other and steeper side of [the woodland]1419-the woodland]1418-the other and steeper side of the woodland . Heavy and ramshackle as was [the vehicle]1420-the vehicle , it was driven quickly enough , and [they]1405-they soon had the exhilarating impression of distancing altogether those , whoever [they]1405-they were , who were hunting [them]1405-they . For , after all , the riddle as to where [the anarchists]2287-the anarchists had got [all these followers]1422-all these followers was still unsolved . [One man]592-one man 's presence had sufficed for [them]1405-they ; [they]1405-they had fled at the first sight of the deformed smile of [the Secretary]670-the secretary . [Syme]93-syme every now and then looked back over [his]93-syme shoulder at [the army on [their]1405-they track]1425-the army on their track .

As the wood grew first thinner and then smaller with distance , [he]93-syme could see [the sunlit slopes beyond]1426-the sunlit slopes beyond [it]1427-it and above it ; and across these was still moving [the square black mob]1428-the square black mob like one monstrous beetle . In the very strong sunlight and with [his]93-syme own very strong eyes , which were almost telescopic , [Syme]93-syme could see [this mass of [men]179-men]1429-this mass of men quite plainly . [He]93-syme could see [them]1405-they as [separate human figures]1431-separate human figures ; but [he]93-syme was increasingly surprised by the way in which [they]1405-they moved as [one man]592-one man . [They]1405-they seemed to be dressed in dark clothes and plain hats , like [any common crowd out of [the streets]203-the streets]1433-any common crowd out of the streets ; but [they]1405-they did not spread and sprawl and trail by various lines to the attack , as would be natural in [an ordinary mob]1435-an ordinary mob . [They]1405-they moved with a sort of dreadful and wicked woodenness , like [a staring army of automatons]1436-a staring army of automatons .

[Syme]93-syme pointed this out to [Ratcliffe]160-ratcliffe .

" Yes , "[451-the policeman] replied [the policeman]451-the policeman , " that 's discipline . That 's [Sunday]110-sunday . [He]160-ratcliffe is perhaps five hundred miles off , but the fear of [him]160-ratcliffe is on all of [them]1405-they , like the finger of [God]90-god . Yes , [they]1405-they are walking regularly ; and [you]3085-you bet [your]3085-you boots that [they]1405-they are talking regularly , yes , and thinking regularly . But the one important thing for [us]3086-us is that [they]1405-they are disappearing regularly . "[451-the policeman]

[Syme]93-syme nodded . It was true that the black patch of [the pursuing men]1438-the pursuing men was growing smaller and smaller as [the peasant]1439-the peasant belaboured [his]1439-the peasant horse .

The level of the sunlit landscape , though flat as a whole , fell away on the farther side of [the wood]1350-the wood in billows of heavy slope towards [the sea]396-the sea , in a way not unlike [the lower slopes of [the Sussex downs]1443-the sussex downs]1442-the lower slopes of the sussex downs . The only difference was that in [Sussex]67-sussex [the road]299-the road would have been broken and angular like [a little brook]1445-a little brook , but here [the white French road]1446-the white french road fell sheer in front of [them]1447-them like a waterfall . Down this direct descent [the cart]1448-the cart clattered at a considerable angle , and in a few minutes , [the road]299-the road growing yet steeper , [they]1447-them saw below [them]1447-them [the little harbour of [Lancy]66-lancy]1450-the little harbour of lancy and [a great blue arc of [the sea]396-the sea]1451-a great blue arc of the sea . The travelling cloud of [[their]1447-them enemies]1453-their enemies had wholly disappeared from the horizon .

[The horse and cart]1454-the horse and cart took a sharp turn round a clump of elms , and the horse 's nose nearly struck the face of [an old gentleman who was sitting on the benches outside [the little caf of " [Le Soleil d'Or]3089-le soleil d'or]3088-the little caf of " le soleil d'or]3087-an old gentleman who was sitting on the benches outside the little caf of " le soleil d'or . "[1439-the peasant] [The peasant]1439-the peasant grunted an apology , and got down from [his]1439-the peasant seat . [The others]579-the others also descended one by one , and spoke to [the old gentleman]903-the old gentleman with fragmentary phrases of courtesy , for it was quite evident from [his]903-the old gentleman expansive manner that [he]903-the old gentleman was [the owner of [the little tavern]491-the little tavern]1458-the owner of the little tavern .

[He]903-the old gentleman was [a white - haired , apple - faced old boy , with sleepy eyes and a grey moustache]1460-a white - haired , apple - faced old boy , with sleepy eyes and a grey moustache ; stout , sedentary , and very innocent , of a type that may often be found in [France]55-france , but is still commoner in [Catholic Germany]68-catholic germany . Everything about [him]903-the old gentleman , [his]903-the old gentleman pipe , [his]903-the old gentleman pot of beer , [his]903-the old gentleman flowers , and [his]903-the old gentleman beehive , suggested an ancestral peace ; only when [[his]903-the old gentleman visitors]1461-his visitors looked up as [they]1461-his visitors entered [the inn - parlour]1462-the inn - parlour , [they]1461-his visitors saw the sword upon the wall .

[The Colonel]1237-the colonel , who greeted [the innkeeper]1414-the innkeeper as [an old friend]1465-an old friend , passed rapidly into [the inn - parlour]1462-the inn - parlour , and sat down ordering some ritual refreshment . The military decision of [his]903-the old gentleman action interested [Syme]93-syme , who sat next to [him]903-the old gentleman , and [he]93-syme took the opportunity when [the old innkeeper]1467-the old innkeeper had gone out of satisfying [his]93-syme curiosity .

" May [I]93-syme ask [you]1237-the colonel , [Colonel]155-colonel ducroix , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said in a low voice , " why [we]3090-we have come here ? "[93-syme]

[Colonel Ducroix]155-colonel ducroix smiled behind [his]155-colonel ducroix bristly white moustache .

"[155-colonel ducroix]

" Horses ! "[93-syme] repeated [Syme]93-syme , looking up quickly .

[Syme]93-syme looked up at the wall , and saw a crudely - painted and pathetic religious picture . Then [he]93-syme said

" Yes , "[155-colonel ducroix] answered [Ducroix]155-colonel ducroix , " [you]2203-sir may be quite certain that [I]155-colonel ducroix gave orders the moment [I]155-colonel ducroix came in . Almost as [he]155-colonel ducroix spoke , [the old innkeeper with the blue eyes and white hair]1470-the old innkeeper with the blue eyes and white hair came ambling into [the room]313-the room , and announced that six horses were saddled outside .

By [Ducroix]155-colonel ducroix 's advice [the five others]1472-the five others equipped [themselves]1472-the five others with some portable form of food and wine , and keeping [their]1472-the five others duelling swords as the only weapons available , [they]1472-the five others clattered away down [the steep , white road]1473-the steep , white road . [The two servants]1474-the two servants , who had carried [the Marquis]712-the marquis 's luggage when [he]712-the marquis was [a marquis]1476-a marquis , were left behind to drink at the caf by common consent , and not at all against [their]1474-the two servants own inclination .

By this time the afternoon sun was slanting westward , and by its rays [Syme]93-syme could see the sturdy figure of [the old innkeeper]1467-the old innkeeper growing smaller and smaller , but still standing and looking after [them]1472-the five others quite silently , the sunshine in [his]1467-the old innkeeper silver hair . [Syme]93-syme had a fixed , superstitious fancy , left in [his]93-syme mind by the chance phrase of [the Colonel]1237-the colonel , that this was indeed , perhaps , [the last honest stranger whom [he]93-syme should ever see upon [the earth]253-the earth]1479-the last honest stranger whom he should ever see upon the earth .

[He]93-syme was still looking at [this dwindling figure , which stood as a mere grey blot touched with a white flame]1481-this dwindling figure , which stood as a mere grey blot touched with a white flame against the great green wall of [the steep down behind [him]93-syme]1482-the steep down behind him . The horses had been saddled none too soon .

CHAPTER XII . [THE EARTH]253-the earth IN [ANARCHY]69-anarchy

Urging the horses to a gallop , without respect to the rather rugged descent of [the road]299-the road , [the horsemen]1490-the horsemen soon regained [their]1490-the horsemen advantage over [the men on the march]1491-the men on the march , and at last [the bulk of [the first buildings of [Lancy]66-lancy]1493-the first buildings of lancy]1492-the bulk of the first buildings of lancy cut off the sight of [[their]1490-the horsemen pursuers]1362-their pursuers . Nevertheless , the ride had been a long one , and by the time [they]1490-the horsemen reached [the real town]1495-the real town the west was warming with the colour and quality of sunset . [The Colonel]1237-the colonel suggested that , before making finally for [the police station]1497-the police station , [they]1490-the horsemen should make the effort , in passing , to attach to [themselves]1490-the horsemen [one more individual who might be useful]1498-one more individual who might be useful .

" [Four out of [the five rich men in [this town]3112-this town]3111-the five rich men in this town]3110-four out of the five rich men in this town , "[1237-the colonel] [he]1237-the colonel said , " are [common swindlers]3113-common swindlers . [I]1237-the colonel suppose the proportion is pretty equal all over [the world]182-the world . [The fifth]3115-the fifth is [a friend of mine]3116-a friend of mine , and [a very fine fellow]3117-a very fine fellow ; and what is even more important from [our]1490-the horsemen point of view , [he]3115-the fifth owns [a motor - car]3118-a motor - car . "[1237-the colonel]

" [I]773-the professor am afraid , "[773-the professor] said [the Professor]773-the professor in [his]773-the professor mirthful way , looking back along the white road on which the black , crawling patch might appear at any moment , " [I]773-the professor am afraid [we]1490-the horsemen have hardly time for afternoon calls . "[773-the professor]

" [[Doctor Renard]162-doctor renard 's house]3119-doctor renard 's house is only three minutes off , "[1237-the colonel] said [the Colonel]1237-the colonel .

" Yes , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , " if [we]1490-the horsemen ride on fast [we]1490-the horsemen must leave [them]3120-them behind , for [they]3120-them are on foot . "[93-syme]

" Yes , [he]1237-the colonel is quite on [your]1237-the colonel side . "[93-syme]

" But [he]1237-the colonel might be out . "[93-syme]

For a second [they]1502-they all sat as still as equestrian statues , and for a second for two or three or four seconds heaven and [earth]2207-earth seemed equally still . [The Colonel]1237-the colonel 's face had an instantaneous change , as if lightning had struck it , and yet left it scatheless .

" [They]1502-they have done [us]1490-the horsemen , "[1237-the colonel] [he]1237-the colonel said , with brief military irony . " Prepare to receive cavalry ! "[1237-the colonel]

" No ! "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme violently , " [I]93-syme do n't believe [he]1237-the colonel 'd do it . Not with all that white hair . "[93-syme]
