" [They]1502-they must be at least a hundred strong , for which reason [we]579-the others are all going to see [[my]1237-the colonel friend]3100-my friend [Renard]162-doctor renard , who has [a motor - car]3118-a motor - car . "[1237-the colonel]

With these words [he]1237-the colonel swung [his]1237-the colonel horse suddenly round [a street corner]1508-a street corner , and went down [the street]298-the street with such thundering speed , that [the others]579-the others , though already well at the gallop , had difficulty in following the flying tail of [his]1237-the colonel horse .

[Dr. Renard]163-dr. renard inhabited [a high and comfortable house at the top of [a steep street]1512-a steep street]1511-a high and comfortable house at the top of a steep street , so that when [the riders]1513-the riders alighted at [his]163-dr. renard door [they]1513-the riders could once more see [the solid green ridge of [the hill]1515-the hill]1514-the solid green ridge of the hill , with [the white road]1516-the white road across [it]1515-the hill , standing up above all [the roofs of [the town]2984-the town]1517-the roofs of the town . [They]1513-the riders breathed again to see that [the road]299-the road as yet was clear , and [they]1513-the riders rang the bell .

[Dr. Renard]163-dr. renard was [a beaming , brown - bearded man]1520-a beaming , brown - bearded man , a good example of that silent but very busy professional class which [France]55-france has preserved even more perfectly than [England]14-england . When the matter was explained to [him]163-dr. renard [he]163-dr. renard pooh - poohed the panic of [the ex - Marquis]1361-the ex - marquis altogether ; [he]163-dr. renard said , with the solid French scepticism , that there was no conceivable probability of [a general anarchist]1522-a general anarchist rising . " [Anarchy]164-anarchy , "[163-dr. renard] [he]163-dr. renard said , shrugging [his]163-dr. renard shoulders , " it is childishness ! "[163-dr. renard]

" _ Et a _ , "[1237-the colonel] cried out [the Colonel]1237-the colonel suddenly , pointing over the other 's shoulder , " and that is childishness , is n't it ? "[1237-the colonel]

[They]1513-the riders all looked round , and saw a curve of [black cavalry]1524-black cavalry come sweeping over [the top of [the hill]1515-the hill]1525-the top of the hill with all the energy of [Attila]165-attila . Swiftly as [they]1513-the riders rode , however , the whole rank still kept well together , and [they]1513-the riders could see the black vizards of the first line as level as a line of uniforms . But although the main black square was the same , though travelling faster , there was now one sensational difference which [they]1513-the riders could see clearly upon [the slope of [the hill]1515-the hill]1527-the slope of the hill , as if upon a slanted map . [The bulk of [the riders]1513-the riders]1529-the bulk of the riders were in one block ; but [one rider]1531-one rider flew far ahead of the column , and with frantic movements of hand and heel urged [his]1531-one rider horse faster and faster , so that [one]244-one might have fancied that [he]1531-one rider was not [the pursuer]1533-the pursuer but [the pursued]1534-the pursued . But even at that great distance [they]1513-the riders could see something so fanatical , so unquestionable in [his]1531-one rider figure , that [they]1513-the riders knew it was [the Secretary]670-the secretary [himself]670-the secretary . " [I]1237-the colonel am sorry to cut short a cultured discussion , "[1237-the colonel] said [the Colonel]1237-the colonel , " but can [you]1237-the colonel lend [me]1237-the colonel [your]1237-the colonel [motor - car]3125-motor - car now , in two minutes ? "[1237-the colonel]

" [I]163-dr. renard have a suspicion that [you]1237-the colonel are all mad , "[163-dr. renard] said [Dr. Renard]163-dr. renard , smiling sociably ; " but God forbid that madness should in any way interrupt friendship . Let [us]1237-the colonel go round to [the garage]3126-the garage . "[163-dr. renard]

[Dr. Renard]163-dr. renard was [a mild man with monstrous wealth]1537-a mild man with monstrous wealth ; [[his]163-dr. renard rooms]1538-his rooms were like [the Musee de Cluny]1539-the musee de cluny , and [he]163-dr. renard had [three motor - cars]1540-three motor - cars . These , however , [he]163-dr. renard seemed to use very sparingly , having the simple tastes of [the French middle class]1541-the french middle class , and when [[his]163-dr. renard impatient friends]1542-his impatient friends came to examine [them]1540-three motor - cars , it took [them]1542-his impatient friends some time to assure [themselves]1542-his impatient friends that one of [them]1540-three motor - cars even could be made to work . This with some difficulty [they]1542-his impatient friends brought round into [the street]298-the street before [[the Doctor]1073-the doctor 's house]1545-the doctor 's house . When [they]1542-his impatient friends came out of [the dim garage]1546-the dim garage [they]1542-his impatient friends were startled to find that twilight had already fallen with the abruptness of night in [the tropics]1547-the tropics . Either [they]1542-his impatient friends had been longer in [the place]214-the place than [they]1542-his impatient friends imagined , or some unusual canopy of cloud had gathered over [the town]2984-the town . [They]1542-his impatient friends looked down [the steep streets]1550-the steep streets , and seemed to see a slight mist coming up from [the sea]396-the sea .

" It is now or never , "[135-dr. bull] said [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull . " [I]135-dr. bull hear horses . "[135-dr. bull]

" No , "[773-the professor] corrected [the Professor]773-the professor , " a horse . "[773-the professor]

And as [they]1542-his impatient friends listened , it was evident that the noise , rapidly coming nearer on the rattling stones , was not the noise of [the whole cavalcade]1553-the whole cavalcade but that of [the one horseman]1554-the one horseman , who had left it far behind [the insane Secretary]1555-the insane secretary .

[[Syme]93-syme 's family]1556-syme 's family , like most of [those who end in the simple life]1557-those who end in the simple life , had once owned [a motor]1558-a motor , and [he]93-syme knew all about [them]1556-syme 's family . [He]93-syme had leapt at once into the chauffeur 's seat , and with flushed face was wrenching and tugging at the disused machinery . [He]93-syme bent [his]93-syme strength upon one handle , and then said quite quietly

" [I]93-syme am afraid it 's no go . "[93-syme]

As [he]93-syme spoke , there swept round the corner [a man]240-a man rigid on [his]240-a man rushing horse , with the rush and rigidity of an arrow . [He]93-syme had a smile that thrust out [his]93-syme chin as if it were dislocated . [He]93-syme swept alongside of [the stationary car]1560-the stationary car , into which [its]1560-the stationary car company had crowded , and laid [his]93-syme hand on the front . It was [the Secretary]670-the secretary , and [his]670-the secretary mouth went quite straight in the solemnity of triumph .

[Syme]93-syme was leaning hard upon the steering wheel , and there was no sound but the rumble of [the other pursuers]1562-the other pursuers riding into [the town]2984-the town . Then there came quite suddenly a scream of scraping iron , and [the car]1564-the car leapt forward . [It]1564-the car plucked [the Secretary]670-the secretary clean out of [his]670-the secretary saddle , as a knife is whipped out of its sheath , trailed [him]670-the secretary kicking terribly for twenty yards , and left [him]670-the secretary flung flat upon [the road]299-the road far in front of [his]670-the secretary frightened horse . As [the car]1564-the car took the corner of [the street]298-the street with a splendid curve , [they]1569-we could just see [the other anarchists]1570-the other anarchists filling [the street]298-the street and raising [[their]1570-the other anarchists fallen leader]1572-their fallen leader .

" [I]773-the professor ca n't understand why it has grown so dark , "[773-the professor] said [the Professor]773-the professor at last in a low voice .

" Going to be a storm , [I]135-dr. bull think , "[135-dr. bull] said [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull . " [I]135-dr. bull say , it 's a pity [we]1569-we have n't got a light on [this car]3127-this car , if only to see by . "[135-dr. bull]

" [We]1569-we have , "[1237-the colonel] said [the Colonel]1237-the colonel , and from the floor of [the car]1564-the car [he]1237-the colonel fished up a heavy , old - fashioned , carved iron lantern with a light inside it . It was obviously an antique , and it would seem as if [its]1564-the car original use had been in some way semi - religious , for there was a rude moulding of a cross upon one of its sides .

" Where on earth did [you]1237-the colonel get that ? "[773-the professor] asked [the Professor]773-the professor .

" [I]1237-the colonel got it where [I]1237-the colonel got [the car]1564-the car , "[1237-the colonel] answered [the Colonel]1237-the colonel , chuckling , " from [[my]1237-the colonel best friend]3129-my best friend . ' [I]1237-the colonel suppose , ' [I]1237-the colonel said , ' there 's no time to get a lamp . ' [He]163-dr. renard looked up , blinking amiably at the beautiful arched ceiling of [[his]163-dr. renard own front hall]3134-his own front hall . From this was suspended , by chains of exquisite ironwork , this lantern , one of the hundred treasures of [[his]163-dr. renard treasure house]3135-his treasure house . By sheer force [he]163-dr. renard tore the lamp out of [his]163-dr. renard own ceiling , shattering the painted panels , and bringing down two blue vases with [his]163-dr. renard violence . Then [he]163-dr. renard handed [me]1237-the colonel the iron lantern , and [I]1237-the colonel put it in [the car]1564-the car . Was [I]1237-the colonel not right when [I]1237-the colonel said that [Dr. Renard]163-dr. renard was worth knowing ? "[1237-the colonel]

" [You]1237-the colonel were , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme seriously , and hung the heavy lantern over the front . There was a certain allegory of [their]1578-we whole position in the contrast between [the modern automobile]1579-the modern automobile and its strange ecclesiastical lamp . Hitherto [they]1578-we had passed through [the quietest part of [the town]2984-the town]1580-the quietest part of the town , meeting at most [one or two pedestrians]1582-one or two pedestrians , who could give [them]1578-we no hint of the peace or the hostility of [the place]214-the place . Now , however , the windows in [the houses]1584-the houses began one by one to be lit up , giving a greater sense of habitation and humanity . [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull turned to [the new detective who had led [their]1578-we flight]1585-the new detective who had led their flight , and permitted [himself]135-dr. bull one of [his]135-dr. bull natural and friendly smiles .

[The town]2984-the town was mostly in shadow , but the sun had not sunk ; wherever its level light could break through , it painted everything a burning gold . [They]1660-four men turned and faced [the town]2984-the town .

[That town]1676-that town was transfigured with uproar . All along the high parade from which [they]1660-four men had just descended was a dark and roaring stream of humanity , with tossing arms and fiery faces , groping and glaring towards [them]1660-four men . The long dark line was dotted with torches and lanterns ; but even where no flame lit up a furious face , [they]1660-four men could see in [the farthest figure]1677-the farthest figure , in the most shadowy gesture , an organised hate . It was clear that [they]1660-four men were [the accursed of [all men]1679-all men]1678-the accursed of all men , and [they]1660-four men knew not why .

[Two or three men , looking little and black like monkeys]1680-two or three men , looking little and black like monkeys , leapt over the edge as [they]1680-two or three men , looking little and black like monkeys had done and dropped on to [the beach]1671-the beach . [These]1682-these came ploughing down [the deep sand]1683-the deep sand , shouting horribly , and strove to wade into [the sea]396-the sea at random . The example was followed , and the whole black mass of [men]179-men began to run and drip over the edge like black treacle .

Foremost among [the men on [the beach]1671-the beach]1686-the men on the beach [Syme]93-syme saw [the peasant who had driven [[their]1660-four men cart]1689-their cart]1688-the peasant who had driven their cart . " [The peasant]1439-the peasant ! "[93-syme] cried [Syme]93-syme . " [They]1439-the peasant have not risen since the Middle Ages . "[93-syme]

" It may be , "[773-the professor] said [the Professor]773-the professor absently . Then [he]773-the professor added in [his]773-the professor dreamy voice , " What is all that at the end of the ' Dunciad ' ?[773-the professor]

' Nor public flame ; nor private , dares to shine ; Nor human light is left , nor glimpse divine ! Lo ! [thy]1694-thy dread Empire , Chaos , is restored ; Light dies before thine uncreating word : [Thy]1694-thy hand , [great Anarch]168-great anarch , lets the curtain fall ; And universal darkness buries all . ' "[168-great anarch]

" Stop ! "[135-dr. bull] cried [Bull]135-dr. bull suddenly , " [the gendarmes]3102-the gendarmes are out . "[135-dr. bull]

" [They]3102-the gendarmes are charging [the mob]3221-the mob ! "[135-dr. bull] cried [Bull]135-dr. bull in ecstacy or alarm .

" No , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , " [they]3102-the gendarmes are formed along the parade . "[93-syme]

" [They]3102-the gendarmes have unslung [their]3102-the gendarmes carbines , "[135-dr. bull] cried [Bull]135-dr. bull dancing with excitement .

" Yes , "[160-ratcliffe] said [Ratcliffe]160-ratcliffe , " and [they]3102-the gendarmes are going to fire on [us]1697-us . "[160-ratcliffe]

As [he]160-ratcliffe spoke there came a long crackle of musketry , and bullets seemed to hop like hailstones on the stones in front of [them]1697-us .

" [The gendarmes]3102-the gendarmes have joined [them]3102-the gendarmes ! "[773-the professor] cried [the Professor]773-the professor , and struck [his]773-the professor forehead .

" [I]135-dr. bull am in [the padded cell]3223-the padded cell , "[135-dr. bull] said [Bull]135-dr. bull solidly .

There was a long silence , and then [Ratcliffe]160-ratcliffe said , looking out over [the swollen sea]1700-the swollen sea , all a sort of grey purple

" What does it matter who is mad or who is sane ? [We]1697-us shall all be dead soon . "[160-ratcliffe]

[Syme]93-syme turned to [him]135-dr. bull and said

" [You]135-dr. bull are quite hopeless , then ? "[93-syme]

" No ; oddly enough [I]160-ratcliffe am not quite hopeless . There is one insane little hope that [I]160-ratcliffe can not get out of [my]160-ratcliffe mind . " Will [you]93-syme believe [your]93-syme eyes ? "[300-the other] asked [the other]300-the other , and pointed to [the beach]1671-the beach .

[Many of [[their]1710-many of their pursuers pursuers]1362-their pursuers]1710-many of their pursuers had waded into the water shaking [their]1710-many of their pursuers fists , but [the sea]396-the sea was rough , and [they]1710-many of their pursuers could not reach [the pier]2326-the pier . [Two or three figures]1714-two or three figures , however , stood on the beginning of [the stone footway]1715-the stone footway , and seemed to be cautiously advancing down [it]1715-the stone footway . The glare of a chance lantern lit up the faces of [the two foremost]1716-the two foremost . One face wore a black half - mask , and under it the mouth was twisting about in such a madness of nerves that the black tuft of beard wriggled round and round like a restless , living thing . [The other]300-the other was the red face and white moustache of [Colonel Ducroix]155-colonel ducroix . [They]1714-two or three figures were in earnest consultation .

" Yes , [he]155-colonel ducroix is gone too , "[773-the professor] said [the Professor]773-the professor , and sat down on a stone . " [Everything]3235-everything 's gone . [I]773-the professor 'm gone ! [I]773-the professor ca n't trust [my]773-the professor own bodily machinery . " When [my]93-syme hand flies up , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , " it will strike [somebody else]3236-somebody else , "[93-syme] and [he]93-syme strode along [the pier]2326-the pier towards [the Colonel]1237-the colonel , the sword in one hand and the lantern in the other .

As if to destroy the last hope or doubt , [the Colonel]1237-the colonel , who saw [him]93-syme coming , pointed [his]1237-the colonel revolver at [him]93-syme and fired . The shot missed [Syme]93-syme , but struck [his]1237-the colonel sword , breaking it short at the hilt . [Syme]93-syme rushed on , and swung the iron lantern above [his]93-syme head .

" [Judas]170-judas before [Herod]171-herod ! "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said , and struck [the Colonel]1237-the colonel down upon the stones . Then [he]93-syme turned to [the Secretary , whose frightful mouth]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth was almost foaming now , and held the lamp high with so rigid and arresting a gesture , that [the man]315-the man was , as it were , frozen for a moment , and forced to hear .

" Do [you]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth see this lantern ? "[93-syme] cried [Syme]93-syme in a terrible voice . " Do [you]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth see the cross carved on it , and the flame inside ? [You]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth did not make it . [You]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth did not light it . [Better men than [you]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth]3237-better men than you , [men who could believe and obey]3238-men who could believe and obey , twisted the entrails of iron and preserved the legend of fire . There is not [a street]551-a street [you]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth walk on , there is not a thread [you]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth wear , that was not made as this lantern was , by denying [your]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth philosophy of dirt and rats . [You]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth can make nothing . [You]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth can only destroy . [You]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth will destroy [mankind]2239-mankind ; [you]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth will destroy [the world]182-the world . Let that suffice [you]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth . Yet this one old Christian lantern [you]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth shall not destroy . It shall go where [[your]1723-the secretary , whose frightful mouth empire of apes]3242-your empire of apes will never have the wit to find it . "[93-syme]

[He]1725-he struck [the Secretary]670-the secretary once with the lantern so that [he]670-the secretary staggered ; and then , whirling it twice round [his]670-the secretary head , sent it flying far out to [sea]1727-sea , where it flared like a roaring rocket and fell .

" Swords ! "[93-syme] shouted [Syme]93-syme , turning [his]93-syme flaming face to [the three behind [him]93-syme]1728-the three behind him . " Let [us]3243-us charge these dogs , for [our]3243-us time has come to die . "[93-syme]

[[His]93-syme three companions]1729-his three companions came after [him]93-syme sword in hand . [Syme]93-syme 's sword was broken , but [he]1725-he rent a bludgeon from the fist of [a fisherman]1730-a fisherman , flinging [him]1725-he down . [The Secretary]670-the secretary , ever since [Syme]93-syme 's speech , had stood with [his]670-the secretary hand to [his]670-the secretary stricken head as if dazed ; now [he]670-the secretary suddenly pulled off [his]670-the secretary black mask .

The pale face thus peeled in the lamplight revealed not so much rage as astonishment . [He]670-the secretary put up [his]670-the secretary hand with an anxious authority .

" There is some mistake , "[670-the secretary] [he]670-the secretary said . " [Mr. Syme]93-syme , [I]670-the secretary hardly think [you]93-syme understand [your]93-syme position . [I]670-the secretary arrest [you]93-syme in the name of the law . "[670-the secretary]

" Of the law ? "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , and dropped [his]93-syme stick .

CHAPTER XIII . [THE PURSUIT OF]1737-the pursuit of [THE PRESIDENT]2547-the president

Next morning five bewildered but [hilarious people]1739-hilarious people took [the boat]2414-the boat for [Dover]56-dover . [The poor old Colonel]1741-the poor old colonel might have had some cause to complain , having been first forced to fight for [two factions that did n't exist , and then knocked down with an iron lantern]1742-two factions that did n't exist , and then knocked down with an iron lantern . But [he]135-dr. bull was [a magnanimous old gentleman]1743-a magnanimous old gentleman , and being much relieved that [neither party]1744-neither party had anything to do with dynamite , [he]135-dr. bull saw [them]1745-them off on [the pier]2326-the pier with great geniality .

[The five reconciled detectives]1747-the five reconciled detectives had a hundred details to explain to [each other]2300-each other . [The Secretary]670-the secretary had to tell [Syme]93-syme how [they]1747-the five reconciled detectives had come to wear masks originally in order to approach [the supposed enemy]1750-the supposed enemy as [fellow - conspirators]1751-fellow - conspirators .

[Syme]93-syme had to explain how [they]1747-the five reconciled detectives had fled with such swiftness through [a civilised country]1752-a civilised country . But above all these matters of detail which could be explained , rose the central mountain of the matter that [they]1747-the five reconciled detectives could not explain . What did it all mean ? If [they]1747-the five reconciled detectives were [all harmless officers]1753-all harmless officers , what was [Sunday]110-sunday ? If [he]110-sunday had not seized [the world]182-the world , what on earth had [he]110-sunday been up to ? [Inspector Ratcliffe]160-ratcliffe was still gloomy about this .

" [I]160-ratcliffe ca n't make head or tail of old [Sunday]110-sunday 's little game any more than [you]93-syme can , "[160-ratcliffe] [he]160-ratcliffe said . " But whatever else [Sunday]110-sunday is , [he]110-sunday is n't [a blameless citizen]3257-a blameless citizen . Damn it ! do [you]93-syme remember [his]110-sunday face ? "[160-ratcliffe]

" [I]93-syme grant [you]93-syme , "[93-syme] answered [Syme]93-syme , " that [I]93-syme have never been able to forget it . "[93-syme]

" Well , "[670-the secretary] said [the Secretary]670-the secretary , " [I]670-the secretary suppose [we]3258-we can find out soon , for tomorrow [we]3258-we have [our]3258-we next general meeting . "[670-the secretary]

" [I]773-the professor suppose [you]773-the professor are right , "[773-the professor] said [the Professor]773-the professor reflectively . "[773-the professor]

Throughout [their]1759-they whole journey by [boat]1760-boat and [train]1761-train [they]1759-they were highly convivial , but [they]1759-they instinctively kept together . [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull , who had always been [the optimist of [the party]1763-the party]1762-the optimist of the party , endeavoured to persuade [the other four]802-the other four that [the whole company]590-the whole company could take [the same hansom cab]1766-the same hansom cab from [Victoria]96-victoria ; but this was over - ruled , and [they]1759-they went in [a four - wheeler]1767-a four - wheeler , with [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull on the box , singing . [They]1759-they finished [their]1759-they journey at [an hotel in [Piccadilly Circus]72-piccadilly circus]1768-an hotel in piccadilly circus , so as to be close to the early breakfast next morning in [Leicester Square]33-leicester square . Yet even then the adventures of the day were not entirely over . [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull , discontented with the general proposal to go to bed , had strolled out of [the hotel]570-the hotel at about eleven to see and taste some of the beauties of [London]3-london . Twenty minutes afterwards , however , [he]135-dr. bull came back and made quite a clamour in [the hall]1770-the hall . [Syme]93-syme , who tried at first to soothe [him]135-dr. bull , was forced at last to listen to [his]135-dr. bull communication with quite new attention .

Next morning [the battalion of [the reunited six]1775-the reunited six]1774-the battalion of the reunited six marched stolidly towards [the hotel]570-the hotel in [Leicester Square]33-leicester square .

[They]1775-the reunited six turned in silence into [the Square]549-the square , and though [the hotel]570-the hotel was in the opposite corner , [they]1775-the reunited six saw at once [the little balcony]1779-the little balcony and a figure that looked too big for [it]570-the hotel . [He]1780-him was sitting alone with bent head , poring over a newspaper . But [all [his]1780-him councillors , who had come to vote [him]1780-him down]1781-all his councillors , who had come to vote him down , crossed [that Square]1782-that square as if [they]1781-all his councillors , who had come to vote him down were watched out of heaven by a hundred eyes .

[They]1775-the reunited six had disputed much upon [their]1775-the reunited six policy , about whether [they]1775-the reunited six should leave [the unmasked Gogol]126-gogol without and begin diplomatically , or whether [they]1775-the reunited six should bring [him]1780-him in and blow up the gunpowder at once . " [My]93-syme reason is quite simple , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme . " [I]93-syme attack [him]1780-him rashly because [I]93-syme am afraid of [him]1780-him . "[93-syme]

[They]1775-the reunited six followed [Syme]93-syme up [the dark stair]1784-the dark stair in silence , and [they]1775-the reunited six all came out simultaneously into the broad sunlight of the morning and the broad sunlight of [Sunday]110-sunday 's smile .

" Delightful ! "[1783-the secretary to the last] [he]1783-the secretary to the last said . " So pleased to see [you]1775-the reunited six all . What an exquisite day it is . Is [the Czar]658-the czar dead ? "[1783-the secretary to the last]

[The Secretary , who happened to be foremost]1785-the secretary , who happened to be foremost , drew [himself]1785-the secretary , who happened to be foremost together for a dignified outburst .

" Of course , [we]1775-the reunited six all have [our]1775-the reunited six opinions and even [our]1775-the reunited six eyes , but really to call them disgusting before [the man]315-the man [himself]315-the man "[2547-the president]

" [We]1775-the reunited six have no time for tomfoolery , "[670-the secretary] said [the Secretary]670-the secretary , breaking in savagely . " [We]1775-the reunited six have come to know what all this means . Who are [you]2203-sir ? What are [you]2203-sir ? Why did [you]2203-sir get [us]1775-the reunited six all here ? " [Candidates]3277-candidates , "[110-sunday] murmured [Sunday]110-sunday , " are only required to answer eight out of the seventeen questions on the paper . As far as [I]110-sunday can make out , [you]2203-sir want [me]110-sunday to tell [you]2203-sir what [I]110-sunday am , and what [you]2203-sir are , and what this table is , and what [this Council]3278-this council is , and what [this world]3279-this world is for all [I]110-sunday know . " And [you]2547-the president , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme , leaning forward , " what are [you]2547-the president ? "[93-syme]

" [I]2547-the president ? What am [I]2547-the president ? " [You]2547-the president want to know what [I]2547-the president am , do [you]2547-the president ? [Bull]135-dr. bull , [you]135-dr. bull are [a man of science]3281-a man of science . Grub in the roots of those trees and find out the truth about [them]1792-them . [Syme]93-syme , [you]93-syme are [a poet]217-a poet . Stare at those morning clouds . But [I]2547-the president tell [you]93-syme this , that [you]93-syme will have found out the truth of the last tree and the top - most cloud before the truth about [me]2547-the president . [You]93-syme will understand [the sea]396-the sea , and [I]2547-the president shall be still a riddle ; [you]93-syme shall know what the stars are , and not know what [I]2547-the president am . Since the beginning of [the world]182-the world [all men]1679-all men have hunted [me]2547-the president like [a wolf kings]3286-a wolf kings and [sages]3287-sages , and [poets]3288-poets and [lawgivers]3289-lawgivers , [all the churches]3290-all the churches , and all the philosophies . But [I]2547-the president have never been caught yet , and the skies will fall in the time [I]2547-the president turn to [bay]3291-bay . [I]2547-the president have given [them]1793-them a good run for [their]1793-them money , and [I]2547-the president will now . "[2547-the president]

Before one of [them]1793-them could move , [the monstrous man]1794-the monstrous man had swung [himself]1794-the monstrous man like some huge ourang - outang over the balustrade of [the balcony]561-the balcony . Yet before [he]1794-the monstrous man dropped [he]1794-the monstrous man pulled [himself]1794-the monstrous man up again as on a horizontal bar , and thrusting [his]1794-the monstrous man great chin over the edge of [the balcony]561-the balcony , said solemnly

" There 's one thing [I]1794-the monstrous man 'll tell [you]1793-them though about who [I]1794-the monstrous man am . [I]1794-the monstrous man am [the man in [the dark room]737-the dark room , who made [you]1793-them all [policemen]2422-policemen]3292-the man in the dark room , who made you all policemen . "[1794-the monstrous man]

With that [he]1794-the monstrous man fell from [the balcony]561-the balcony , bouncing on the stones below like a great ball of india - rubber , and went bounding off towards [the corner of [the Alhambra]34-the alhambra]1798-the corner of the alhambra , where [he]1794-the monstrous man hailed [a hansom - cab]1799-a hansom - cab and sprang inside [it]1799-a hansom - cab . [The six detectives]1800-the six detectives had been standing thunderstruck and livid in the light of [his]1794-the monstrous man last assertion ; but when [he]1794-the monstrous man disappeared into [the cab]306-the cab , [Syme]93-syme 's practical senses returned to [him]93-syme , and leaping over [the balcony]561-the balcony so recklessly as almost to break [his]93-syme legs , [he]93-syme called [another cab]1803-another cab .

[He]93-syme and [Bull]135-dr. bull sprang into [the cab]306-the cab together , [the Professor]773-the professor and [the Inspector]1806-the inspector into another , while [the Secretary]670-the secretary and [the late Gogol]1808-the late gogol scrambled into a third just in time to pursue the flying [Syme]93-syme , who was pursuing [the flying President]1809-the flying president . [Sunday]110-sunday led [them]1800-the six detectives a wild chase towards [the north - west]1810-the north - west , [[his]110-sunday cabman]1811-his cabman , evidently under the influence of more than common inducements , urging the horse at breakneck speed . But [Syme]93-syme was in no mood for delicacies , and [he]93-syme stood up in [[his]93-syme own cab]1812-his own cab shouting , " Stop [thief]3295-thief ! "[93-syme] until [crowds]1813-crowds ran along beside [[his]93-syme cab]1814-his cab , and [policemen]2422-policemen began to stop and ask questions . All this had its influence upon [[the President]2547-the president 's cabman]1817-the president 's cabman , who began to look dubious , and to slow down to a trot . [He]93-syme opened the trap to talk reasonably to [his]93-syme fare , and in so doing let the long whip droop over the front of [the cab]306-the cab . [Sunday]110-sunday leant forward , seized it , and jerked it violently out of [the man]315-the man 's hand . Then standing up in front of [the cab]306-the cab [himself]110-sunday , [he]110-sunday lashed the horse and roared aloud , so that [they]1821-they went down [the streets]203-the streets like a flying storm . [Through street]1823-through street after [street]1824-street and [square]1825-square after [square]1825-square went whirling [this preposterous vehicle]1827-this preposterous vehicle , in which the fare was urging the horse and [the driver]1828-the driver trying desperately to stop [it]1827-this preposterous vehicle . [The other three cabs]1829-the other three cabs came after [it]1827-this preposterous vehicle ( if the phrase be permissible of [a cab]2201-a cab ) like panting hounds . [Shops]1831-shops and [streets]1832-streets shot by like rattling arrows .

At the highest ecstacy of speed , [Sunday]110-sunday turned round on the splashboard where [he]110-sunday stood , and sticking [his]110-sunday great grinning head out of [the cab]306-the cab , with white hair whistling in the wind , [he]110-sunday made a horrible face at [[his]110-sunday pursuers]1834-his pursuers , like [some colossal urchin]1835-some colossal urchin . Then raising [his]110-sunday right hand swiftly , [he]110-sunday flung a ball of paper in [Syme]93-syme 's face and vanished . [Syme]93-syme caught the thing while instinctively warding it off , and discovered that it consisted of two crumpled papers . One was addressed to [himself]110-sunday , and the other to [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull , with a very long , and it is to be feared partly ironical , string of letters after [his]135-dr. bull name . [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull 's address was , at any rate , considerably longer than [his]135-dr. bull communication , for the communication consisted entirely of the words :

" What about [Martin Tupper _]172-martin tupper _ now ? _ "[93-syme]

" What does [the old maniac]3296-the old maniac mean ? "[135-dr. bull] asked [Bull]135-dr. bull , staring at the words . " What does [yours]93-syme say , [Syme]93-syme ? "[135-dr. bull]

[Syme]93-syme 's message was , at any rate , longer , and ran as follows :

" [No one]2257-no one would regret anything in the nature of an interference by [the Archdeacon]3298-the archdeacon more than [I.]93-syme [I]93-syme trust it will not come to that . But , for the last time , where are [your]93-syme goloshes ? The thing is too bad , especially after what [uncle]3299-uncle said . "[93-syme]

[[The President]2547-the president 's cabman]1817-the president 's cabman seemed to be regaining some control over [his]1817-the president 's cabman horse , and [the pursuers]1838-the pursuers gained a little as [they]1838-the pursuers swept round into [the Edgware Road]74-the edgware road . And here there occurred what seemed to [the allies]1839-the allies a providential stoppage . [Traffic of every kind]1840-traffic of every kind was swerving to right or left or stopping , for down [the long road]1841-the long road was coming the unmistakable roar announcing the fire - engine , which in a few seconds went by like a brazen thunderbolt . But quick as it went by , [Sunday]110-sunday had bounded out of [his]110-sunday cab , sprung at the fire - engine , caught it , slung [himself]110-sunday on to it , and was seen as [he]110-sunday disappeared in the noisy distance talking to [the astonished fireman]1842-the astonished fireman with explanatory gestures .

" After [him]110-sunday ! "[93-syme] howled [Syme]93-syme . " [He]110-sunday ca n't go astray now . There 's no mistaking a fire - engine . "[93-syme]

[The three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment]1843-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment , whipped up [their]1843-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment horses and slightly decreased the distance between [themselves]1843-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment and [their]1843-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment disappearing prey . [The President]2547-the president acknowledged this proximity by coming to the back of [the car]1564-the car , bowing repeatedly , kissing [his]2547-the president hand , and finally flinging a neatly - folded note into the bosom of [Inspector Ratcliffe]160-ratcliffe . When [that gentleman]1846-that gentleman opened it , not without impatience , [he]1846-that gentleman found it contained the words :

" Fly at once . The truth about [your]2547-the president trouser - stretchers is known . [A FRIEND]2318-a friend . "[1846-that gentleman]

[The fire - engine]1847-the fire - engine had struck still farther to [the north]1848-the north , into [a region that [they]1843-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment did not recognise]1849-a region that they did not recognise ; and as it ran by a line of high railings shadowed with trees , [the six friends]1850-the six friends were startled , but somewhat relieved , to see [the President]2547-the president leap from the fire - engine , though whether through another whim or the increasing protest of [[his]2547-the president entertainers]1852-his entertainers [they]1843-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment could not see . Before the three cabs , however , could reach up to the spot , [he]2547-the president had gone up the high railings like a huge grey cat , tossed [himself]2547-the president over , and vanished in a darkness of leaves .

[Syme]93-syme with a furious gesture stopped [[his]93-syme cab]1814-his cab , jumped out , and sprang also to [the escalade]1854-the escalade . When [he]93-syme had one leg over the fence and [[his]93-syme friends]1207-his friends were following , [he]93-syme turned a face on [them]1843-the three cabmen , who had been stunned for a moment which shone quite pale in the shadow .

" What place can this be ? "[93-syme] [he]93-syme asked . " Can it be [the old devil 's house]3301-the old devil 's house ? [I]93-syme 've heard [he]2547-the president has [a house in [North London]75-north london]3302-a house in north london . "[93-syme]

[He]93-syme held up [his]93-syme hand , and there came out of the thicket a long growling roar that seemed to get under the skin and freeze the flesh a low thrilling roar that made a throbbing in the air all about [them]1858-their .

" The dogs of [Sunday]110-sunday would be no ordinary dogs , "[126-gogol] said [Gogol]126-gogol , and shuddered .

[Syme]93-syme had jumped down on the other side , but [he]93-syme still stood listening impatiently .

There broke upon [their]1858-their ear a hoarse screaming as of things protesting and clamouring in sudden pain ; and then , far off like an echo , what sounded like a long nasal trumpet .

" Well , [[his]2547-the president house]1487-his house ought to be hell ! "[670-the secretary] said [the Secretary]670-the secretary ; " and if it is hell , [I]670-the secretary 'm going in ! "[670-the secretary] and [he]670-the secretary sprang over the tall railings almost with one swing .

[The others]579-the others followed . [They]1858-their broke through a tangle of plants and shrubs , and came out on [an open path]1861-an open path . Nothing was in sight , but [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull suddenly struck [his]135-dr. bull hands together .

" Has it come this way ? "[1866-the keeper] gasped [the keeper]1866-the keeper .

[He]3309-an elephant has run away with the elephant . [The elephant]3317-the elephant is not made by [God]90-god that could run away with [him]3317-the elephant if [he]3317-the elephant did not consent to the elopement . And , by thunder , there [he]3317-the elephant is ! "[93-syme]

There was no doubt about it this time . Clean across [the space of grass]1870-the space of grass , about two hundred yards away , with [a crowd]3034-a crowd screaming and scampering vainly at [his]93-syme heels , went [a huge grey elephant]1872-a huge grey elephant at an awful stride , with [his]1872-a huge grey elephant trunk thrown out as rigid as [a ship]1873-a ship 's bowsprit , and trumpeting like the trumpet of doom . " Stop [him]3317-the elephant ! "[1875-the populace] screamed [the populace]1875-the populace . " [He]3317-the elephant 'll be out of the gate ! "[1875-the populace]

" Stop a landslide ! "[1866-the keeper] said [the keeper]1866-the keeper . " [He]3317-the elephant is out of the gate ! "[1866-the keeper]

And even as [he]1866-the keeper spoke , a final crash and roar of terror announced that the great grey elephant had broken out of the gates of [the Zoological Gardens]1877-the zoological gardens , and was careening down [Albany Street]77-albany street like [a new and swift sort of omnibus]1878-a new and swift sort of omnibus .

" [Great Lord]173-great lord ! "[135-dr. bull] cried [Bull]135-dr. bull , " [I]135-dr. bull never knew an elephant could go so fast . Well , it must be hansom - cabs again if [we]1879-they are to keep [him]3317-the elephant in sight . "[135-dr. bull]

As [they]1879-they raced along to the gate out of which the elephant had vanished , [Syme]93-syme felt a glaring panorama of the strange animals in the cages which [they]1879-they passed . Afterwards [he]93-syme thought it queer that [he]93-syme should have seen [them]1880-them so clearly . [He]93-syme remembered especially seeing pelicans , with [their]1880-them preposterous , pendant throats . [He]93-syme wondered why the pelican was the symbol of charity , except it was that it wanted a good deal of charity to admire [a pelican]1881-a pelican . [He]93-syme remembered a hornbill , which was simply a huge yellow beak with a small bird tied on behind it . The whole gave [him]93-syme a sensation , the vividness of which [he]93-syme could not explain , that [Nature]174-nature was always making quite mysterious jokes . [Sunday]110-sunday had told [them]1879-they that [they]1879-they would understand [him]93-syme when [they]1879-they had understood the stars . [He]93-syme wondered whether even [the archangels]1882-the archangels understood the hornbill .

[The six unhappy detectives]1883-the six unhappy detectives flung [themselves]1883-the six unhappy detectives into [cabs]1884-cabs and followed the elephant sharing the terror which [he]93-syme spread through the long stretch of [the streets]203-the streets . This time [Sunday]110-sunday did not turn round , but offered [them]1879-they the solid stretch of [his]110-sunday unconscious back , which maddened [them]1879-they , if possible , more than [his]110-sunday previous mockeries . Just before [they]1879-they came to [Baker Street]7-baker street , however , [he]93-syme was seen to throw something far up into the air , as [a boy]546-a boy does a ball meaning to catch it again . But at [their]1879-they rate of racing it fell far behind , just by the cab containing [Gogol]126-gogol ; and in faint hope of a clue or for some impulse unexplainable , [he]93-syme stopped [[his]93-syme cab]1814-his cab so as to pick it up . It was addressed to [himself]93-syme , and was quite a bulky parcel . On examination , however , its bulk was found to consist of thirty - three pieces of paper of no value wrapped one round the other . When the last covering was torn away it reduced itself to a small slip of paper , on which was written :

" The word , [I]1888-the man once known as gogol fancy , should be ' pink ' . "[1888-the man once known as gogol]

[The man once known as [Gogol]126-gogol]1888-the man once known as gogol said nothing , but the movements of [his]1888-the man once known as gogol hands and feet were like those of [a man urging a horse to renewed efforts]1889-a man urging a horse to renewed efforts .

Through [street]1824-street after [street]1824-street , through [district]1892-district after [district]1892-district , went the prodigy of the flying elephant , calling [crowds]1813-crowds to every window , and driving the traffic left and right . And still through all this insane publicity the three cabs toiled after it , until [they]1879-they came to be regarded as part of a procession , and perhaps the advertisement of a circus . [They]1879-they went at such a rate that distances were shortened beyond belief , and [Syme]93-syme saw [the Albert Hall]78-the albert hall in [Kensington]79-kensington when [he]93-syme thought that [he]93-syme was still in [Paddington]80-paddington . The animal 's pace was even more fast and free through [the empty , aristocratic streets of [South Kensington]81-south kensington]1895-the empty , aristocratic streets of south kensington , and [he]93-syme finally headed towards that part of [the sky - line where the enormous Wheel of Earl 's Court]1896-the sky - line where the enormous wheel of earl 's court stood up in the sky . The wheel grew larger and larger , till it filled heaven like the wheel of stars .

The beast outstripped the cabs . [They]1879-they lost [him]93-syme round several corners , and when [they]1879-they came to one of the gates of [the Earl 's Court Exhibition]1897-the earl 's court exhibition [they]1879-they found [themselves]1879-they finally blocked . In front of [them]1879-they was [an enormous crowd]1898-an enormous crowd ; in the midst of it was an enormous elephant , heaving and shuddering as such shapeless creatures do . But [the President]2547-the president had disappeared .

" Where has [he]93-syme gone to ? "[93-syme] asked [Syme]93-syme , slipping to the ground .

" [Gentleman]3318-gentleman rushed into [the Exhibition]3319-the exhibition , [sir]2203-sir ! "[1900-an official] said [an official]1900-an official in a dazed manner . Then [he]1900-an official added in an injured voice : " [Funny gentleman]3321-funny gentleman , [sir]2203-sir . [He]1900-an official held out with distaste a piece of folded paper , addressed : " To [the Secretary of [the Central Anarchist Council]82-the central anarchist council]3323-the secretary of the central anarchist council . "[1900-an official]

[The Secretary]145-the secretary , raging , rent it open , and found written inside it :

" When the herring runs a mile , Let [the Secretary]670-the secretary smile ; When the herring tries to _ fly _ , Let [the Secretary]670-the secretary die . Rustic Proverb . "[1900-an official]

" Why [the eternal crikey]3326-the eternal crikey , "[670-the secretary] began [the Secretary]670-the secretary , " did [you]145-the secretary let [the man]315-the man in ? Do [people]2223-people commonly come to [your]145-the secretary Exhibition riding on mad elephants ? Do "[670-the secretary]

" Why the blazes should [I]670-the secretary look at a captive balloon ? "[670-the secretary] demanded [the Secretary]670-the secretary . " What is there queer about a captive balloon ? "[670-the secretary]

[They]1904-they all turned [their]1904-they eyes to where the balloon swung and swelled above the Exhibition on a string , like [a child]495-a child 's balloon . A second afterwards the string came in two just under [the car]1564-the car , and the balloon , broken loose , floated away with the freedom of a soap bubble .

" [Ten thousand devils]3329-ten thousand devils ! "[670-the secretary] shrieked [the Secretary]670-the secretary . " [He]670-the secretary 's got into it ! "[670-the secretary] and [he]670-the secretary shook [his]670-the secretary fists at the sky .

The balloon , borne by some chance wind , came right above [them]1904-they , and [they]1904-they could see the great white head of [the President]2547-the president peering over the side and looking benevolently down on [them]1904-they .

" God bless [my]773-the professor soul ! " [Your]93-syme beauty has not left [me]93-syme indifferent . From [LITTLE SNOWDROP]83-little snowdrop . "[93-syme]

CHAPTER XIV . [THE SIX PHILOSOPHERS

Across green fields]1911-the six philosophers across green fields , and breaking through blooming hedges , toiled [six draggled detectives]1912-six draggled detectives , about five miles out of [London]3-london . [The optimist of the party]1762-the optimist of the party had at first proposed that [they]1912-six draggled detectives should follow [the balloon across [South England]84-south england in hansom - cabs]1914-the balloon across south england in hansom - cabs . But [he]1762-the optimist of the party was ultimately convinced of the persistent refusal of [the balloon]1915-the balloon to follow [the roads]1916-the roads , and the still more persistent refusal of [the cabmen]1917-the cabmen to follow [the balloon]1915-the balloon . Consequently [the tireless though exasperated travellers]1919-the tireless though exasperated travellers broke through black thickets and ploughed through [ploughed fields]1920-ploughed fields till each was turned into a figure too outrageous to be mistaken for [a tramp]1921-a tramp . [Those green hills of [Surrey]50-surrey]1922-those green hills of surrey saw the final collapse and tragedy of the admirable light grey suit in which [Syme]93-syme had set out from [Saffron Park]2-saffron park . [His]93-syme silk hat was broken over [his]93-syme nose by a swinging bough , [his]93-syme coat - tails were torn to the shoulder by arresting thorns , the clay of [England]14-england was splashed up to [his]93-syme collar ; but [he]93-syme still carried [his]93-syme yellow beard forward with a silent and furious determination , and [his]93-syme eyes were still fixed on that floating ball of gas , which in the full flush of sunset seemed coloured like a sunset cloud .

" After all , "[93-syme] [he]93-syme said , " it is very beautiful ! "[93-syme]

" [It]1915-the balloon is singularly and strangely beautiful ! "[773-the professor] said [the Professor]773-the professor . " [I]773-the professor wish the beastly gas - bag would burst ! "[773-the professor]

" No , "[135-dr. bull] said [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull , " [I]135-dr. bull hope it wo n't . It might hurt [the old boy]3330-the old boy . "[135-dr. bull]

" Hurt [him]3330-the old boy ! "[1924-the vindictive professor] said [the vindictive Professor]1924-the vindictive professor , " hurt [him]3330-the old boy ! Not as much as [I]1924-the vindictive professor 'd hurt [him]3330-the old boy if [I]1924-the vindictive professor could get up with [him]3330-the old boy . [Little Snowdrop]83-little snowdrop ! "[1924-the vindictive professor]

" [I]135-dr. bull do n't want [him]3330-the old boy hurt , somehow , "[135-dr. bull] said [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull .

" What ! "[670-the secretary] cried [the Secretary]670-the secretary bitterly . " Do [you]135-dr. bull believe all that tale about [his]3330-the old boy being [[our]3331-our man]3332-our man in [the dark room]737-the dark room ? [Sunday]110-sunday would say [he]3330-the old boy was [anybody]2507-anybody . "[670-the secretary]

" [I]135-dr. bull do n't know whether [I]135-dr. bull believe it or not , "[135-dr. bull] said [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull . " But it is n't that that [I]135-dr. bull mean . [I]135-dr. bull ca n't wish [old Sunday]110-sunday 's balloon to burst because "[135-dr. bull]

" Well , "[93-syme] said [Syme]93-syme impatiently , " because ? "[93-syme]

" Well , because [he]3330-the old boy 's so jolly like a balloon [himself]3330-the old boy , "[135-dr. bull] said [Dr. Bull]135-dr. bull desperately . " [I]135-dr. bull do n't understand a word of all that idea of [his]3330-the old boy being the same man who gave [us]3331-our all [our]3331-our blue cards . It seems to make everything nonsense . But [I]135-dr. bull do n't care who knows it , [I]135-dr. bull always had a sympathy for [old Sunday]110-sunday [himself]3330-the old boy , wicked as [he]3330-the old boy was . Just as if [he]3330-the old boy was [a great bouncing baby]3335-a great bouncing baby . How can [I]135-dr. bull explain what [my]135-dr. bull queer sympathy was ? It did n't prevent [my]135-dr. bull fighting [him]3330-the old boy like hell ! Shall [I]135-dr. bull make it clear if [I]135-dr. bull say that [I]135-dr. bull liked [him]3330-the old boy because [he]3330-the old boy was so fat ? "[135-dr. bull]

" [You]135-dr. bull will not , "[670-the secretary] said [the Secretary]670-the secretary .

" [I]135-dr. bull 've got it now , "[135-dr. bull] cried [Bull]135-dr. bull , " it was because [he]3330-the old boy was so fat and so light . Just like a balloon . "[135-dr. bull]

[The six adventurers]1978-the six adventurers had passed through many adventures , but [not one]1979-not one had carried [them]1978-the six adventurers so utterly off [their]1978-the six adventurers feet as this last adventure of comfort . [They]1978-the six adventurers had all become inured to things going roughly ; but things suddenly going smoothly swamped [them]1978-the six adventurers . [They]1978-the six adventurers could not even feebly imagine what [the carriages]1980-the carriages were ; it was enough for [them]1978-the six adventurers to know that [they]1980-the carriages were [carriages]1981-carriages , and carriages with cushions . [They]1978-the six adventurers could not conceive who [the old man]855-the old man was who had led [them]1978-the six adventurers ; but it was quite enough that [he]855-the old man had certainly led [them]1978-the six adventurers to [the carriages]1980-the carriages .

[Syme]93-syme drove through a drifting darkness of trees in utter abandonment . It was typical of [him]93-syme that while [he]93-syme had carried [his]93-syme bearded chin forward fiercely so long as anything could be done , when the whole business was taken out of [his]93-syme hands [he]93-syme fell back on the cushions in a frank collapse .

Very gradually and very vaguely [he]93-syme realised into what rich roads [the carriage]1984-the carriage was carrying [him]93-syme . [He]93-syme saw that [they]1978-the six adventurers passed the stone gates of what might have been [a park]1985-a park , that [they]1978-the six adventurers began gradually to climb a hill which , while wooded on both sides , was somewhat more orderly than [a forest]1986-a forest . Then there began to grow upon [him]93-syme , as upon [a man]240-a man slowly waking from a healthy sleep , a pleasure in everything . [He]93-syme felt that the hedges were what hedges should be , living walls ; that a hedge is like a human army , disciplined , but all the more alive . [He]93-syme saw high elms behind the hedges , and vaguely thought how happy [boys]1988-boys would be climbing there . Then [[his]93-syme carriage]1973-his carriage took a turn of [the path]1864-the path , and [he]93-syme saw suddenly and quietly , like a long , low , sunset cloud , [a long , low house]1991-a long , low house , mellow in the mild light of sunset . [All the six friends]1992-all the six friends compared notes afterwards and quarrelled ; but [they]1992-all the six friends all agreed that in some unaccountable way [the place]214-the place reminded [them]1992-all the six friends of [[their]1992-all the six friends boyhood]1994-their boyhood . It was either this elm - top or that crooked path , it was either this scrap of orchard or that shape of a window ; but [each man of [them]1992-all the six friends]1995-each man of them declared that [he]1995-each man of them could remember [this place]2285-this place before [he]1995-each man of them could remember [[his]1995-each man of them mother]421-his mother .
